keyvalues.desc: The tank must have the player as a target for this amount of time before it's allowed to fire.

keyvalues.name: Automatically search for NPCs
keyvalues.desc: If controllable by NPCs, sets whether we should automatically search for NPCs to use this func_tank or just wait for the player to set it. Identical to StartFindingNPCs and StopFindingNPCs.

keyvalues.name: Effect Handling
keyvalues.desc: Special effect handling that influences sound and muzzle effects. Individual settings can override parts of it.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn the tank on

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the tank off (go dormant)

inputs.name: SetFireRate
inputs.desc: How fast to fire (0 = don't fire)

inputs.name: SetDamage
inputs.desc: Set the Damage Per Bullet

inputs.name: SetTargetPosition
inputs.desc: World position that I should aim at

inputs.name: SetTargetDir
inputs.desc: Direction to aim at.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntityName
inputs.desc: Name of entity I should follow/attack

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Set the entity I should follow/attack to the passed in entity.

inputs.name: ClearTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Clear the entity I should be attacking.

inputs.name: FindNPCToManTank
inputs.desc: Find a nearby NPC to man this func_tank.

inputs.name: StartFindingNPCs
inputs.desc: Start searching for NPCs to man this func_tank.

inputs.name: StopFindingNPCs
inputs.desc: Stop searching for NPCs to man this func_tank.

inputs.name: ForceNPCOff
inputs.desc: Force the NPC manning this func_tank (if any) to leave.

inputs.name: SetMaxRange
inputs.desc: Set the max range of the func_tank.

outputs.name: OnFire
outputs.desc: Fires when the tank fires its bullets

outputs.name: OnAquireTarget
outputs.desc: Fires when target is newly in range and can be shot

outputs.name: OnLoseTarget
outputs.desc: Fires when when target goes out of range

outputs.name: OnAmmoDepleted
outputs.desc: Fires when tank runs out of ammo

outputs.name: OnGotController
outputs.desc: Fires when an NPC starts to control this tank. Players do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnLostController
outputs.desc: Fires when the NPC controller of the tank stops controlling it. Players do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnGotPlayerController
outputs.desc: Fires when a Player starts to control this tank. NPCs do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnLostPlayerController
outputs.desc: Fires when the Player controller of the tank stops controlling it. NPCs do NOT fire this input.

outputs.name: OnReadyToFire
outputs.desc: Fires once when the tank is done waiting to fire between rounds

keyvalues.name: Gib Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction the gibs will fly.

keyvalues.name: Number of Gibs
keyvalues.desc: Total number of gibs to shoot each time it's activated.

keyvalues.name: Delay between shots
keyvalues.desc: Delay (in seconds) between shooting each gib. If 0, all gibs shoot at once.

keyvalues.name: Gib Angles (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The orientation of the spawned gibs.

keyvalues.name: Max angular velocity
keyvalues.desc: How fast (degrees/sec) the gib pieces should spin. They will spin on x and y axis at between 10% and 100% of this speed.

keyvalues.name: Gib Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Speed of the fired gibs.

keyvalues.name: Course Variance
keyvalues.desc: How much variance in the direction gibs are fired.

keyvalues.name: Gib Life
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for gibs to live +/- 5%.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from for all gibs spawned by this shooter, instead of their own origins.

inputs.name: Shoot
inputs.desc: Force the gibshooter to create and shoot a gib.

inputs.name: SetTeam
inputs.desc: Changes the entity's team.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Damage
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'.

keyvalues.name: Explosion Radius
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'.

keyvalues.name: Explode Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage.

keyvalues.name: Performance Mode
keyvalues.desc: Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons.

keyvalues.name: Pressure Delay
keyvalues.desc: Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart).

keyvalues.name: Minimum Damage to Hurt
keyvalues.desc: The entity will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking. 0 means don't break.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Breaks the breakable.

inputs.name: SetHealth
inputs.desc: Sets a new value for the breakable's health. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: AddHealth
inputs.desc: Adds health to the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: RemoveHealth
inputs.desc: Removes health from the breakable. If the breakable's health reaches zero it will break.

inputs.name: EnablePhyscannonPickup
inputs.desc: Makes the breakable able to picked up by the physcannon.

inputs.name: DisablePhyscannonPickup
inputs.desc: Makes the breakable not able to picked up by the physcannon.

inputs.name: SetMass
inputs.desc: Set mass of this object.

outputs.name: OnBreak
outputs.desc: Fired when this breakable breaks.

outputs.name: OnTakeDamage
outputs.desc: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

outputs.name: OnHealthChanged
outputs.desc: Fired when the health of this breakable changes, passing the new value of health as a percentage of max health, from [0..1].

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonDetach
outputs.desc: Fired when the physcannon has ripped this breakable off of the wall. Only fired if ACT_PHYSCANNON_DETACH is defined in the model this breakable is using.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePreStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the Pre physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_PRE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePullStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre pull anim, this will be fired after the Pre anim has finished playing.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonPullAnimFinished
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop has finished playing the physcannon-pull activity, caused by the player trying to grab this prop with the physcannon. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE activity is defined in the model this breakable is using. If the prop has Pre & Post pull anims, this will be fired after the Post anim has finished playing.

outputs.name: OnPhysCannonAnimatePostStarted
outputs.desc: Fired when this prop starts playing the Post physcannon-pull activity. Only fired if the ACT_PHYSCANNON_ANIMATE_POST activity is defined in the model this breakable is using.

keyvalues.name: Effect Flags
keyvalues.desc: For configuring visual effects. If you want to combine effects, turn SmartEdit off and add the effect numbers together, i.e. 64 + 8 = 72.

keyvalues.name: Collisions
keyvalues.desc: Method of collision for this entity. Can be changed at runtime with AddOutput.

keyvalues.name: Bodygroup
keyvalues.desc: Body Groups allow turning on and off parts of a model, so sections can be shown or hidden dynamically.

keyvalues.name: (Set) Body Group
keyvalues.desc: Identical to Body Group (body), ask Valve why this is duplicated. Body Groups allow turning on and off parts of a model, so sections can be shown or hidden dynamically.

keyvalues.name: Texture Frame
keyvalues.desc: The frame number for any animated textures on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Hitbox Set
keyvalues.desc: Sets the $hboxset to use for collision testing.

keyvalues.name: Model Scale
keyvalues.desc: A multiplier for the size of the model.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select any entity (not info_lighting!) from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin Offset
keyvalues.desc: The info_lighting_relative from which to sample lighting instead of the entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Distance/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Cast Distance
keyvalues.desc: Sets how far the entity casts dynamic shadows, in units. 0 means default distance from the shadow_control entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevent the entity from creating cheap render-to-texture/dynamic shadows.

keyvalues.name: Disable Receiving Shadows?
keyvalues.desc: Prevents dynamic shadows (e.g. player and prop shadows) from appearing on this entity.

keyvalues.name: Disable ShadowDepth
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable rendering into shadow depth (for flashlight) for this entity.

keyvalues.name: Projected Texture Cache
keyvalues.desc: Used to hint projected texture system whether it is sufficient to cache shadow volume of this entity or to force render it every frame instead.

keyvalues.name: Disable flashlight
keyvalues.desc: Used to disable flashlight (env_projectedtexture) lighting and shadows on this entity.

inputs.name: Skin
inputs.desc: Changes the model skin to the specified number.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Change the model's bodygroup to the specified index number.

inputs.name: Ignite
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire indefinitely.

inputs.name: IgniteLifetime
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire for a given amount of time.

inputs.name: IgniteNumHitboxFires
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given number of hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: IgniteHitboxFireScale
inputs.desc: Makes the entity catch on fire with a given scale for hitbox fire particles.

inputs.name: BecomeRagdoll
inputs.desc: Kills the entity and creates a client-side ragdoll from the model with ZERO force (just go limp). Input is only passed if the model contains ragdolling, for other models phys_convert can be used instead. OnDeath, OnHalfHealth, etc. outputs will **NOT** BE FIRED.

inputs.name: SetLightingOrigin
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as the entity's lighting origin. Any entity can be used.

inputs.name: SetLightingOriginHack
inputs.desc: Offsets the entity's lighting origin by their distance from an info_lighting_relative.

inputs.name: fademindist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity starts fading. If <0, the entity will disappear instantly when end fade is hit. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: fademaxdist
inputs.desc: Sets distance at which the entity ends fading. If <0, the entity won't disappear at all. The value will scale appropriately if the entity is in a 3D Skybox.

inputs.name: DisableShadow
inputs.desc: Allows the entity to draw a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: EnableShadow
inputs.desc: Prevents the entity from drawing a render target (dynamic) shadow.

inputs.name: DisableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object will not recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: EnableReceivingFlashlight
inputs.desc: This object may recieve light or shadows from projected textures (flashlights).

inputs.name: AlternativeSorting
inputs.desc: Used to attempt to fix sorting problems when rendering. True activates, false deactivates

inputs.name: SetModelScale
inputs.desc: Sets the scale of the model. Secondary parameter (space delimited) sets the duration of time to scale the model.

outputs.name: OnIgnite
outputs.desc: Fired when this object catches fire.

keyvalues.name: Render in Fast Reflections
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, causes this entity/prop to to render in fast water reflections (i.e. when a water material specifies $reflectonlymarkedentities) and in the world impostor pass.

inputs.name: DisableDrawInFastReflection
inputs.desc: Turns off rendering of this entity in reflections when using $reflectonlymarkedentities in water material.

inputs.name: EnableDrawInFastReflection
inputs.desc: Turn on rendering of this entity in reflections when using $reflectonlymarkedentities in water material.

desc: The base for all the different projectors (wall & tractor beam).

keyvalues.name: Start Enabled
keyvalues.desc: If the projector should start enabled.

keyvalues.name: Disable Placement Helper
keyvalues.desc: Disable the automatically created placement helper to prevent it from fighting with a custom one.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables projection from this projector. This also updates the position of the bridge/funnel if the model was parented.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables projection from this projector.

inputs.name: SetParent
inputs.desc: Sets the parent for the projector. This will only move the model properly, retrigger the enable input to correct the bridge/funnel position.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachment
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

inputs.name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
inputs.desc: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

inputs.name: ClearParent
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

keyvalues.name: Start Activated
keyvalues.desc: An inactive portal will not be drawn and will not teleport entities.

keyvalues.name: Portal Number
keyvalues.desc: Which of the pair is this portal?

outputs.name: OnPlacedSuccessfully
outputs.desc: When a portal is placed without failure, this output is fired.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

keyvalues.name: Next Rope
keyvalues.desc: Name of the next rope along this path.

keyvalues.name: Slack
keyvalues.desc: How much extra length the rope has (by default it has the length between its two endpoints in the editor).

keyvalues.name: Subdivision
keyvalues.desc: Number of subdivisions between each rope segment. Maximum value is 8. Higher values make smoother ropes, but are slower to render.

keyvalues.name: Barbed
keyvalues.desc: Test effect that makes the rope look sharper and more barbed.

keyvalues.name: Width (1-64)
keyvalues.desc: Width of the rope.

keyvalues.name: Texture Scale
keyvalues.desc: This changes the texture resolution. The default resolution is 4 pixels per unit. Larger values stretch the texture and smaller values scrunch it up.

keyvalues.name: Start Dangling
keyvalues.desc: When set to Yes, the rope starts out detached from its target endpoint.

keyvalues.name: Breakable
keyvalues.desc: When set to yes, the rope can be detached from either endpoint when shot.

keyvalues.name: Rope Material
keyvalues.desc: The material to use when rendering the rope.

keyvalues.name: Wind
keyvalues.desc: Is the rope affected by wind?

keyvalues.name: Position Interpolator
keyvalues.desc: Curve Type. Currently only Rope is fully supported.

inputs.name: SetScrollSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed at which the texture scrolls.

inputs.name: SetForce
inputs.desc: Apply a force instantaneously to the rope. The parameter should be a vector containing the force to be applied (X Y Z).

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Break the rope, if it's marked to do so.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

keyvalues.name: Global Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name by which this entity is linked to another entity in a different map. When the player transitions to a new map, entities in the new map with globalnames matching entities in the previous map will have the previous map's state copied over their state.

keyvalues.name: Entity Scripts
keyvalues.desc: Name(s) of script files that are executed after all entities have spawned.

keyvalues.name: Script think function
keyvalues.desc: Name of a function in this entity's script scope which will be called automatically.

keyvalues.name: Init Code
keyvalues.desc: This code will be executed after the Entity Scripts option. Backtick ( ` ) characters will be converted to quotes in-game for strings.

keyvalues.name: Init Code 2
keyvalues.desc: This code will be the second line executed after the Entity Scripts option. Backtick ( ` ) characters will be converted to quotes in-game for strings. Additional Init Code keyvalues can be added with SmartEdit off.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world.

inputs.name: KillHierarchy
inputs.desc: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

inputs.name: AddOutput
inputs.desc:
Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity or changes keyvalues dynamically. Format:
'<output name> <targetname>:<inputname>:<parameter>:<delay>:<max times to fire (-1 == infinite, 1 = only once)>'
or 'keyvalue newval'. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: FireUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

inputs.name: FireUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

inputs.name: Use
inputs.desc: More or less replicates the player interacting with an entity. (+USE)

inputs.name: RunScriptFile
inputs.desc: Execute a game script file from disk.

inputs.name: RunScriptCode
inputs.desc: Execute a string of script source code. Backtick ( ` ) characters will be converted to quotes in-game for strings.

inputs.name: CallScriptFunction
inputs.desc: Execute the given function name.

inputs.name: CancelPending
inputs.desc: Cancels any events fired by this entity that are currently pending in the I/O event queue.

inputs.name: PassUser1
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser1 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser2
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser2 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser3
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser3 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: PassUser4
inputs.desc: Causes this entity's OutUser4 output to be fired, passing along the parameter unchanged.

inputs.name: FireRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OnUser1, OnUser2, OnUser3, or OnUser4 with a 25% chance of each.

inputs.name: PassRandomUser
inputs.desc: Fires OutUser1, OutUser2, OutUser3, or OutUser4 with a 25% chance of each. The parameter is passed along unchanged.

inputs.name: KillIfNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity if it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: KillWhenNotVisible
inputs.desc: Removes this entity when it is not in the player's viewcone.

inputs.name: FireOutput
inputs.desc: Fires the named output on this entity. Format: '<output name>:<activator>:<caller>:<parameter>:<delay>' (OnDeath:hl3cardgame:gaben). Everything beyond the output name is optional.

inputs.name: RemoveOutput
inputs.desc: Removes all instances of the named output on this entity. Wildcards are supported, meaning you could just pass '*' to wipe all outputs from this entity.

inputs.name: AcceptInput
inputs.desc: Fires the named input on this entity. Format: '<input name>:<parameter>:<activator>:<caller>:<output ID>' (SetTarget:cheese). Everything beyond the input name is optional. Mind the fact this is arranged differently from FireOutput, having the parameter right after the input name.

inputs.name: AddSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Adds spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: RemoveSpawnFlags
inputs.desc: Removes spawnflag(s) to this entity. Many spawnflags have their respective numbers suffixed in this FGD.

inputs.name: AddSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Adds solid flags to this entity.

inputs.name: RemoveSolidFlags
inputs.desc: Removes solid flags from this entity.

inputs.name: ChangeVariable
inputs.desc: Similar to AddOutput, except it changes an internal variable similar to logic_datadesc_accessor instead. Very dangerous, use with care.

inputs.name: SetEntityName
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's name that other entities should refer to it by.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's target. This is specific to certain entities, particularly logic entities that involve a target.

inputs.name: SetOwnerEntity
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's owner entity. This has nothing to do with parenting and has more to do with collision and kill credits.

inputs.name: SetThinkNull
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's general think function to null. Behavior varies from entity to entity..

outputs.name: OnUser1
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

outputs.name: OnUser2
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

outputs.name: OnUser3
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

outputs.name: OnUser4
outputs.desc: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

outputs.name: OutUser1
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser1 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser2
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser2 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser3
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser3 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

outputs.name: OutUser4
outputs.desc: Fires in response to PassUser4 input, with the parameter passed through unchanged.

keyvalues.name: Press Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when pressed. Choose from sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the player tries to use the button, and fails because it's locked. These are sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the button is unlocked. These are sounds in the Buttons.snd* category.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the player tries to use the button, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sentence
keyvalues.desc: A sentence played when the button is unlocked.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the button, preventing it from functioning.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the button, allowing it to function.

inputs.name: Press
inputs.desc: Activate the button as if it was pressed.

inputs.name: PressIn
inputs.desc: Activate the button as if it was pressed, sending it to the bottom position.

inputs.name: PressOut
inputs.desc: Unpress the button, sending it to the top position.

outputs.name: OnDamaged
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is damaged.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is pressed.

outputs.name: OnUseLocked
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is used while locked.

outputs.name: OnIn
outputs.desc: Fired when the button reaches the in/pressed position.

outputs.name: OnOut
outputs.desc: Fired when the button reaches the out/released position.

desc: An entity that can be linked to another door and create a passage between them dynamically.

inputs.name: SetPartner
inputs.desc: Set a new partner door.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door and cause the portal to activate.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door and cause the portal to deactivate.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its open animation.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its close animation.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

desc: Behaviour only applicable to visible NPCs.

keyvalues.name: Target Path Corner
keyvalues.desc: If set, the name of a path corner entity that this NPC will walk to, after spawning.

keyvalues.name: Expression Override
keyvalues.desc: Enter a VCD file to override facial expressions on this NPC.

keyvalues.name: Don't Use Speech Semaphore?
keyvalues.desc: Friendly NPCs are not allowed to speak if another friendly NPC is speaking. In some cases we don't want speaking NPCs to prevent other NPCs from speaking (for instance, if there is a friendly NPC speaking for a long time on a monitor). To make this NPC not prevent other NPCs from talking, make it not grab the semaphore when it speaks.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: HACK: Sets this NPC's body group (from 0 - n). You'd better know what you are doing!

inputs.name: SetExpressionOverride
inputs.desc: Set a VCD file to override facial expressions on this NPC.

keyvalues.name: Ball count
keyvalues.desc: This is how many balls will be bouncing around inside the spawner

keyvalues.name: Min ball speed
keyvalues.desc: The minimum speed of balls that fly in the spawner

keyvalues.name: Max ball speed
keyvalues.desc: The maximum speed of balls that fly in the spawner

keyvalues.name: Ball radius
keyvalues.desc: The radius of the energy balls.

keyvalues.name: Ball Respawn Time
keyvalues.desc: The energy balls respawn time

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable spawning of combine balls

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable spawning of combine balls

outputs.name: OnBallGrabbed
outputs.desc: Fired when a combine ball is grabbed from the field by a mega physcannon

outputs.name: OnBallReinserted
outputs.desc: Fired when a combine ball is reinserted into the field (only gets triggered when Combine Power supply is checked)

outputs.name: OnBallHitTopSide
outputs.desc: Fired when a combine ball in hits the top side of the field (only gets triggered when Combine Power supply is checked)

outputs.name: OnBallHitBottomSide
outputs.desc: Fired when a combine ball in hits the bottom side of the field (only gets triggered when Combine Power supply is checked)

outputs.name: OnLastBallGrabbed
outputs.desc: Fired when the last combine ball is grabbed from the field by a mega physcannon

outputs.name: OnFirstBallReinserted
outputs.desc: Fired when the first combine ball is reinserted into the field (only gets triggered when Combine Power supply is checked)

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

outputs.name: OnTakeDamage
outputs.desc: Fired each time this breakable takes any damage.

desc: This is the definition of the 'beam' class, but we don't want that in the entity list.

keyvalues.name: Render Mode
keyvalues.desc: Render mode is forced to Texture, but set to Color in Hammer to ensure correct rendering.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Amount of noise (0-64)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of noise in the beam. 0 is a perfectly straight beam.

keyvalues.name: Frames per 10 seconds
keyvalues.desc: Framerate at which the beam texture should animate, if it has multiple frames.

keyvalues.name: Starting Frame
keyvalues.desc: The frame to start the beam texture on.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Name
keyvalues.desc: The material used to draw the beam.

keyvalues.name: Texture Scroll Rate (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Rate at which the beam texture should scroll along the beam.

keyvalues.name: Damage / second
keyvalues.desc: How much damage this beam does per second to things while active. For continuous damage, the value should be greater than 10 or it may not work.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turns the beam on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turns the beam off.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the beam between on and off.

inputs.name: Noise
inputs.desc: Set the noise of the beam, in pixels.

inputs.name: Width
inputs.desc: Set the width of the beam, in pixels.

inputs.name: ScrollSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the scroll speed in units per second (0 - 100).

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.desc: Sets the beam's alpha (0 - 255).

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Sets the beam's render color (R G B).

inputs.name: ColorRedValue
inputs.desc: Sets the red color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorGreenValue
inputs.desc: Sets the green color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: ColorBlueValue
inputs.desc: Sets the blue color channel's value (0 - 255).

desc: The base for the various floor buttons - weighted, cube, sphere and Antique weighted.

keyvalues.name: Suppress Animation Sounds
keyvalues.desc: Prevent the model from playing any sounds.

keyvalues.name: Collisions
keyvalues.desc: Determine if the button should be solid or not.

inputs.name: PressIn
inputs.desc: Activate the button as if it was pressed, sending it to the bottom position.

inputs.name: PressOut
inputs.desc: Release the button, sending it to the top position.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Called when the button has been pressed.

outputs.name: OnUnPressed
outputs.desc: Called when the button has been released.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist).

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out).

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under low end/medium end, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

keyvalues.name: Entity 1 (Yellow)
keyvalues.desc: The first entity to constrain. If blank the second entity will be constrained to the World.

keyvalues.name: Entity 2 (Blue)
keyvalues.desc: The second entity to constrain. If blank the first entity will be constrained to the World.

keyvalues.name: Constraint System Manager
keyvalues.desc: The name of a phys_constraintsystem that this constraint should be a part of. All constraints on a set of entities should be placed in the same system, or they will fight each other during simulation.

keyvalues.name: Force Limit to Break (lbs)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of force an impact must apply to the constraint to break it. A way of calculating this is to set it to the mass of an object that would break this constraint if it were resting on the constrainted objects.

keyvalues.name: Torque Limit to Break (lbs * distance)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of torque required to break the constraint. A way of calculating this is to multiply any reference mass by the resting distance (from the center of mass of the object) needed to break the constraint.

keyvalues.name: Play Sound on Break
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the constraint is broken.

keyvalues.name: Follow teleport distance
keyvalues.desc: If one object teleports more than this many units away it will cause the other constrained object to teleport to an appropriate relative position.

inputs.name: Break
inputs.desc: Force the constraint to break.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable the constraint.  Do this when the objects don't exist when the constraint spawns - or when you have deactivated the constraint.  Broken constraints can NOT be turned on.  They have been deleted.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable this constraint.

outputs.name: OnBreak
outputs.desc: Fired when the constraint breaks.

keyvalues.name: Hint Activity
keyvalues.desc: Activity associated with this hint node. Various parts of the NPC AI play this activity at times. i.e. Actbusy nodes will play this activity when an NPC acts busy on the node.

keyvalues.name: Node FOV
keyvalues.desc: Imagine this node requires that an NPC be in the node's field of view in order to use this hint.

keyvalues.name: Hint Group
keyvalues.desc: If specified, gives the hint a specific group name.  Useful for hint nodes that need to be logically grouped together. NPCs may also refuse to use hint nodes that don't match their hint group.

keyvalues.name: Target node
keyvalues.desc: The node ID of an associated target node, if any.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Facing
keyvalues.desc: Don't pay attention to the facing of the node. May not apply to a given hint type.

keyvalues.name: Minimum State
keyvalues.desc: Require an NPC have a minimum state to use the hint.

keyvalues.name: Maximum State
keyvalues.desc: Require an NPC have a maximum state to use the hint.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: How close an NPC must be to consider this hint. 0 means infinite.

inputs.name: EnableHint
inputs.desc: Enable hint.

inputs.name: DisableHint
inputs.desc: Disable hint.

keyvalues.name: Spawn path_track
keyvalues.desc: The name of the first path_track in the train's path. The train will spawn at this path_track. It will also turn to face direction indicated by the 'Orientation Type' setting.

keyvalues.name: Max Speed (units / second)
keyvalues.desc: The maximum speed that this train can move. Any speeds applied to this train, such as by path_tracks or SetSpeed inputs, will be clipped to this maximum value.

keyvalues.name: Initial Speed (units / second)
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the train will move at after it spawns, 0 = stopped.

keyvalues.name: Change Velocity
keyvalues.desc: The method through which this train changes its velocity as it moves along the path.

keyvalues.name: Change Orientation
keyvalues.desc: The method through which this train changes its orientation as it moves along the path.

keyvalues.name: Distance Between the Wheels
keyvalues.desc: Used for turning and stopping.

keyvalues.name: Height above track
keyvalues.desc: The height above the track that this train moves.

keyvalues.name: Damage on Crush
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage this train does to entities that block it.

keyvalues.name: Move Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound that is played (and looped) while the train is moving.

keyvalues.name: Move Ping Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound that is played more frequently as the train speeds up.

keyvalues.name: Start Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the train starts moving.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: A sound played when the train stops moving.

keyvalues.name: Min pitch (1-255, > 100 = higher)
keyvalues.desc: The sound pitch value that the train will approach as it comes to a stop.

keyvalues.name: Max pitch (1-255, > 100 = higher)
keyvalues.desc: The sound pitch value that the train will approach as it approaches its max speed  or 1000 units/second if the 'Use max speed for pitch shifting move sound' flag is not set.

keyvalues.name: Min move sound interval
keyvalues.desc: Minimum interval at which to play the move ping sound.

keyvalues.name: Max move sound interval
keyvalues.desc: Maximum interval at which to play the move ping sound.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train, as a ratio of max speed [0, 1]

inputs.name: SetSpeedDir
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train, as a ratio of max speed. Negative values reverse the direction [-1, 1]

inputs.name: SetSpeedReal
inputs.desc: Set the speed of the train. Must be a positive value from 0 to max speed.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop the train.

inputs.name: StartForward
inputs.desc: Start the train moving forward.

inputs.name: StartBackward
inputs.desc: Start the train moving backward.

inputs.name: Resume
inputs.desc: Resume the train moving in the current direction after it was stopped via the 'Stop' or 'Toggle' input.

inputs.name: Reverse
inputs.desc: Reverse the direction of the train.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the train between start and stop.

keyvalues.name: 50 percent falloff distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which brightness should fall off to 50%. If set, overrides linear constant and quadratic parameters.

keyvalues.name: 0 percent falloff distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which brightness should fall off to negligible (1/256)%. Must set _fifty_percent_distance to use.

keyvalues.name: Hard Falloff
keyvalues.desc: If set, causes lights to fall to exactly zero beyond the zero percent distance. May cause unrealistic lighting if not used carefully.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance that light is allowed to cast.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTouch
outputs.desc: Fires when the player touches this object.

outputs.name: OnCacheInteraction
outputs.desc: This output fires when the player proves they have 'found' this item. Fires on: Player Touch (whether or not player actually acquires the item), Picked up by +USE, Picked up by Physcannon, Punted by Physcannon.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fires when the player +uses this weapon.

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Fires when the player picks up this weapon.

outputs.name: OnNPCPickup
outputs.desc: Fires when an NPC picks up this weapon.

outputs.name: OnCacheInteraction
outputs.desc: Fires when the player 'proves' they've found this weapon. Fires on: Player Touch, +USE pickup, Physcannon pickup, Physcannon punt.

keyvalues.name: Render Mode
keyvalues.desc: Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'.* Color & Texture = src*a+dest*(1-a)* Glow = src*a + dest, fixed on screen for sprites* Solid = Performs alphatest transparency* Additive = src*a + dest* Additive FF = blend between sprite nimation frames* Alpha Add = src + dest*(1-a)* World Space Glow = src*a + dest

keyvalues.name: FX Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: A color to mix with the model/sprite.

keyvalues.name: FX Alpha (0 - 255)
keyvalues.desc: Transparency amount, requires a Render Mode other than Normal. 0 is invisible, 255 is fully visible.

keyvalues.name: Render FX
keyvalues.desc: Various somewhat legacy alpha effects. Material Proxies are more modern.

keyvalues.name: View ID nodraw
keyvalues.desc: This keyvalue can control whether an entity should only draw on things like monitors or mirrors, or the opposite. The code for this is { m_iViewHideFlags & (1 << CurrentViewID()) } and supports any combination of view IDs.

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.desc: Set the entity's alpha (0 - 255).

inputs.name: Color
inputs.desc: Set the entity's color (R G B).

inputs.name: SetRenderMode
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's render mode.

inputs.name: SetRenderFX
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's render FX.

inputs.name: SetViewHideFlags
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's view ID nodraw flags (takes raw flag combination).

inputs.name: AddEffects
inputs.desc: Adds an entity effect.

inputs.name: RemoveEffects
inputs.desc: Removes an entity effect.

inputs.name: EnableDraw
inputs.desc: Draws an entity if it is not drawn. Equivalent to RemoveEffects > 32.

inputs.name: DisableDraw
inputs.desc: Undraws an entity if it is drawn. Equivalent to AddEffects > 32.

inputs.name: AddEFlags
inputs.desc: Adds an entity flag. NOTE: Entity flags are not the spawn flags you see in Hammer. Use AddSpawnFlags to add spawnflags.

inputs.name: RemoveEFlags
inputs.desc: Removes an entity flag. NOTE: Entity flags are not the spawn flags you see in Hammer. Use RemoveSpawnFlags to remove spawnflags.

inputs.name: SetCollisionGroup
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's collision group.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: The model to use for this entity.

keyvalues.name: Actor(s) to affect
keyvalues.desc: NPC's that should act busy

keyvalues.name: Search Type
keyvalues.desc: How to search for the entities using the targetname.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Begin acting busy

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Cease acting busy

inputs.name: SetBusySearchRange
inputs.desc: Update the busy search range for all actors.

inputs.name: ForceNPCToActBusy
inputs.desc: Force an NPC to act busy. Takes parameters, separated by spaces: <Targetname> <hint node targetname> <optional:teleport> <optional:$customactivityorsequence> <maximum time to actbusy>. If no hint node targetname is specified, it'll search for a random one. If no max time is specified, it'll use the default. Specifying 0 as the max time will make the NPC act busy until disturbed. If the optional teleport parameter is specified, the NPC will teleport to the act busy point. A custom move animation can be specified by prepending $ to the name of it. i.e. $ACT_RUN will make the NPC Run. Sequence names can be used instead of activities.

inputs.name: ForceThisNPCToActBusy
inputs.desc: Force an NPC outputted from another entity to act busy. (only usable from an output that specifies an entity)

inputs.name: ForceThisNPCToLeave
inputs.desc: Force an NPC outputted from another entity to find a HINT_NPC_EXIT_POINT hintnode and vanish.

outputs.name: OnNPCStartedBusy
outputs.desc: Fired when an NPC targeted by this goal starts an ActBusy animation.

outputs.name: OnNPCFinishedBusy
outputs.desc: Fired when an NPC targeted by this goal finishes an ActBusy.

outputs.name: OnNPCLeft
outputs.desc: Fired when an NPC target by this goal finishes a forced Leave.

desc: For prop_physics-like entities.

keyvalues.name: Min Damage to Hurt
keyvalues.desc: The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Cast Distance
keyvalues.desc: Use this to override how far this object casts shadows. 0 = default distance.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc:
Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.
Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.

keyvalues.name: Damaging it Doesn't Push It
keyvalues.desc: Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move.

keyvalues.name: Scale Factor For Inertia
keyvalues.desc: Scales the angular mass of an object. Used to hack angular damage and collision response.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

keyvalues.name: Override Parameters
keyvalues.desc: A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.

keyvalues.name: Health Level to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Force to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value on the physbox will enable motion.

inputs.name: Wake
inputs.desc: Wake up this physics object, if it is sleeping.

inputs.name: Sleep
inputs.desc: Put this physics object to sleep. It will wake if given the Wake input, or if force is applied to it. Note that physics objects go to sleep automatically after coming to rest for a while, so you don't really need to use this.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Enable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Disable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableFloating
inputs.desc: Disable fluid/floating simulation to reduce cost.

inputs.name: SetBodyGroup
inputs.desc: Set this prop's body group (from 0 - n).

inputs.name: physdamagescale
inputs.desc: Set the Physics Impact Damage Scale for this character. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.

inputs.name: EnableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity applies physics forces to it.

inputs.name: DisableDamageForces
inputs.desc: Damaging the entity does *not* apply physics forces to it.

inputs.name: EnablePuntSound
inputs.desc: Allow this prop to play its own sound when punted.

inputs.name: DisablePuntSound
inputs.desc: Prevent this prop from playing its own sound when punted.

outputs.name: OnMotionEnabled
outputs.desc: Fired when motion is enabled on this prop, either via 'Health Level to Override Motion' or from the EnableMotion input.

outputs.name: OnAwakened
outputs.desc: Fired when this entity becomes awake (collision/force is applied to it while it's asleep).

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when the player picks up the prop with the physcannon or +USE.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPunt
outputs.desc: Fired when a player punts this object with the physgun.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunOnlyPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when a player picks this object up WITH THE PHYSGUN. +USE pickups do not fire this output.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunDrop
outputs.desc: Fired when the player drops the prop with the physcannon or USE.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player tries to +USE the prop. This output will fire only if the Generate output on +USE spawnflag is set.

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the player picks up this prop (with the physcannon or with +USE).

outputs.name: OnOutOfWorld
outputs.desc: Fired whenever the prop is out of the allowed world bounds.

desc: Adds an Indicator Name option to toggle overlays.

keyvalues.name: Indicator Name
keyvalues.desc: Set to the name of a set of info_overlays to toggle when this is activated and deactivated. The name may also point to a prop_indicator_panel, which will also be toggled appropriately.

inputs.name: SetTextureIndex
inputs.desc: Manually change the index of the overlays. prop_indicator_panels must not be used.

desc: Targetnames only used in compilation.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity only exists during compilation, so the name is only usable in limited situations.

keyvalues.name: Response Contexts
keyvalues.desc: Response system context(s) for this entity. Format should be: 'key:value,key2:value2,etc'. When this entity speaks, the list of keys & values will be passed to the response rules system.

inputs.name: AddContext
inputs.desc: Adds a context to this entity's list of response contexts. The format should be 'key:value'.

inputs.name: RemoveContext
inputs.desc: Remove a context from this entity's list of response contexts. The name should match the 'key' of a previously added context.

inputs.name: ClearContext
inputs.desc: Removes all contexts in this entity's list of response contexts.

inputs.name: DisableSpotlight
inputs.desc: Disable the spotlight.

inputs.name: InspectTargetPhoto
inputs.desc: Tells the scanner to photograph the given entity, named by classname or by target name. !activator or !player works here also.

inputs.name: InspectTargetSpotlight
inputs.desc: Tells the scanner to spotlight the given entity, named by classname or by target name. !activator or !player works here also.

inputs.name: InputSetFlightSpeed
inputs.desc: Sets the flight speed of the scanner

inputs.name: InputShouldInspect
inputs.desc: Set whether should inspect or not

inputs.name: SetFollowTarget
inputs.desc: Set target to follow until told otherwise

inputs.name: ClearFollowTarget
inputs.desc: Stop following our target

inputs.name: SetDistanceOverride
inputs.desc: Override the distance the scanner will attempt to keep between inspection targets and itself

outputs.name: OnPhotographPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired any time the scanner takes a picture of the player.

outputs.name: OnPhotographNPC
outputs.desc: Fired any time the scanner takes a picture of an NPC.

keyvalues.name: Always transition
keyvalues.desc: If yes, this NPC will always teleport to a Player Squad Transition Point if they're not within the trigger_transition volume.

keyvalues.name: Prevent picking up weapons?
keyvalues.desc: If yes, this NPC will NOT be allowed to pick up weapons they find on the ground.

keyvalues.name: Is this a vital ally?
keyvalues.desc: If yes, this NPC will cause the game to end if killed.

inputs.name: OutsideTransition
inputs.desc: Use this input to teleport the NPC to a hintnode with the Player Squad Transition Point hint type.

inputs.name: EnableAlwaysTransition
inputs.desc: Enable the 'always transition' behavior

inputs.name: DisableAlwaysTransition
inputs.desc: Disable the 'always transition' behavior

inputs.name: EnableSpeakWhileScripting
inputs.desc: Allow this NPC to speak responses while in a scripted sequence or while StartScripting is active.

inputs.name: DisableSpeakWhileScripting
inputs.desc: Cancels this NPC's ability to speak responses while in a scripted sequence or while StartScripting is active if it was previously enabled by EnableSpeakWhileScripting.

inputs.name: MakeGameEndAlly
inputs.desc: Make this NPC a game end ally.

inputs.name: MakeRegularAlly
inputs.desc: Make this NPC a regular ally.

inputs.name: EnableWeaponPickup
inputs.desc: Enable Weapon Pickup

inputs.name: DisableWeaponPickup
inputs.desc: Disable Weapon Pickup

inputs.name: GiveWeapon
inputs.desc: Gives the NPC a weapon of the specified entity name.

inputs.name: SetReadinessPanic
inputs.desc: Set readiness to panic state (Special)

inputs.name: SetReadinessLow
inputs.desc: Set readiness to calmest state (Bored)

inputs.name: SetReadinessMedium
inputs.desc: Set readiness to moderate (Alert)

inputs.name: SetReadinessHigh
inputs.desc: Set readiness to highest. (Combat imminent)

inputs.name: LockReadiness
inputs.desc: Lock readiness at current setting for x seconds -1 = forever, 0 = unlock now

inputs.name: ClearAllOutputs
inputs.desc: Obliterate every output that this NPC has.

outputs.name: OnWeaponPickup
outputs.desc: Fires when this NPC picks a weapon off the ground or a gun rack.

desc: The base for the prop_button/prop_under_button.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before Reset
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the button has been pressed before it returns to the starting position. Once it has returned, it can be used again.

keyvalues.name: Play timer sound?
keyvalues.desc: If set, this button will play timer sounds while button is depressed. This allows fast reset by default - use Prevent fast reset to stop this.

keyvalues.name: Prevent fast reset?
keyvalues.desc: Buttons that are timer's allow you to reset early - use this to make the button stick for the entire duration.

keyvalues.name: Is Solid
keyvalues.desc: Makes button able to be passed through.

inputs.name: Press
inputs.desc: Cause the button to be pressed.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Locks the button.

inputs.name: UnLock
inputs.desc: UnLocks the button.

inputs.name: CancelPress
inputs.desc: Causes the button to reset quietly and without firing OnButtonReset outputs.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Called when the button has been pressed.

outputs.name: OnPressedBlue
outputs.desc: Called in Coop when the button has been pressed by the Blue player.

outputs.name: OnPressedOrange
outputs.desc: Called in Coop when the button has been pressed by the Orange player.

outputs.name: OnButtonReset
outputs.desc: Called when the button has reset after being pressed.

desc: Paint Type property.

keyvalues.name: Paint Type
keyvalues.desc: The type of Gel created.

keyvalues.name: [H] Paint Type
keyvalues.desc: The type of gel displayed in Hammer.

inputs.name: ThrowGrenadeAtTarget
inputs.desc: Throws a grenade at the specified target.

keyvalues.name: Orientation
keyvalues.desc: How the prop/sprite rotates to face the camera.

keyvalues.name: Initial Speed
keyvalues.desc: Sets the helicopter's desired speed that it should try to reach as soon as it's spawned.

keyvalues.name: Target path_track
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) The name of a path_track entity that this NPC will fly to after spawning.

inputs.name: MoveTopSpeed
inputs.desc: The helicopter will immediately move at top speed toward its current goal, or in its current orientation if it's on top of its goal.

inputs.name: MoveSpecifiedSpeed
inputs.desc: The helicopter will immediately move at the specified speed (you provide this as parameter override in units per second) towards its current goal.

inputs.name: ChangePathCorner
inputs.desc: Tell the helicopter to move to a path corner on a new path.

inputs.name: SelfDestruct
inputs.desc: Self Destruct.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Activate. Use to wake up a helicopter that spawned with the 'Await Input' spawnflag on.

inputs.name: SetTrack
inputs.desc: Set a track for the helicopter to adhere to. The helicopter will do nothing if it's on the same path, and will move to the closest point on the specified track if it's on a different path.

inputs.name: FlyToSpecificTrackViaPath
inputs.desc: The helicopter will first fly to the closest point on the path if it's on a different path. Then it'll fly along the path to the specified track point.

inputs.name: StartPatrol
inputs.desc: Start patrolling back and forth along the current track.

inputs.name: StopPatrol
inputs.desc: Stop patrolling back and forth along the track. This will cause the helicopter to come to rest at the track which it's currently flying toward.

inputs.name: ChooseFarthestPathPoint
inputs.desc: When tracking an enemy, choose the point on the path furthest from the enemy, but still in firing range.

inputs.name: ChooseNearestPathPoint
inputs.desc: When tracking an enemy, choose the point on the path nearest from the enemy.

inputs.name: StartBreakableMovement
inputs.desc: The helicopter is now allowed to disobey direct commands to go to particular points if it senses an enemy. It will move to the closest point (or farthest point, if ChooseFarthestPathPoint is used), on the path if it senses an enemy.

inputs.name: StopBreakableMovement
inputs.desc: The helicopter can not disobey direct commands. It will continue to fly along its patrol path or to its specified target even if it senses an enemy.

desc: An entity that constrains players to a radius around itself, slowing them down the closer they get to the edge of the radius.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius to constrain players to.

keyvalues.name: Constraint Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the constraint edge. This is the distance in which to start slowing players down as they approach the edge of the radius.

keyvalues.name: Speed Factor
keyvalues.desc: Factor applied to the player's max speed as they approach the radius edge.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Start constraining any players within the radius.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Stop constraining any players previously constrained.

outputs.name: OnConstraintBroken
outputs.desc: Fired when a player breaks through the constraint.

desc: Fires prop_exploding_futbols at a target entity. Used in Wheatley's boss fight.

keyvalues.name: Launch speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed to launch the futbol.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Set new launch target.

inputs.name: ShootFutbol
inputs.desc: Shoot a futbol at the target.

outputs.name: OnShootSuccess
outputs.desc: Called when a futbol is successfully fired.

outputs.name: OnShootFail
outputs.desc: Called when a futbol fails to fire.

desc: An entity that displays a text message oriented in the world, at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Text Size
keyvalues.desc: Text Size.

keyvalues.name: Font Material
keyvalues.desc: The font material atlas to use for the text

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start displaying the message text, if the player is within the message radius.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop displaying the message text.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the display status

inputs.name: SetMessage
inputs.desc: Set the message text.

desc: An entity that relays bonus maps changes.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlocks the filename/map combination.

inputs.name: Complete
inputs.desc: Completes the filename/map combination.

inputs.name: Save
inputs.desc: Saves bonus map data.

desc: Antlion Repellant

keyvalues.name: Repell radius
keyvalues.desc: Antlions aren't allowed to be inside this radius

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable

desc: An entity that will find an entity and pass it along as the !caller with the OutEntity output. Requires using !caller as the parameter on the input.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to narrow set of findable entities. See filter_activator_name for more explanation.

keyvalues.name: Reference Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity to use when evaluating criteria. For example, when using 'Nearest', this is the entity that distance will be measured from. If left blank will use the point_entity_finder.

inputs.name: FindEntity
inputs.desc: Find an entity that meets the specified criteria.  Will fire OutEntity if found and pass the entity as !Caller.

outputs.name: OnFoundEntity
outputs.desc: Fired when FindEntity is input and an entity was found. Passes the found entity as !Caller.

desc: An entity that does damage to all entities in a radius around itself, with a specified delay. If 'Target Entity' is specified, the damage is only done to that entity.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, only this entity will take damage. Otherwise, all entities within the Radius will take damage.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: All entities within this radius of this entity will take damage. If a 'Target Entity' is specified, only that entity will take damage.

keyvalues.name: Damage
keyvalues.desc: Damage done to all affected entities each time this entity fires.

keyvalues.name: Delay
keyvalues.desc: Delay between refires, in seconds.

inputs.name: Hurt
inputs.desc: Force a single fire, damaging either the Target Entity or all entities within the radius.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable this entity. It will start damaging entities everytime it fires, and refire based upon the specified Delay.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable this entity. It will stop damaging entities.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle this entity between On/Off state.

desc: Launches Aperture Science High Energy Pellets.

keyvalues.name: Ball count
keyvalues.desc: The number of Pellets that are alive at once.

keyvalues.name: Max ball speed
keyvalues.desc: The maximum starting speed.

keyvalues.name: Min ball speed
keyvalues.desc: The minimum starting speed.

keyvalues.name: Ball Type
keyvalues.desc: Has no effect.

keyvalues.name: Ball Bounces
keyvalues.desc: Sets on which bounce the ball should explode. For example, if set to 4, the ball will explode on the 4th bounce.

keyvalues.name: Ball Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: The time in seconds the ball will live before self-destructing. A negative value will give infinite life, appearing green.

keyvalues.name: Ball Damage
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage to deal to the player on contact

keyvalues.name: Ball explodes on player contact
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not the ball should interact with the player.

keyvalues.name: Ball body material override
keyvalues.desc: Override the main ball material. Remember to enable the flag! Default material behavior is used if the flag is not set!!!

keyvalues.name: Ball flicker material override
keyvalues.desc: Override the other ball material. Remember to enable the flag! Default material behavior is used if the flag is not set!!!

keyvalues.name: Ball knockback multiplier
keyvalues.desc: The ball's velocity is multiplied by this value to determine how strongly to knockback hit objects. Use 1 for 1:1 speed = knockback radio.

keyvalues.name: Min life after portal transition
keyvalues.desc: When energy balls created by this launcher pass through a portal their life is refreshed to be this number at minimum.

inputs.name: LaunchBall
inputs.desc: Launch a ball from the spawner.

inputs.name: BallCaught
inputs.desc: Ball this launcher created was 'caught'.

outputs.name: OnPostSpawnBall
outputs.desc: Fired after the ball has spawned.

outputs.name: OnBallCaught
outputs.desc: Fired when a ball this entity has launched has been 'caught'.

desc: Area of affect for the $flesh shader effect.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius of the effect when active

inputs.name: SetRadius
inputs.desc: Sets a new radius and time to interpolate to it(as a vector <Size> <Time in Seconds>).

desc: An entity that issues commands to the client console, as if it was typed in by the player (if activator is a player, or the local player in single player).

inputs.name: Command
inputs.desc: Command to execute.

desc: A camera entity that controls the player's view. While it's active, the player will see out of the camera.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Look At
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that the camera should point at and track while active.

keyvalues.name: Target Attachment Name
keyvalues.desc: If set, the camera will focus on the specified attachment on the 'Entity to Look At'.

keyvalues.name: Hold Time
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time the camera should control the player's view for, after which it deactivates itself. If the camera should stay active until told to deactive, set the 'Infinite Hold Time' spawnflag.

keyvalues.name: Path Corner
keyvalues.desc: The first path corner in a track that the camera should move along once it's activated. If not specified, the camera won't move.

keyvalues.name: Interpolate Position To Player
keyvalues.desc: Gradually interpolate player's position to here on start. (Episodic only)

keyvalues.name: Initial Speed
keyvalues.desc: The starting speed that the camera moves at, if it's on a path track.

keyvalues.name: Acceleration units/sec^2
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the camera accelerates to path corner's desired speeds.

keyvalues.name: Stop Deceleration units/sec^2
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the camera decelerates to path corner's desired speeds.

keyvalues.name: Tracking Speed of the camera
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the camera tries to follow it's look target.

keyvalues.name: Field of view
keyvalues.desc: Player FOV (if Set FOV spawnflag is set)

keyvalues.name: Seconds to reach FOV target
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time it should take to reach the specified FOV

keyvalues.name: Don't set player view
keyvalues.desc: Prevents this point_viewcontrol from actually controlling the player's view. FOV, player-affecting spawnflags, etc. may still happen.

keyvalues.name: <Far Plane>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to display the view frustum preview.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the point_viewcontrol, and start controlling the player's view.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the point_viewcontrol, and stop controlling the player's view.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Set a new target for the camera to point at.

inputs.name: SetTargetAttachment
inputs.desc: Set a new attachment on the target for the camera to point at.

inputs.name: ReturnToEyes
inputs.desc: Return the camera view to the player's eyes.

inputs.name: TeleportToView
inputs.desc: Teleport the player to the current position of the camera.

inputs.name: SetTrackSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed that the camera will try to track it's target.

inputs.name: SetPath
inputs.desc: Have the camera start following a new path.

outputs.name: OnEndFollow
outputs.desc: Fired when the point_viewcontrol deactivates, due to the Disable input being received, the Entity to Look At being destroyed, or the Hold Time expiring.

desc: An entity that detects when surfaces are painted.

keyvalues.name: Search Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius to search inside, -1 to disable.

keyvalues.name: Target Brush Faces
keyvalues.desc: Faces on which to watch for paint.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: Entity for which to watch for paint.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to narrow set of findable entities. See filter_activator_name for more explanation.

outputs.name: OnPainted
outputs.desc: Gets called when paint is detected. Parameter is set to the paint type index.

desc: An entity that issues commands to each valid client's console, as if it was typed in by that player locally.

inputs.name: Command
inputs.desc: Command to execute for all players.

desc: Invisible Discouragement Beam detector, for logic use. The entity will fire outputs when struck and unstruck.

keyvalues.name: Terminal Point
keyvalues.desc: Whether to behave like a laser catcher or a relay. When on, lasers will auto-aim towards this, and lasers that hit it will not show end sparks or be able to activate later laser targets. When off, these behaviors do not occur, and it has a taller hitbox to match a laser relay.

keyvalues.name: Laser Filter Color (R G B A)
keyvalues.desc: Filter lasers by this colour.

outputs.name: OnPowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser hits the target.

outputs.name: OnUnpowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser has stopped hitting the target.

desc: Commentary node for the developer commentary. Usually added after-the-fact by the commentary system, but can also be placed manually.

keyvalues.name: Commentary File
keyvalues.desc: The sound that will play when this is triggered.

keyvalues.name: Commentary File (no HDR)
keyvalues.desc: If HDR is off and this exists it will be played instead.

keyvalues.name: Speaker(s)
keyvalues.desc: The characters/people who are saying the commentary.

keyvalues.name: Start Disabled
keyvalues.desc: Should it be disabled or not?

keyvalues.name: Prevent Movement?
keyvalues.desc: If enabled players won't be able to move while the commentary is playing.

keyvalues.name: Pre-Command
keyvalues.desc: Command that will fire before the sound file is played. Use semicolons to delimit multiple commands.

keyvalues.name: Post-Command
keyvalues.desc: Command that will fire after the sound file is played. Also accepts semicolons.

keyvalues.name: View Position
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity the player's view will move to.

keyvalues.name: View Target
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity the player's view will track. If set, the player cannot move their camera.

inputs.name: StartCommentary
inputs.desc: Start the commentary, just like if the player +USEd this.

inputs.name: StopCommentary
inputs.desc: Force the commentary node to stop.

inputs.name: StartUnstoppableCommentary
inputs.desc: Start the commentary but don't let the player cancel it.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryStarted
outputs.desc: Triggered when the commentary starts.

outputs.name: OnCommentaryStopped
outputs.desc: Triggered when the commentary stops. If viewposition is set, this triggers after the player's returns to their regular view.

desc: Bugbait sensor point

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the sensor.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the sensor.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the sensor.

outputs.name: OnBaited
outputs.desc: Fires when bugbait lands within a radius of the sensor

desc: Adds a hiding spot to the nav mesh at this location.
An entity that detects if another entity points in a given direction for a period of time.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose angles will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Look At Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity we want to check to see if the Target Entity is looking at.

keyvalues.name: Duration
keyvalues.desc: The amount of time the Target Entity must look at the 'Look at Entity' to trigger this entity, in seconds.

keyvalues.name: Tolerance
keyvalues.desc: The tolerance, in degrees, in the checking to determine when the Target Entity is looking at the Look At Entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the sensor between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Check to see if the Target Entity is facing the Look At Entity within the specified tolerance, firing either the OnFacingLookat or OnNotFacingLookat output based on the result.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Set the target entity

outputs.name: TargetDir
outputs.desc: Fired when the forward direction of the Target Entity changes. Passes the new forward direction as a parameter.

outputs.name: OnFacingLookat
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity points at the Look At Entity for more than the specified Duration, or in response to a Test input.

outputs.name: OnNotFacingLookat
outputs.desc: Fires in response to a Test input when the Target Entity is not pointing at the Look At Entity.

outputs.name: FacingPercentage
outputs.desc: Normalized value (0..1) where 1 is facing directly at target and 0 is at or beyond the angle of tolerance.

desc: An entity that teleports a target entity to this position and angles. If 'Teleport Home' spawn flag is set, teleports the target entity to its spawn position instead. If object is physically simulated, simulation is turned off when teleported.

keyvalues.name: Entity To Teleport
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that will be teleported.

keyvalues.name: [H] Model
keyvalues.desc: The model shown in Hammer, to use for positioning.

inputs.name: Teleport
inputs.desc: Teleport the target entity.

inputs.name: TeleportToCurrentPos
inputs.desc: Teleport the target entity to wherever the point_teleport entity is currently. The Teleport input teleports to the initial position of the point_teleport, so this input was added to avoid breaking old content.

inputs.name: TeleportEntity
inputs.desc: Teleport the entity specified by the parameter override. Use this to teleport an entity other than the one specified in the Entity To Teleport field.

desc: An entity that issues commands to the server console.

inputs.name: Command
inputs.desc: Command to execute.

desc: A camera entity that moves the player's view. Use this if you want the player to retain control of where the player looks but want to move the position to another location.

keyvalues.name: Offset type
keyvalues.desc: How the player's view moves to the view of the camera.

keyvalues.name: Proxy Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that the camera uses to translate the view.

keyvalues.name: Attachment Point
keyvalues.desc: Use this attachment on the proxy's parent for position and orientation.

keyvalues.name: Tilt Fraction
keyvalues.desc: How much the angle of the proxy affects the angle of the view. 0.0 will keep the players view angles unmodified. 1.0 will add in the whole tilt from the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Use Fake Acceleration
keyvalues.desc: If the player maintains an offset from the proxy apply fake acceleration on the player based on the movement of the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Skew Acceleration Forward
keyvalues.desc: If this is set fake acceleration will be more noticeable in the direction of the proxy.

keyvalues.name: Acceleration Scalar
keyvalues.desc: Multiply the fake acceleration by this ammount.

keyvalues.name: Ease Angles To Camera
keyvalues.desc: Move the player's angles to the camera - this will stop them from looking around.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the view proxy, and start modifying the player's view.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the view proxy, and start modifying the player's view.

inputs.name: TeleportPlayerToProxy
inputs.desc: Move the player to the view proxy.

desc: An entity that detects if another entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds a threshold value.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose angular velocity will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Threshold Velocity
keyvalues.desc: The threshold angular velocity to compare against, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Fire Interval
keyvalues.desc: Angular velocity must cross the threshold for at least this long to fire.

keyvalues.name: Use Axis Helper
keyvalues.desc: Use axis helper to determine rotation values (clockwise/counter-clockwise).

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Checks to see if the Target Entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds the Threshold Velocity, firing either the OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo or OnLessThan output based on the result.

inputs.name: TestWithInterval
inputs.desc: Checks to see if the Target Entity's angular velocity meets or exceeds the Threshold Velocity. Once the Fire Interval expires, fires the appropriate test result output if the result is stable throughout the Fire Interval.

outputs.name: AngularVelocity
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target's Angular Velocity changes, passing the new magnitude of the angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from slower than the threshold angular velocity to faster than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from slower than the threshold angular velocity to faster than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnLessThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from faster than the threshold angular velocity to slower than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnLessThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity goes from faster than the threshold angular velocity to slower than the threshold angular velocity.

outputs.name: OnEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target Entity reaches the threshold angular velocity from a different velocity.

desc: Camera

keyvalues.name: FOV
keyvalues.desc: Field of view in degrees

keyvalues.name: Fog Start
keyvalues.desc: The near fog plane.

keyvalues.name: Fog End
keyvalues.desc: The far fog/clipping plane.

keyvalues.name: Fog Max Density [0..1]
keyvalues.desc: The maximum fog density. 0=no fog, 1=full fog.

inputs.name: ChangeFOV
inputs.desc: Changes camera's FOV over time

inputs.name: SetOnAndTurnOthersOff
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on, and turn all other cameras off.

inputs.name: SetOn
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on.

inputs.name: SetOff
inputs.desc: Turn the camera off.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn the camera on, activate it and deactivate all other cameras.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the camera off, deactivate it.

desc: Level Change Entity

inputs.name: ChangeLevel
inputs.desc: Changes the level to the map name supplied as a parameter.

inputs.name: ChangeLevelPostFade
inputs.desc: Immediately set screen to black rather than fade out, then change the level to the map name supplied.

outputs.name: OnChangeLevel
outputs.desc: Fired when the level is about to change.

desc: An entity that creates tesla lightning arcs around its origin.

keyvalues.name: Start Enabled
keyvalues.desc: Should the tesla start active?

keyvalues.name: Source Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, tesla lightning will originate from the specified entity. Otherwise, they originate from this entity.

keyvalues.name: Sound Name
keyvalues.desc: Sound to be played whenever lightning is created.

keyvalues.name: Sprite Name
keyvalues.desc: Material to use for the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius around the origin to find a point to strike with a tesla lightning beam.

keyvalues.name: Min # of Beams
keyvalues.desc: Minimum number of tesla lightning beams to create when creating an arc.

keyvalues.name: Max # of Beams
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of tesla lightning beams to create when creating an arc.

keyvalues.name: Min Beam Width
keyvalues.desc: Minimum width of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Max Beam Width
keyvalues.desc: Maximum width of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Min Time Visible
keyvalues.desc: Minimum lifetime of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Max Time Visible
keyvalues.desc: Maximum lifetime of the tesla lightning beams.

keyvalues.name: Min Time Between Arcs
keyvalues.desc: Minimum time delay between random arcing.

keyvalues.name: Max Time Between Arcs
keyvalues.desc: Maximum time delay between random arcing.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn emitter on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn emitter off.

inputs.name: DoSpark
inputs.desc: Force a single arc.

desc: An entity that detects and outputs an entity's velocity.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose velocity will be sensed.

keyvalues.name: Start Enabled
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not to start enabled and active.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the sensor.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the sensor.

outputs.name: Velocity
outputs.desc: Fired when the Target's Velocity changes, passing the new magnitude of the velocity.

desc: Pulls objects to, or pushes them away from a point. In Portal 2, if a portal is placed nearby it will transfer the suction and produce a 'broken_tube_suck' effect for Diversity Vents.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: How strongly to push away from the center.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius to affect items in.

keyvalues.name: LOS Radius
keyvalues.desc: If 'Test LOS' is enabled, collision checks will check this far from the center. This allows models to be placed in the middle.

keyvalues.name: Cone of Influence
keyvalues.desc: If greater than zero, the cone (in degrees) within which the object must lie for it to be affected.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the push.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the push.

desc: An entity that detects another entity's proximity to a target position.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity whose position will be sensed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the sensor between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity and begins output. The targetnames !activator and !caller are accepted.

outputs.name: Distance
outputs.desc: Distance of the target entity away from this entity.

desc: APC Controller

keyvalues.name: Name of entity I should follow/attack

inputs.name: Activate
