inputs.desc: Turn the APC rockets on

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn the APC rockets off (go dormant)

outputs.name: OnFireAtTarget
outputs.desc: Fires when a valid target is found and the APC should shoot rockets

desc: Generic game statistics counter.

inputs.name: SetName
inputs.desc: Changes name of statistic counter

inputs.name: Increment
inputs.desc: Increments named statistic counter by specified value

desc:
Turns an entity, or set of entities, into a single template that can be instanced anywhere, and multiple times. If there are interdependencies (entity I/O, hierarchy, or other name references) between the entities in the template, the entities in the template will have their names changed and the interdependencies will be reconnected to the changes names. The name change format is as follows: '<original name>&0000', where the 0000 will be replaced with the current global template instance, so wildcard searches for '<original name>*' will still find them.
If you don't want the name fixup to happen, because you're only spawning the template once, or you want inputs to trigger all instances of the template, check the 'Preserve entity names' spawnflag. 
To spawn the template in other places, use an env_entity_maker.

inputs.name: ForceSpawn
inputs.desc: Spawn an instance of the template at the original position.

outputs.name: OnEntitySpawned
outputs.desc: Fired after spawning an instance of this template.

desc: An entity that controls a pose parameter of a prop and cycles the pose clientside.

keyvalues.name: Target
keyvalues.desc: Name of the prop to control. Can be any animating entity.

keyvalues.name: Pose Parameter Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the pose parameter to control. Setting this to an invalid value will crash the game!

keyvalues.name: Pose Parameter Value
keyvalues.desc: Normalized value for the pose parameter from 0.0 and 1.0 (maps to min and max range).

keyvalues.name: Interpolation Time
keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds (0.0 to 10.0) for client to match absolue pose values.

keyvalues.name: Interpolation Wrap
keyvalues.desc: Should wrap from 0.0 to 1.0 when interpolating.

keyvalues.name: Cycle Frequency
keyvalues.desc: Base cycles per second from -10.0 to 10.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Time Offset
keyvalues.desc: Modulation time offset from -1.0f to 1.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Rate
keyvalues.desc: Modulation cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

keyvalues.name: Frequency Modulation Amplitude
keyvalues.desc: Modulation extents from 0.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterName
inputs.desc: Sets the pose parameter to control.

inputs.name: SetPoseValue
inputs.desc: Set the pose parameter to a normalized value between 0.0 and 1.0 (maps to min and max range).

inputs.name: SetInterpolationTime
inputs.desc: Set the interpolation time to a number of seconds between 0.0 and 10.0.

inputs.name: SetCycleFrequency
inputs.desc: Set the pose parameter's base cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetFModType
inputs.desc: Set the type of frequency modulation.

inputs.name: SetFModTimeOffset
inputs.desc: Set the modulation time offset from -1.0f to 1.0.

inputs.name: SetFModRate
inputs.desc: Set the modulation cycles per second from -10.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: SetFModAmplitude
inputs.desc: Set the modulation extents from 0.0f to 10.0.

inputs.name: RandomizeFMod
inputs.desc: Randomize the frequency modulation by an extremeness of 0.0 to 1.0.

inputs.name: GetFmod
inputs.desc: Outputs the current modulation settings in console.

desc: An entity that displays a text message in the world, at its origin.

keyvalues.name: Show message radius
keyvalues.desc: Distance the player must be within to see this message.

keyvalues.name: Developer Only?
keyvalues.desc: If set, this message will only be visible when developer mode is on.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start displaying the message text, if the player is within the message radius.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop displaying the message text.

desc: A camera entity that controls players' views. which works in multiplayer. While it's active, the players will see out of the camera.

keyvalues.name: Field of view
keyvalues.desc: Player FOV

keyvalues.name: Seconds to reach FOV target
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time it should take to reach the specified FOV

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: Entity to move to. (End of move will match origin and angles).

keyvalues.name: Seconds to reach target entity
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time it should take to reach the target entity's origin and angles.

keyvalues.name: Target Team
keyvalues.desc: Which team (or all) to take over the camera for.

keyvalues.name: <Far Plane>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to display the view frustum preview.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the point_viewcontrol_multiplayer, and start controlling the players' view.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the point_viewcontrol_multiplayer, and stop controlling the players' view.

inputs.name: AddPlayer
inputs.desc: Force the !activator player to be controlled by this.

inputs.name: RemovePlayer
inputs.desc: Remove !activator player from being controlled.

inputs.name: StartMovement
inputs.desc: Start the movement to the target entity.

desc: Displays a survey to the player.

keyvalues.name: Survey Script Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of a survey keyvalues file, from the 'scripts/surveys' folder.

inputs.name: ShowSurvey
inputs.desc: Displays the survey.

outputs.name: OnSurveyComplete
outputs.desc: Fired when the player completes or cancels the survey.

desc: An entity used by the -makedevshots system, which automatically takes screenshots at the position of every devshot camera in the level.

keyvalues.name: Camera Name
keyvalues.desc: Used as the name of the directory to store screenshots from this camera. Must be unique within the level.

keyvalues.name: Camera FOV
keyvalues.desc: FOV of this camera.

keyvalues.name: <Far Plane>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to display the view frustum preview.

inputs.name: TakeScreenshot
inputs.desc: Takes a single screenshot from this camera only

desc: An entity to draw a spotlight. Will draw a beam when the player views it side on, and a halo when it's facing towards the player. Unless the 'No Dynamic Light' spawnflag is checked, it will also create a dynamic light wherever the end of the spotlight rests.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Length
keyvalues.desc: Length of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: Spotlight Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the spotlight beam.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply sprite color by when running in HDR mode.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Solid
keyvalues.desc: If set, this spotlight won't trace for solids.

keyvalues.name: Brightness
keyvalues.desc: Integer value representing spotlight brightness (0-255)

inputs.name: LightOn
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight on.

inputs.name: LightOff
inputs.desc: Turn the spotlight off

inputs.name: SetColor
inputs.desc: Change the color of the spotlight.

inputs.name: ForceUpdate
inputs.desc: Force an update of the spotlight position and orientation.

inputs.name: SetBrightness
inputs.desc: Set the brightness of the spotlight.

outputs.name: OnLightOn
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns on.

outputs.name: OnLightOff
outputs.desc: Fires when light turns off.

desc: An entity used to move a motion-disabled prop when it enables motion. Parent this entity to the prop, and when the prop has its motion enabled, it will immediately teleport to the origin of this entity.
Launches Combine balls.

keyvalues.name: Noise to launch direction
keyvalues.desc: Noise in degrees added to the launch direction.

keyvalues.name: Name of bullseye
keyvalues.desc: If you select the Attach Bullseye spawnflag, you may specify a name here which will be given to the bullseye.

keyvalues.name: Max number of bounces
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of bounces the balls are allowed to do before they are removed.

inputs.name: LaunchBall
inputs.desc: Launch a ball from the spawner.

desc: An entity used to manage a group of interacting constraints and keep them stable. All constraints on a set of entities should be placed in the same system, or they will fight each other during simulation.

keyvalues.name: Additional System Iterations
keyvalues.desc: Adding iterations makes the interactions among constraints in a system tighter. It will not compensate for errors due to collision, but will help in cases where objects of disparate mass are constrained to each other.

desc: An entity used to apply constant acceleration to a physics object. The force and torque is calculated using the position and direction of the thruster as an impulse. So moving those off the object's center will cause torque as well. Torque can be removed by unchecking the 'apply torque' flag. The position of the thruster can be forced to be at the object's center by checking to 'ignore pos' flag.

keyvalues.name: Force
keyvalues.desc: Force (will be integrated, units are force kg*in/s^2)

desc: A constraint that keeps the position of two objects fixed, relative to the constraint's origin. It does not affect rotation.
An entity that tries to spin a target entity at a particular speed.

keyvalues.name: Rotation Speed
keyvalues.desc: Angular speed (units are degress/second)

keyvalues.name: Spin up time
keyvalues.desc: spin up time in seconds (also affects the rate at which speed changes happen)

keyvalues.name: System Interia Scale
keyvalues.desc: Make this larger if the object being driven is constrained to a set of heavier objects.

keyvalues.name: Attached Object
keyvalues.desc: Object to apply the force to

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Sets target speed

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turns motor on

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turns motor off

desc: Turns an arbitrary entity into a physically simulated entity. i.e. brush entities will behave like func_physbox, model entities behave like prop_physics.

keyvalues.name: Entity to convert
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity or entities that will be converted to a physics object when the ConvertTarget input is fired. Maximum of 512 entities.

keyvalues.name: Model Swap Entity
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the entity will be switched to use this entity's model instead of its own. Only one entity will be converted.

keyvalues.name: Mass Override
keyvalues.desc: Sets the mass when the object(s) are converted (0 means auto-calculate)

inputs.name: ConvertTarget
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's target to a physically simulated object.

outputs.name: OnConvert
outputs.desc: Fires after the conversion has taken place.

desc: A constraint that constrains an entity along a line segment.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: Resistance/friction in the constraint

keyvalues.name: Load Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the mass load connected to this constraint (1=just the objects directly connected)

keyvalues.name: Minimum Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling below this many units/sec, will not play any sound.

keyvalues.name: Full Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling at this speed or above, will play sound at full volume.

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (forward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling forward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (backward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling backward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (small)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the small reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (medium)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the medium reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (large)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the large reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (small)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the small threshold but less than medium

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (medium)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the medium threshold but less than large

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (large)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the large threshold

inputs.name: SetVelocity
inputs.desc: Set linear velocity along the constraint

desc: A physically simulated hinge. Use the helper to define the axis of rotation.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: Resistance/friction in the hinge

keyvalues.name: Load Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the load connected to this hinge (1=just the objects directly connected)

keyvalues.name: Minimum Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling below this many units/sec, will not play any sound.

keyvalues.name: Full Sound Velocity
keyvalues.desc: When travelling at this speed or above, will play sound at full volume.

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (forward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling forward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Travel sound (backward)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when travelling backward on helper axis

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (small)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the small reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (medium)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the medium reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound threshold (large)
keyvalues.desc: When accelerating by more than this many units/sec^2 opposite to direction of travel, play the large reversal sound.

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (small)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the small threshold but less than medium

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (medium)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the medium threshold but less than large

keyvalues.name: Reversal sound (large)
keyvalues.desc: Play this sound when making a hard reverse over the large threshold

inputs.name: SetAngularVelocity
inputs.desc: Set angular velocity around the hinge (motor) in deg/sec

desc: A controller that tries to keep an entity facing a particular direction.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity to align to the desired angles.

keyvalues.name: Angular Limit
keyvalues.desc: The maximum angular velocity that this controller can compensate for, in degrees per second.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Enable the controller.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Disable the controller.

desc: An entity that acts like a magnet for ragdolls. Useful for crafting exaggerated ragdoll behavior (i.e. guys falling over rails on death). If the Bar Magnet spawnflag is set, the magnet works like it was a cylindrical magnet i.e. it attracts ragdolls to the nearest point on a line.

keyvalues.name: Bar Magnet Axis
keyvalues.desc: If the Bar Magnet spawnflag is set, ragdolls will be attracted to any point on this line.

keyvalues.name: Effective Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius in which ragdolls are affected around this entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Force
keyvalues.desc: Magnetic force to apply to ragdolls within the radius. Expressed as kilograms per unit per second. So a force of 1000 will add 10 units/second to a 100kg man. It will add 100 units per second to a 10kg headcrab.

keyvalues.name: Entity to affect
keyvalues.desc: If specified, the phys_ragdollmagnet will only affect the target entity.

desc: A constraint that keeps the relative position and orientation of two objects fixed.

A physically simulated spring. 'Length' is what's known as the 'natural spring length'. This is how long the spring would be if it was at rest (nothing hanging on it or attached). When you attach something to the spring, it will stretch longer than its 'natural length'. The amount of stretch is determined by the 'Sprint Constant'. The larger the spring constant the less stretch the spring.

keyvalues.name: Spring Axis
keyvalues.desc: Use the helper. Drag it out to match the virtual spring.

keyvalues.name: Spring Length
keyvalues.desc: How long the spring would be if it was at rest (nothing hanging on it or attached). 0 means the length of the brush.

keyvalues.name: Spring Constant
keyvalues.desc: Stiffness of the spring.  The larger the number the less the spring will stretch.

keyvalues.name: Damping Constant
keyvalues.desc: How much energy the spring loses.  The larger the number, the less bouncy the spring.

keyvalues.name: Relative Damping Constant
keyvalues.desc: The amount of energy the spring loses proportional to the relative velocity of the two objects the spring is attached to.

keyvalues.name: Break on Length
keyvalues.desc: If the spring's length ever exceeds this length, the spring breaks.

inputs.name: SetSpringConstant
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Constant.

inputs.name: SetSpringLength
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Length.

inputs.name: SetSpringDamping
inputs.desc: Set the Spring Damping.

desc: A constraint that preserves the distance between two entities. If the 'Keep Rigid' flag is set, think of it as a rod. If not, think off it as a virtual rope.

keyvalues.name: Additional Length
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the rope.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Length
keyvalues.desc: If the constraint is not rigid, this is the minimum length it can be.

keyvalues.name: Attached object 2 point
keyvalues.default: The position the rope attaches to object 2

desc: An angular thruster. Use it to apply angular force to an entity.
An entity that acts like a magnet, attaching metallic physics objects to itself when they touch it.

keyvalues.name: Force Limit to Break (lbs)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of force necessary to break a stuck object off the magnet. A way of calculating this is to set it to the mass of an object that would break this constraint if it were resting on the magnet.

keyvalues.name: Torque Limit to Break (lbs * distance)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of torque necessary to break a stuck object off the magnet. A way of calculating this is to multiply any reference mass by the resting distance (from the center of mass of the object) needed to break the constraint.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

keyvalues.name: Override parameters
keyvalues.desc: A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Attached Objects
keyvalues.desc: The maximum number of physics objects that can be stuck to the magnet at once. 0 = no limit.

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the magnet on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: The the magnet off. This will detach anything current stuck to the magnet.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the magnet on or off.

outputs.name: OnAttach
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity is grabbed by the magnet.

outputs.name: OnDetach
outputs.desc: Fired when an entity is released by the magnet.

desc: A constraint that fixes the position of two entities, relative to this constraint's origin. Also allows for limits on the rotation around each axis, in the space of this constraint.

keyvalues.name: X axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: X axis max limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Y axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Y axis max limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.name: Z axis min limit
keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

keyvalues.desc: -180 min and 180 max = no constraint on this axis.

desc: A constraint that is essentially two length constraints and two points. Imagine it as a virtual rope connected to two objects, each suspended from a pulley above them. The constraint keeps the sum of the distances between the pulley points and their suspended objects constant.

keyvalues.name: Additional Length
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the pulley rope.

keyvalues.name: Pulley Gear Ratio
keyvalues.desc: Add (or subtract) this amount to the rest length of the pulley rope.

keyvalues.name: Pulley Position 2
keyvalues.desc: The position of the pulley for Entity 2. The pulley for Entity 1 is the origin of this constraint entity. Entity 1 is always suspended from pulley point 1, and Entity 2 is always suspended from pulley point 2.

desc: Catches (bombs?) and fires an output.
Catches 'hot potatos' and fires an output.
This uses the futbol model. It can be carried around, but on impact it explodes, similar to prop_exploding_futbols.
Catches 'hot potatos' and fires an output.

An entity used to control the 3D Skybox. Its origin is used to determine the 3D Skybox's position relative to the map. Place this entity, in the 3D Skybox, at the point where the origin of the map should be.

keyvalues.name: Parent
keyvalues.desc: The name of the entity to move with. NOTE: sky_camera's position is normally only updated on spawn. Fire the ForceUpdate or StartUpdating inputs to update the sky_camera's position! You might also want to enable Use Angles for Sky.

keyvalues.name: Sky Color
keyvalues.desc: Causes the skybox to use a solid color instead of the sky texture specified in worldspawn. Blended alpha is unfortunately not supported, but an alpha of '0' disables the effect and any alpha greater than that (e.g. 255) enables the effect.

keyvalues.name: 3D Skybox scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale of the skybox.

keyvalues.name: Use Angles for Sky
keyvalues.desc: Uses angles for actual skybox rotation, as if the world were tilted on this entity's axis.

keyvalues.name: Fog Start
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the skybox fog should start.

keyvalues.name: Fog End
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the skybox fog should be fully opaque.

keyvalues.name: HDR color scale.
keyvalues.desc: float value to multiply fog color by when running in HDR mode.

inputs.name: ForceUpdate
inputs.desc: Forces the 3D skybox to update with this sky_camera's position.

inputs.name: StartUpdating
inputs.desc: Begins per-tick skybox updating, which is needed if you want this sky_camera to move.

inputs.name: StopUpdating
inputs.desc: Ends per-tick skybox updating if it was enabled before.

inputs.name: ActivateSkybox
inputs.desc: Make this skybox the active one.

inputs.name: DeactivateSkybox
inputs.desc: Stops making this sky_camera the active skybox if it is currently the active skybox, which causes the sky to clear.

inputs.name: SetFogStartDist
inputs.desc: Sets the fog start distance.

inputs.name: SetFogEndDist
inputs.desc: Sets the fog end distance.

inputs.name: TurnOnFog
inputs.desc: Turns the fog on.

inputs.name: TurnOffFog
inputs.desc: Turns the fog off.

inputs.name: SetFogColor
inputs.desc: Sets the primary fog color.

inputs.name: SetFogColorSecondary
inputs.desc: Sets the secondary fog color.

inputs.name: SetFarZ
inputs.desc: Sets the far clip plane distance.

inputs.name: SetFogMaxDensity
inputs.desc: 0 to 1, set the fog's max density

inputs.name: SetSkyColor
inputs.desc: Sets the sky color.

desc: Keyframed Move Behavior

A node entity that marks a point in a rope. Traditionally, one move_rope is used to start the chain and then is followed by one or more keyframe_rope entities. However they are freely interchangeable.
Track Move Behavior
Universal ambient sound. Use it to play and control a single sound.

keyvalues.name: Sound Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the GameSound entry for the sound to play. Also supports direct .wav filenames.

keyvalues.name: Volume
keyvalues.desc: Sound volume, expressed as a range from 0 to 10, where 10 is the loudest.

keyvalues.name: Sound Range
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which this sound is audible. Overridden by soundscripts.

keyvalues.name: Pitch
keyvalues.desc: Sound pitch, expressed as a range from 1(low) to 255(high), where 100 is the sound's default pitch. Overridden by soundscripts.

keyvalues.name: Source Entity
keyvalues.desc: If an entity is specified, sound will come from this named entity instead of the location of ambient_generic.

keyvalues.name: Sound Flags
keyvalues.desc: Additional options for your sound.

keyvalues.name: Dynamic Presets
keyvalues.desc: If used, overrides many of the below properties (+pitch) to preset values.

keyvalues.name: Transition Volume
keyvalues.desc: The Volume to start/end with. Use with Fade In and Out times.

keyvalues.name: Volume Transition Time - Start (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for the sound to transition from the Transition Volume to the set volume as it starts playing.

keyvalues.name: Volume Transition Time - Stop (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds for the sound to transition from the set volume to the Transition Volume as it stops playing.

keyvalues.name: Transition Pitch
keyvalues.desc: Pitch to start with/end. Use with Spin Up and Spin Down.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Transition Time - Start (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The time taken to change from the Transition Pitch to the final Pitch while the sound starts playing. Simulates the noise powering-up when an object is activated.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Transition Time - Stop (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The time taken to transition from the Pitch to the Transition pitch while the sound stops playing. Simulates the noise fading out as the object shuts down.

keyvalues.name: LFO type
keyvalues.desc: The kind of Low Frequency Oscillation to apply to the sound. Allows subtle modification to the sound. Square waves instantly switch between the high and low values, whereas Triangle Waves gradually switch between the two.

keyvalues.name: LFO rate (0-1000)
keyvalues.desc: How often the Low Frequency Oscillation repeats itself.

keyvalues.name: LFO Effect On Pitch (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The amount the Low Frequency Oscillation affects the pitch.

keyvalues.name: LFO Effect On Volume (0-100)
keyvalues.desc: The amount the Low Frequency Oscillation affects the volume.

keyvalues.name: Incremental Spinup Count
keyvalues.desc: Appears non-functional.

inputs.name: Pitch
inputs.desc: Sets the sound pitch, expressed as a range from 1 to 255, where 100 is the sound's default pitch.

inputs.name: PlaySound
inputs.desc: Starts the sound or restart from beginning (if looped).

inputs.name: StopSound
inputs.desc: Stops the sound if it is playing. Only works properly if the looped flag is checked.

inputs.name: ToggleSound
inputs.desc: Toggles the sound between playing and stopping.

inputs.name: Volume
inputs.desc: Sets the sound volume, expressed as a range from 0 to 10, where 10 is the loudest.

inputs.name: FadeIn
inputs.desc: Fades the sound up to full volume over a specified number of seconds, with a range from 0 to 100 seconds.

inputs.name: FadeOut
inputs.desc: Fades the sound to silence over a specified number of seconds, with a range from 0 to 100 seconds. Sound is forced to full volume first!

inputs.name: SetSound
inputs.desc: Sets the sound this ambient_generic should play.

outputs.name: OnSoundFinished
outputs.desc: Fires when the sound finishes playing. NOTE: This sound should be set to pause when the game is paused.

desc:
This entity makes sounds or smells that can be sensed by NPCs, but not by the player. This can be used to cause reactions in nearby NPCs.

Sound Types
  Combat: Will cause most NPCs to become alert
  World: Will cause most NPCs to become alert
  Danger: Will cause most NPCs to move away from the position of the sound
  Bullet Impact: 
  Carcass: 
  Meat: 
  Garbage: 
  Thumper: causes antlions to run away briefly
  Readiness: (Low, Medium, High) Causes player companions that can hear this sound to change readiness

keyvalues.name: Volume
keyvalues.desc: How far away this sound can be heard. This is a radius.

keyvalues.name: Duration
keyvalues.desc: How long the sound persists each time you insert it.

keyvalues.name: Sound Type
keyvalues.desc: The type of sound or smell will determine the reaction of NPCs that sense it.

keyvalues.name: Additional sound context (optional)
keyvalues.desc: Optional settings specifying such things as who can or cannot hear the sound.

keyvalues.name: Location Proxy
keyvalues.desc: The name of an entity to use as a proxy to determine the location at which to make the sound. If you specify an entity here, the sound will be made at that entity's location (!player included)

inputs.name: EmitAISound
inputs.desc: Make the sound.

desc: An entity that allows you to generate events for nearby friendly NPCs to respond to.

inputs.name: TriggerResponseEvent
inputs.desc: Fire an NPC Response Event. The parameter should match the response rules concept that any nearby friendly NPCs will try to speak.

inputs.name: ForceTriggerResponseEvent
inputs.desc: Fire an NPC Response Event, and force the first available NPC to speak the response (breaking them out of any scene they're in). The parameter should match the response rules concept that any nearby friendly NPCs will try to speak.

inputs.name: ForceTriggerResponseEventNoCancel
inputs.desc: Fire an NPC Response Event, and force the first available NPC to speak the response (but don't break them out of any scene they're in). The parameter should match the response rules concept that any nearby friendly NPCs will try to speak.

desc: AI Relationship - Sets relationships between groups of NPCs in the AI.

keyvalues.name: Subject(s)
keyvalues.desc: This is the NPC(s) whose disposition will change. May be a targetname or a classname.

keyvalues.name: Target(s)
keyvalues.desc: This is the NPC(s) about whom the Subject(s) will change their disposition. May be a targetname or a classname.

keyvalues.name: Disposition
keyvalues.desc: Choose the way the Subject(s) should feel about the Target(s)

keyvalues.name: Disposition Priority
keyvalues.desc: How much the Subject(s) should Like/Hate/Fear the Target(s). Higher priority = stronger feeling.

keyvalues.name: Reciprocal
keyvalues.desc: Set this to YES to have the new relationship mirrored by Target

inputs.name: ApplyRelationship
inputs.desc:
Apply relationship changes. This will change all Subject entities' relationships to all Target entities. 

IMPORTANT: Once you ApplyRelationships, this entity is then 'ALWAYS ON' until you send a Disable input or RevertRelationship input. During the time this entity is 'ON', any entities that spawn who match the Subject or Target names will be affected. 

IMPORTANT: Unpredictable results may occur when two ai_relationship entities refer to the same set or subset of target or subject entities. This situation should be avoided.

inputs.name: RevertRelationship
inputs.desc: Revert relationship changes. This will return the relationship to what it was at the time the ApplyRelationship input was called (or when this ai_relationship was spawned if StartActive is set).

inputs.name: RevertToDefaultRelationship
inputs.desc: Revert relationship changes to the default relationship, which may have changed since this ai_relationship was applied. This returns control of the entity relationship to the code.

desc: An entity that remaps a range of input values to a given range of output values.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the InValue input is received, with the remapped input value as the parameter.

desc: A math_counter variant that specializes in bitwise operations.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: The bits this entity should start with.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Adds bit(s) to this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtracts bit(s) to this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: ShiftLeft
inputs.desc: Shifts this entity's value to the left by the specified number and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: ShiftRight
inputs.desc: Shifts this entity's value to the right by the specified number and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Changes this entity's value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Changes this entity's value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes this entity to fire its OnGetValue output with its current bits. Used for polling the current bits when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: ContainsBits
inputs.desc: Tests whether this entity's current value contains at least one of the specified bit(s).

inputs.name: ContainsAllBits
inputs.desc: Tests whether this entity's current value contains all of the specified bit(s).

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the current bits when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired by ContainsBits when the current value contains the specified bit.

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired by ContainsBits when the current value does not contain the specified bit.

desc: Clamps a value between two values. Supports integers, floats, and vectors.

keyvalues.name: Max
keyvalues.desc: The maximum value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

keyvalues.name: Min
keyvalues.desc: The minimum value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: ClampValue
inputs.desc: Clamps the specified value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: SetMax
inputs.desc: Sets the max value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

inputs.name: SetMin
inputs.desc: Sets the max value. Can be an integer, a float, or a vector.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Outputs the clamped value.

outputs.name: OnBeforeMin
outputs.desc: Fires when a clamped value was before the minimum value. Outputs the clamped value.

outputs.name: OnBeyondMax
outputs.desc: Fires when a clamped value was beyond the maximum value. Outputs the clamped value.

desc: Used to create a blend between two colors for controlling the color of another entity.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values below this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Valid Input Value
keyvalues.desc: Input values above this value will be ignored.

keyvalues.name: Output RGB color when input is min.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Minimum Valid Input Value', this is the output RGB color.

keyvalues.name: Output RGB color when input is max.
keyvalues.desc: When the input value is equal to 'Maximum Valid Input Value', this is the output RGB color.

inputs.name: InValue
inputs.desc: Input a value and fire the output with the remapped value.

outputs.name: OutColor
outputs.desc: Fired when the InValue input is received, with the remapped RGB color as the parameter.

desc: Holds a numeric value and performs arithmetic operations upon it. If either the minimum or maximum legal value is nonzero, OutValue will be clamped to the legal range, and the OnHitMin/OnHitMax outputs will be fired at the appropriate times. If both min and max are set to zero, no clamping is performed and only the OutValue output will be fired.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: Starting value for the counter.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Minimum legal value for the counter. If min=0 and max=0, no clamping is performed.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Maximum legal value for the counter. If min=0 and max=0, no clamping is performed.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Add an amount to the counter and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Divide
inputs.desc: Divide the counter by an amount and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Multiply
inputs.desc: Multiply the counter by an amount and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the counter to a new value and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the counter to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtract an amount from the counter and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetHitMax
inputs.desc: Set the upper bound of the counter and fire the OutValue output with the current value.

inputs.name: SetHitMin
inputs.desc: Set the lower bound of the counter and fire the OutValue output with the current value.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes the counter fire its OnGetValue output with the current value of the counter. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: SetMaxValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the upper bound of the counter without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: SetMinValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Set the lower bound of the counter without firing any outputs.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes.

outputs.name: OnHitMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value meets or goes below the min value. The counter must go back above the min value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnHitMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value meets or exceeds the max value. The counter must go below the max value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes from the minimum value.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the counter value changes from the max value.

desc: A math_counter variant that specializes in vector operations.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: The vector this entity shuold start with.

inputs.name: Add
inputs.desc: Adds a vector to this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Divide
inputs.desc: Divides a vector from this entity's current value and fire the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Multiply
inputs.desc: Multiplies a vector from this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current vector to a new value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's current vector to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: Subtract
inputs.desc: Subtracts a vector from this entity's current value and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes this entity to fire its OnGetValue output with its current vector. Used for polling the counter when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: PointAtLocation
inputs.desc: Creates an angle pointing from the entity's current vector to the specified point and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: PointAtEntity
inputs.desc: Creates an angle pointing from the entity's current vector to the specified entity and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: VectorAngles
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector to an angle, assuming the current vector is a direction vector. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorForward
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the forward direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorRight
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the right direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: AngleVectorUp
inputs.desc: Converts this entity's vector angles to a vector in the up direction. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Normalize
inputs.desc: Normalizes this entity's vector and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: NormalizeAngles
inputs.desc: Normalizes this entity's vector as angles and fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: SetX
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: SetY
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: SetZ
inputs.desc: Sets this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: GetX
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: GetY
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: GetZ
inputs.desc: Gets this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: AddX
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: AddY
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: AddZ
inputs.desc: Adds to this entity's Z coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractX
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's X coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractY
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's Y coordinate.

inputs.name: SubtractZ
inputs.desc: Subtracts from this entity's Z coordinate.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes.

outputs.name: OutX
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting X coordinate.

outputs.name: OutY
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting Y coordinate.

outputs.name: OutZ
outputs.desc: Fired when the value changes, passing the resulting Z coordinate.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling this entity's current value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnGetX
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetX input.

outputs.name: OnGetY
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetY input.

outputs.name: OnGetZ
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetZ input.

desc: Continuously generates numbers using various generation modes based on material proxies.

keyvalues.name: Initial Value
keyvalues.desc: Starting value for the math_generate.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Minimum legal value for generation.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Legal Value
keyvalues.desc: Maximum legal value for generation.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 1
keyvalues.desc: Multi-purpose parameter #1 for the generation algorithms to use for their own needs.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 2
keyvalues.desc: Multi-purpose parameter #2 for the generation algorithms to use for their own needs.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets the math_generate to a new value and fires the OutValue output with the result, performing all generation from that value.

inputs.name: SetValueNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets the math_generate to a new value without firing any outputs.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Causes the math_generate to fire its OnGetValue output with the current value. Used for polling the value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

inputs.name: SetGenerateType
inputs.desc: Sets the type of generation this math_generate should perform.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles whether this entity is disabled.

inputs.name: SetHitMin
inputs.desc: Set minimum legal value for generation

inputs.name: SetHitMax
inputs.desc: Set maximum legal value for generation

inputs.name: SetParam1
inputs.desc: Set the value for parameter one

inputs.name: SetParam2
inputs.desc: Set the value for parameter two

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fires each tick while generation is active, passing the value continuously generated by the math_generate.

outputs.name: OnHitMin
outputs.desc: Fired when generation meets the min value. Generation must go back above the min value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnHitMax
outputs.desc: Fired when generation meets the max value. Generation must go below the max value before the output will fire again.

outputs.name: OnGetValue
outputs.desc: Fired in response to the GetValue input. Used for polling the value when you don't want constant updates from the OutValue output.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMin
outputs.desc: Fired when the current generation value changes from the minimum value.

outputs.name: OnChangedFromMax
outputs.desc: Fired when the current generation value changes from the maximum value.

desc:
A logic entity that attempts to replicate light patterns that can be used on named lights.

WARNING: This is currently out of sync with default light patterns. TODO: Fix that!

keyvalues.name: Appearance
keyvalues.desc: Which preset pattern to use.

keyvalues.name: Custom Appearance
keyvalues.desc: A custom pattern to use. a = fully dark, z = fully bright. This should always contain lowercase letters for light patterns. Uppercase letters or other types of characters won't work with actual light patterns. (although they shouldn't break the whole entity either)

keyvalues.name: Pattern Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed of the pattern.

inputs.name: SetStyle
inputs.desc: Sets the pattern from the style presets.

inputs.name: SetPattern
inputs.desc: Sets the pattern directly.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles this entity.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Outputs with a brightness equivalent to the current letter.

outputs.name: OutLetter
outputs.desc: Outputs with the current letter itself.

outputs.name: OnLightOn
outputs.desc: Fires when the current letter is equivalent to 'on' (greater than a).

outputs.name: OnLightOff
outputs.desc: Fires when the current letter is equivalent to 'off' (equal to a).

desc: A special version of math_counter with the ability to perform advanced calculations. Otherwise functions identically to math_counter.

keyvalues.name: Preserve Value?
keyvalues.desc: If set to 'Yes', calculations will fire OutValue with the resulting value, but the actual value stored in this entity will stay the same, allowing future calculations to use a constant value. If you want to change the value, you must use SetValueNoFire to set the counter's value or the PreserveValue input to toggle this feature. This also disables min/max functionality.

keyvalues.name: Always Output As Int
keyvalues.desc: If set to 'Yes', the stored value (and OutValue) will always be rounded to an integer before firing.

keyvalues.name: Lerp Percent
keyvalues.desc: The percentage used by the LerpTo input.

inputs.name: PreserveValue
inputs.desc: Sets whether this counter's value should be preserved after calculations. 1 = Yes, 0 = No

inputs.name: AlwaysOutputAsInt
inputs.desc: Sets whether this counter's value should always output as an integer. 1 = Yes, 0 = No

inputs.name: SetValueToPi
inputs.desc: Sets the counter's value to 3.14159265358979323846 and fires the OutValue output with it.

inputs.name: SquareRoot
inputs.desc: Calculates the square root of the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Power
inputs.desc: Raises the power of the counter's current value to this value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Round
inputs.desc: Rounds the counter's current value to the specified number place. For example, rounding 256 to 100 will round it to 300 and rounding 256 to 10 will round it to 260. Use 0 to round decimals to integers. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Floor
inputs.desc: Floors, or rounds down, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Ceil
inputs.desc: Ceils, or rounds up, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Trunc
inputs.desc: Truncates, or rounds toward zero, the counter's current value to the specified number place. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Sin
inputs.desc: Applies sine to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Cos
inputs.desc: Applies cosine to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: Tan
inputs.desc: Applies tangent to the counter's current value. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: RandomInt
inputs.desc: Generates a random integer between the specified bounds. Format = 'lowerbound upperbound', like '22 65'. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: RandomFloat
inputs.desc: Generates a random float between the specified bounds. Format = 'lowerbound upperbound', like '22.5 48.721'. Fires the OutValue output with the result.

inputs.name: LerpTo
inputs.desc: Lerps this counter's value to the specified value based on the lerp percent.

inputs.name: SetLerpPercent
inputs.desc: Sets the lerp percent.

desc: A lightweight entity that performs simple calculations on the fly without needing a complicated I/O chain. This is useful for values that are outputted on a per-frame basis and might not work with a math_counter chain.

keyvalues.name: Mod Value
keyvalues.desc: The value that is applied to input values.

keyvalues.name: Operator
keyvalues.desc: What calculation to perform with the mod value. (input value _ mod value)

inputs.name: SetMod
inputs.desc: Sets the mod value.

inputs.name: ModInt
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified integer.

inputs.name: ModFloat
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified float.

inputs.name: ModVector
inputs.desc: Applies modification to the specified vector.

inputs.name: SetOperator
inputs.desc: Sets the operator. Use +, -, *, or / to choose addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division respectively.

outputs.name: OutInt
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified integer.

outputs.name: OutFloat
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified float.

outputs.name: OutVector
outputs.desc: Outputs the modified vector.

desc: A damage filter that filters by the type of damage inflicted. This can only be used as a damage filter, not as an activator filter.

keyvalues.name: Damage Type
keyvalues.desc: The damage type to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only damage types that match will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all damage types EXCEPT those who match will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters a potential enemy entity by a set of criteria.

keyvalues.name: Name/Classname
keyvalues.desc: The classname or entity name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius by which to test the proximity of the enemy.  If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose distance is equal to or closer than the radius will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities outside the radius will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Outer Radius
keyvalues.desc: Enemies outside this radius are considered invalid if Allow is set and valid if Disallow is set.

keyvalues.name: Max Squadmates Per Enemy
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of squadmates allowed to target any given entity.

desc: A filter that filters by the class name of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Classname
keyvalues.desc: The class name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose class name matches the given string will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters by the name of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: The name to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose name matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose name matches the string will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that tests the activator against multiple filters. This allows you to build more complex filters, such as 'Allow anyone on Team 1 who is also class engineer', or 'Allow everyone except classes npc_zombie and npc_headcrab'.

keyvalues.name: Negate Outcome
keyvalues.desc:
Whether to negate the result of the subfilters, after combining them using the Logic Type chosen.
Negating the outcome using the AND logic type means that any subfilter must fail for this filter to pass.
Negating the outcome using the OR logic type means that all subfilters must fail for this filter to pass.

keyvalues.name: Filter 1
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 2
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 3
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 4
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 5
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 6
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 7
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 8
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 9
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

keyvalues.name: Filter 10
keyvalues.desc: Activator filter to test.

desc: A filter that tests the activator's surface data.

keyvalues.name: Surface
keyvalues.desc: The surface to test with.

keyvalues.name: Type
keyvalues.desc: What to actually filter by.

desc: A filter that filters by the model of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Model
keyvalues.desc: The model to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose model matches the given string will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose model matches the string will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Use this if you want to filter by skins as well. If you want any skin to be allowed, be sure to leave this at -1! It might automatically change when you choose a model.

desc: A filter that only accepts objects held by the player.
A filter that filters by the activator's keyfields.

keyvalues.name: Key
keyvalues.desc: The key name to filter by. Please note that certain keyvalues, particularly targetnames and base values related to clientside rendering (e.g. render mode), cannot be found by this filter.

keyvalues.name: Value (Optional)
keyvalues.desc: The key value to filter by. If empty, the filter will pass if the entity just has the keyfield.

desc: A filter that filters by the team of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Team Number
keyvalues.desc: The team number to filter by.  If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose team number matches the given team will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose team number matches the given team will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters by the mass of the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Mass
keyvalues.desc: The mass to filter by. If the filter mode is Allow, only entities whose mass is greater than the give float will pass the filter. If the filter mode is Disallow, all entities EXCEPT those whose mass is greater than the given float will pass the filter.

desc: A filter that filters based on the current paint power of the entity.

keyvalues.name: Paint Type
keyvalues.desc: The type of Gel to filter by. Used only in Colour mode.

keyvalues.name: Filter Mode
keyvalues.desc: The filter mode to filter the painted power by.

desc: A filter that filters by a context on the activator.

keyvalues.name: Filter Context
keyvalues.desc: The context(s) to filter by. Syntax is 'key:value,key:value'. Values in this field can use wilcards. For example, if this filter contains 'lastname:*', it will pass any entity with the context 'lastname', regardless of its value. Wildcards do not apply to context names and you cannot define the same context multiple times, but inputs like AddContext or RemoveContext can be used to add to the filter context.

keyvalues.name: Pass if entity has any of these contexts
keyvalues.desc: Should this filter only pass if the entity contains all of these contexts or can it pass if the entity has at least one of them?

inputs.name: AddContext
inputs.desc: Adds a context to this fitler's list of response contexts. The format should be 'key:value'.

inputs.name: RemoveContext
inputs.desc: Remove a context from this filter's list of response contexts. The name should match the 'key' of a previously added context.

inputs.name: ClearContext
inputs.desc: Removes all contexts in this filter's list of response contexts.

desc: A filter that tests whether the activator is within a volume.

keyvalues.name: Volume
keyvalues.desc: The volume to be tested with. This filter passes if the activator is within this volume. Intended to be a brush entity. (e.g. a trigger)

keyvalues.name: Volume Tester
keyvalues.desc: Who should be in the volume for the filter to pass?

desc: Base filter, which all other filters are based off of. This filter passes any entity whatsoever.

keyvalues.name: Filter Mode
keyvalues.desc: If set to Allow, only entities who match the criteria will pass the filter. If set to Disallow, only entities who do NOT match the criteria will pass the filter.

keyvalues.name: Pass caller when tested
keyvalues.desc: When tested with TestActivator or TestEntity, this causes the OnPass and OnFail outputs to use either this filter as the caller or the entity that called the test as the caller.

inputs.name: TestActivator
inputs.desc: Test the activator against the filter and fires OnPass or OnFail output.

inputs.name: TestEntity
inputs.desc: Tests the target entity against the specified entity and fires the OnPass or OnFail output.

inputs.name: SetField
inputs.desc: Sets this filter's primary test criteria. (e.g. the name to test against the activator)

outputs.name: OnPass
outputs.desc: Fired in response to TestActivator input if the activator passes the filter.

outputs.name: OnFail
outputs.desc: Fired in response to TestActivator input if the activator fails to pass the filter.

desc: Filter that checks the player's velocity

keyvalues.name: Dimension
keyvalues.desc: Which component of the entity's velocity to check

keyvalues.name: Match Mode
keyvalues.default: Match when at or above speed (0)
keyvalues.desc: How the entity's speed should be compared to the threshold

keyvalues.name: Check Horizontal Speed Along Yaw Angle
keyvalues.desc: In Specified Yaw Angle mode, compare against the component of the entity's horizontal velocity in this direction.

desc: A filter that filters by combine ball type.

Fires outputs when a map spawns. If 'Remove on fire' flag is set the logic_auto is deleted after firing. It can be set to check a global state before firing. This allows you to only fire events based on what took place in a previous map.

outputs.name: OnNewGame

outputs.name: OnLoadGame

outputs.name: OnMapTransition

outputs.name: OnMultiNewMap

outputs.name: OnMultiNewRound
outputs.desc: Fired only in multiplayer, when a new round is started. Only fired in multiplayer games that use round-based gameplay.

outputs.name: OnTrigger1

outputs.name: OnTrigger2

desc: Changes the server's timescale.

.

desc:
Compares an input to up to 16 preset values. If the input value is the same as any of the preset values, an output corresponding to that value is fired.

For example: if Case01 is set to 2 and Case02 is set to 5, and the input value is 5, the OnCase02 output will be fired.

This entity can also be used to select from a number of random targets via the PickRandom input. One of the OnCase outputs that is connected to another entity will be picked at random and fired.

keyvalues.name: Multiple case hits allowed
keyvalues.desc: If an input value matches a given case, are we allowed to test the rest of the cases or should we stop there? Don't worry about this if you're only using this entity for PickRandom.

keyvalues.name: Case 01
keyvalues.desc: If the input value matches this, fire the corresponding output.

keyvalues.name: Case 02
keyvalues.desc: If the input value matches this, fire the corresponding output.

desc: An entity that is used to set navigation properties on other entities. Useful to make NPCs ignore physics props in their way that they can easily push.

desc:
A message forwarder. Fires an OnTrigger output when triggered, and can be disabled to prevent forwarding outputs.

Useful as an intermediary between one entity and another for turning on or off an I/O connection, or as a container for holding a set of outputs that can be triggered from multiple places.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.desc: Trigger the relay, causing its OnTrigger output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: TriggerWithParameter
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay with a parameter, causing its OnTriggerParameter output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the relay between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: EnableRefire
inputs.desc: Allow this relay to trigger again quickly, if fast retrigger is disabled. This input allows the relay to fire again early if it is in this state.This is automatically triggered 0.01s after the last OnTrigger output.

outputs.name: OnSpawn
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is spawned. If the relay is set to only trigger once, it will delete itself after firing this output.

outputs.name: OnTrigger
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered. If the relay is set to only trigger once, it will delete itself after firing this output.

outputs.name: OnTriggerParameter
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered with a parameter. If the relay is set to only trigger once, it will delete itself after firing this output.

desc: A logic entity that could read an entity's response contexts. Use the target and context name keyvalues if you want to store a specific target and/or context. Use the 'Test' input to look for the context on the target. The 'OutValue' output will fire with the context's value if it is found.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: The entity with the context to measure.

keyvalues.name: Context Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of the context to measure.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Gets the stored context's value from stored target.

inputs.name: TestContext
inputs.desc: Tests the specified context against the target instead of using the stored context. Does not change the stored context.

inputs.name: TestTarget
inputs.desc: Tests the specified target against the context instead of using the stored target. Does not change the stored target.

inputs.name: SetContext
inputs.desc: Sets the context to measure.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Sets the stored target's stored context value to the specified string.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fires when a context is found. Passes its value.

outputs.name: OnFailed
outputs.desc: Fires when this entity fails to find the specified context.

desc: Tests a boolean value and fires an output based on whether the value is true or false. Use this entity to branch between two potential sets of events.

keyvalues.name: Initial value

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the boolean value without performing the comparison. Use this to hold a value for a future test.

inputs.name: SetValueTest
inputs.desc: Set the boolean value and test it, firing OnTrue or OnFalse based on the new value.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the boolean value between true and false.

inputs.name: ToggleTest
inputs.desc: Toggle the boolean value and tests it, firing OnTrue or OnFalse based on the new value.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Test the input value and fire OnTrue or OnFalse based on the value.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is true (nonzero).

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is false (zero).

desc: A general logic gate with two inputs. Supports AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, and XNOR operations, which can also be changed through inputs.

keyvalues.name: Compare mode
keyvalues.desc: The current compare mode. This can be changed through the SetMode input.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: When triggered, the current state will be outputted as OutValue.

inputs.name: SetStateA
inputs.desc: Sets the A state.

inputs.name: SetStateB
inputs.desc: Sets the B state.

inputs.name: SetMode
inputs.desc: Sets the mode. 0=AND,1=OR,2=NOT,3=NAND,4=NOR,5=XOR,6=XNOR

outputs.name: OnResultTrue
outputs.desc: Triggered when the state reaches true.

outputs.name: OnResultFalse
outputs.desc: Triggered when the state reaches false.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: When this entity is triggered by GetValue, this output will be called with the current state as the parameter

desc: Compares an input value to another value. If the input value is less than the compare value, the OnLessThan output is fired with the input value. If the input value is equal to the compare value, the OnEqualTo output is fired with the input value. If the input value is greater than the compare value, the OnGreaterThan output is fired with the input value.

keyvalues.name: Initial value
keyvalues.desc: Initial value for the input value.

keyvalues.name: Compare value
keyvalues.desc: The value to compare against.

keyvalues.name: Use string length
keyvalues.desc: Use the length of the string in the compare value rather than its actual value.

inputs.name: Compare
inputs.desc: Force a compare of the input value with the compare value.

inputs.name: SetValue
inputs.desc: Set the value that will be compared against the compare value.

inputs.name: SetValueCompare
inputs.desc: Set the value that will be compared against the compare value and performs the comparison.

inputs.name: SetCompareValue
inputs.desc: Set the compare value.

inputs.name: SetCompareValueCompare
inputs.desc: Sets the compare value and performs the comparison.

outputs.name: OnLessThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is less than the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnNotEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is different from the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThan
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnGreaterThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than or equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

outputs.name: OnLessThanOrEqualTo
outputs.desc: Fired when the input value is greater than or equal to the compare value. Sends the input value as data.

desc: An entity that is used to force an autosave.

keyvalues.desc: If set, the save will discard any savedata from previous levels, for the purpose of keeping savegame filesizes down. Can only be safely used if there is no way for the player to return to previous levels.

keyvalues.desc: Minimum hitpoints required to commit to save. The save will be made if you have at least Minimum Hit Points, but when the autosave timer expires, the autosave is only kept if you have at least Min Hitpoints to Commit.
