desc:
A special variant of logic_relay designed to queue trigger inputs. If the relay is still handling its I/O connections after being triggered, additional Trigger inputs will be queued and automatically fire when the relay is able to be re-fired. Activator, output ID, and parameter are all kept and saved. Inputs are added to the queue each time Trigger or TriggerWithParameter are received while the relay is disabled or still handling its current I/O connections. The first one in the queue will trigger the moment an opportunity becomes available and the next one in the queue will wait for that one.

This is useful for when you don't want something to happen multiple times at once, but don't want to discard further requests either.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Items
keyvalues.desc: The maximum number of Trigger and TriggerWithParameter inputs allowed in the queue. Any others received while this value is full will be discarded. Keep in mind this does not count the I/O chain currently being handled.

keyvalues.name: Don't queue when disabled
keyvalues.desc: Prevents the relay from queuing inputs when disabled. This means inputs will only be queued when enabled and still handling its current I/O connections.

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay, causing its OnTrigger output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: TriggerWithParameter
inputs.desc: Triggers the relay with a parameter, causing its OnTriggerParameter output to fire if it is enabled.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the relay between enabled and disabled.

inputs.name: EnableRefire
inputs.desc: If fast retrigger is disabled, the relay will not be able to fire again until its most delayed output has been fired. This input allows the relay to fire again early if it is in this state.This is automatically triggered 0.01s after the last OnTrigger output.

inputs.name: ClearQueue
inputs.desc: Clears the input queue.

inputs.name: SetMaxQueueItems
inputs.desc: Sets the maximum queue items.

outputs.name: OnTrigger
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered.

outputs.name: OnTriggerParameter
outputs.desc: Fired when the relay is triggered with a parameter.

desc: An entity that can measure the direction of an entity relative to another entity and apply that movement to a third entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Measure
keyvalues.desc: Entity whose direction you want to measure.

keyvalues.name: Measure Reference
keyvalues.desc: The direction of Entity to Measure will be measured from this entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Move
keyvalues.desc: This entity will be moved in the direction of the Entity to Measure.

keyvalues.name: Movement Reference
keyvalues.desc: The Entity to Move will move relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Trace scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale to *divide* the distance between the Entity to Measure and the trace's endpoint by before applying those movements to the Entity to Move. 1 = target entity moves to the end of the trace, 2 = target entity moves to the middle of the trace (half as far), and 0.5 = target entity moves twice as far as the trace.

keyvalues.name: Measurement Type
keyvalues.desc: How should the direction be measured?

keyvalues.name: Trace distance
keyvalues.desc: The maximum distance that the trace can go. 0 = no limit.

keyvalues.name: Trace Mask
keyvalues.default: MASK_SHOT (Anything that would be hit by a bullet) (1174421507)
keyvalues.desc: How the measurement tracing should act in regards to what it should collide with.

keyvalues.name: Collision Group
keyvalues.desc: The collision group the measurement tracing should use.

keyvalues.name: Trace Filter
keyvalues.desc: A filter to use for tracing.

keyvalues.name: Trace Filter behavior
keyvalues.desc: What the filter should actually be used for.

keyvalues.name: Additional trace from movement reference
keyvalues.desc: Initiates another trace from the Movement Reference using the existing properties and adjusts the position to its end point. Only use this if the Movement Reference is different from the Measure Reference.

inputs.name: SetMeasureTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Measure, whose movement should be measured.

inputs.name: SetMeasureReference
inputs.desc: Set the Measure Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Move, which will be moved to mimic the measured entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetReference
inputs.desc: Set the Movement Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetScale
inputs.desc: Set the scale to divide the measured movements by.

inputs.name: SetMeasureType
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement type.

inputs.name: SetMeasureAttachment
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement attachment.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the logic_measure_direction.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the logic_measure_direction.

inputs.name: SetTraceFilter
inputs.desc: Sets the entity to use as the trace filter. Pass in an empty string to clear the trace filter.

desc: An entity that fires a timer event at regular, or random, intervals. It can also be set to oscillate between a high and low end, in which case it will fire alternating high/low outputs each time it fires.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Random Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' is set, this is the minimum time between timer fires. The time will be a random number between this and the 'Maximum Random Interval'.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Random Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' is set, this is the maximum time between timer fires. The time will be a random number between the 'Minimum Random Interval' and this.

keyvalues.name: Refire Interval
keyvalues.desc: If 'Use Random Time' isn't set, this is the time between timer fires, in seconds.

inputs.name: RefireTime
inputs.desc: Set a new Refire Interval.

inputs.name: ResetTimer
inputs.desc: Reset the timer. It will fire after the Refire Interval expires.

inputs.name: FireTimer
inputs.desc: Force the timer to fire immediately.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the timer.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the timer.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the timer on/off.

inputs.name: LowerRandomBound
inputs.desc: Set a new Minimum Random Interval.

inputs.name: UpperRandomBound
inputs.desc: Set a new Maximum Random Interval.

inputs.name: AddToTimer
inputs.desc: Add time to the timer if it is currently enabled.  Does not change the Refire Interval.

inputs.name: SubtractFromTimer
inputs.desc: Subtract time from the timer if it is currently enabled.  Does not change the Refire Interval.

inputs.name: UseRandomTime
inputs.desc: 0 or 1, whether random time is enabled. If random time starts enabled and gets disabled here, the refire interval is set to the Maximum Random Interval.

outputs.name: OnTimer
outputs.desc: Fired when the timer expires.

outputs.name: OnTimerHigh
outputs.desc: Fired every other time for an oscillating timer.

outputs.name: OnTimerLow
outputs.desc: Fired every other time for an oscillating timer.

desc: An entity that can measure the movement of an entity relative to another entity and apply that movement to a third entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Measure
keyvalues.desc: Entity whose movement you want to measure.

keyvalues.name: Measure Reference
keyvalues.desc: The movement of Entity to Measure will be measured relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Entity to Move
keyvalues.desc: This entity will be moved to mimic the motions of Entity to Measure.

keyvalues.name: Movement Reference
keyvalues.desc: The Entity to Move will move relative to this entity.

keyvalues.name: Movement scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale to divide the measured movements by, before applying those movements to the Entity to Move. 1 = target entity moves as much as the measured entity, 2 = target entity moves half as far as the measured entity, and 0.5 = target entity moves twice as far as the measured entity.

keyvalues.name: Fire position outputs
keyvalues.desc: Allows OutPosition and OutAngles to be fired with the resulting position while this entity is active. Does not apply to the GetPosition input.

keyvalues.name: Measurement Attachment
keyvalues.desc: Only useful for the ''Attachment point'' measurement type. This attachment should be on the Entity to Measure and measurements will correspond to its position and angles.

inputs.name: SetMeasureTarget
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Measure, whose movement should be measured.

inputs.name: SetMeasureReference
inputs.desc: Set the Measure Reference entity.

inputs.name: Target
inputs.desc: Set the Entity to Move, which will be moved to mimic the measured entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetReference
inputs.desc: Set the Movement Reference entity.

inputs.name: SetTargetScale
inputs.desc: Set the scale to divide the measured movements by.

inputs.name: SetMeasureType
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement type.

inputs.name: SetMeasureAttachment
inputs.desc: Sets the measurement attachment.

inputs.name: ShouldOutputPosition
inputs.desc: Sets whether we are allowed to fire position outputs while this entity is active.

inputs.name: GetPosition
inputs.desc:
Initiates a single measurement with the current settings, only firing OutPosition and OutAngles without moving anything. (it doesn't need a target to be available)
This input ignores the 'Fire position outputs' keyvalue and instead repurposes it to modify who the outputs' activator should be.
If 'Fire position outputs' is enabled, the target will be used as the activator if it is available.
If 'Fire position outputs' is disabled, the activator that fired GetPosition will be used instead.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the logic_measure_movement.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the logic_measure_movement.

outputs.name: OutPosition
outputs.desc: Outputs the resulting position when allowed.

outputs.name: OutAngles
outputs.desc: Outputs the resulting angles when allowed.

desc: An entity that is used to look for opportunities to autosave.

keyvalues.name: Initiation Hit Points
keyvalues.desc: Start looking for an opportunity to save if player drops below this hitpoint level.

keyvalues.name: Trigger Hit Points
keyvalues.desc: If started looking for an opportunity, save when hitpoints reach this level.

keyvalues.name: Time to trigger
keyvalues.desc: If > 0, how long to try and get a save off before giving up.

keyvalues.name: Dangerous time
keyvalues.desc: If 0, just autosave. Otherwise, do an autosavedangerous with this time threshold.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the entity

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Enable the entity

desc:
Coordinates a sequence out of up to 16 preset values. If the input value matches the sequence's current case value, an output is fired and (by default) the sequence increments to the next case.

This is intended for things like passwords in keypads, which usually demand a specific combination of numbers.

keyvalues.name: Initial Case
keyvalues.desc: Which case to start on, meaning inputs will initially compare with this case. Uses the case's index. (e.g. 4 for Case 04)

keyvalues.name: Start Disabled
keyvalues.desc: If this entity is disabled, it will not accept any case tests. It will still accept other inputs, like SetSequenceIndex.

keyvalues.name: Suppress auto increment
keyvalues.desc: Prevents automatically incrementing the sequence each time a case passes.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables this entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles whether this entity is disabled.

inputs.name: InValue
inputs.desc: Tests the input value against the current case.

inputs.name: SetCurrentCase
inputs.desc: Sets the sequence's current case. This will fire OutCurCase.

inputs.name: SetCurrentCaseNoFire
inputs.desc: Sets the sequence's current case without firing OutCurCase.

inputs.name: IncrementSequence
inputs.desc: Increments the current case by the specified number. (1 if blank)

inputs.name: ResetSequence
inputs.desc: Resets the sequence to Case 01.

outputs.name: OutCurCase
outputs.desc: Fires each time the sequence's current case value changes, e.g. when it's incremented by a passing case.

outputs.name: OnCasePass
outputs.desc: Fires when a case is matched, passing the input value.

outputs.name: OnCaseFail
outputs.desc: Fires when a case fails, passing the input value.

outputs.name: OnSequenceComplete
outputs.desc: Fires when the last case is matched and sequence is complete.

desc: Plays a movie and allows for various playback options

desc: A powerful entity that can read the specified ConVar's value. It functions similarly to a logic_branch, except you could also output the value directly. Due to theoretical abuse, players have the option to disable logic_ConVar usage on a map. Use the 'OnDenied' output to prevent any issues from players who have disabled logic_ConVar.

keyvalues.name: ConVar
keyvalues.desc: The ConVar to read. Can be serverside or clientside(?)

keyvalues.name: Compare value
keyvalues.desc: The value to compare with the ConVar's value during comparisons. You could use <, !=, etc. at the beginning similar to a Response System criterion.

inputs.name: SetConVar
inputs.desc: Sets the ConVar whose variable will be retrieved.

inputs.name: SetTestValue
inputs.desc: Sets the value that will be compared with the ConVar variable during comparisons.

inputs.name: GetValue
inputs.desc: Retrieves the ConVar's value, firing OutValue with its value.

inputs.name: Test
inputs.desc: Compares the ConVar's value with the compare value.

outputs.name: OnTrue
outputs.desc: Fired when a comparison is true.

outputs.name: OnFalse
outputs.desc: Fired when a comparison is false.

outputs.name: OutValue
outputs.desc: Fired with the GetValue input. Passes the ConVar's current value.

outputs.name: OnDenied
outputs.desc: Fires when the ConVar is requested and logic_convar is not allowed by the server.

desc: Gets and outputs some model information from an entity.

inputs.name: SetTarget

inputs.name: GetNumSkins
inputs.desc: Gets the number of skins on the target entity.

inputs.name: LookupSequence
inputs.desc: Looks up the specified sequence on the target entity.

inputs.name: LookupActivity
inputs.desc: Looks up the specified activity on the target entity. Uses the sequence outputs and outputs the first sequence with the given activity.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterName
inputs.desc: Sets the pose parameter to target.

inputs.name: SetPoseParameterValue
inputs.desc: Sets the target pose parameter's current value.

inputs.name: GetPoseParameter
inputs.desc: Gets the current value of the target pose parameter and fires OutPoseParameterValue with it.

outputs.name: OutNumSkins
outputs.desc: Outputs number of skins.

outputs.name: OnHasSequence
outputs.desc: Fires when the target has the sequence requested. Outputs the sequence's index.

outputs.name: OnLacksSequence

outputs.name: OutPoseParameterValue
outputs.desc: Fires when the pose parameter value is requested, outputting its current value.

desc: Compares a set of inputs to each other. If they are all the same, fires an OnEqual output. If any are different, fires the OnNotEqual output. It is not possible to clear the memory, so this only works once.

keyvalues.name: Integer Value (optional)
keyvalues.desc: The value all inputs are compared to if ''Should use Reference Value'' is enabled.

keyvalues.name: Should use Integer Value
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, all inputs are compared to the reference value. If not enabled, they are instead compared to the last input added.

keyvalues.name: Use string length
keyvalues.desc: Use the length of the string in the compare value rather than its actual value.

inputs.name: InputValue
inputs.desc: Adds a value to our set of inputs and fires CompareValues automatically, comparing existing inputs to this one if set to do so.

inputs.name: CompareValues
inputs.desc: Compares the values and fires appropriate outputs.

outputs.name: OnEqual
outputs.desc: Fires if all of the values are equal.

outputs.name: OnNotEqual
outputs.desc: Fires if any of the values are not equal.

desc: An entity that acts as a container for scripts.

Formats a line of text akin to C# String.Format.
As curly brackets cannot be used in the help window, please see Mapbase documentation for clear instructions.

keyvalues.name: Input Value
keyvalues.desc: The input value. Should contain {0}, {1}, etc, which will be replaced by the parameters and then output as OutFormattedValue.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 0
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {0} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 1
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {1} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 2
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {2} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 3
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {3} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 4

keyvalues.name: Parameter 5
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {5} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 6
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {6} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Parameter 7
keyvalues.desc: Will replace all instances of {7} in the input value.

keyvalues.name: Backup Parameter
keyvalues.desc: If an invalid parameter is used (e.g. null parameter or asks for a parameter beyond {7}), then this will be used instead. Otherwise just uses '<null>'.

inputs.name: GetFormattedValue
inputs.desc: Fires OutFormattedValue, which passes the formatted input value.

inputs.name: SetInputValue
inputs.desc: Sets the input value. Should contain {0}, {1}, etc. enclosed by curly brackets, which will be replaced by the parameters and then output as OutFormattedValue.

inputs.name: SetParameter0
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {0}.

inputs.name: SetParameter1
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {1}.

inputs.name: SetParameter2

inputs.name: SetParameter3
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {3}.

inputs.name: SetParameter4
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {4}.

inputs.name: SetParameter5
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {5}.

inputs.name: SetParameter6
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {6}.

inputs.name: SetParameter7
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all instances of {7}.

inputs.name: SetBackupParameter
inputs.desc: Sets the text that will replace all invalid parameters.

outputs.name: OutFormattedValue

desc: An entity used to override player input when the player is looking at it.

outputs.name: YAxis
outputs.desc: An output that fires whenever the Y axis of the player's input changes. i.e. -1 when the player has backward key down, 1 when the player has forward key down, and 0 if neither.

desc:
A navigation node for ground moving NPCs that includes some context information for NPCs that are interested in it. The hint might indicate a window that could be looked out of, or an item of interest that could be commented on. Many hint nodes are NPC-specific, so it's helpful to use naming conventions like 'Crow: Fly to point' in the hint choices list. The angles of a hint node indicate what direction the NPC should face to perform the hint behavior.

It's important to understand the distinction between scripts, such as scripted_sequence and scripted_schedule, and info_hint entities. Scripts summon NPCs to specific cue points to play their parts, while hints provide context information to the AI that they use to perform their behaviors. Hints require code support in the NPC, while scripts are generic and may require only animations to play. Use a hint if the behavior is driven by the AI, use a script if the behavior is driven by the map.

outputs.name: OnNPCStartedUsing
outputs.desc: Fired when an NPC has reached this node and started using it. Passes along the NPC.

outputs.name: OnNPCStoppedUsing
outputs.desc: Fired when an NPC has stopped using this node. Passes along the NPC.

desc: An entity that can be used to change the lighting origin of a prop_static. Set the prop_static's Lighting Origin to point at this entity to make the prop_static light as if it was at the info_lighting's origin.  Good for prop_static entities that are embedded in world geometry (like rocks/windows/etc).
Determines game various rules for gameplay

keyvalues.name: Equip long-fall boots
keyvalues.desc: Disabling this will essentially enable fall damage

keyvalues.name: Co-op Game type
keyvalues.desc: Sets the co-op game type. This is ignored if the game isn't running in co-op mode.

desc: Portal Placement Helper, indicates where portals will snap to. The arrow points to the 'up' diection for the portal.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius in which to influence placement.

keyvalues.name: Proxy Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity we want to use for our real placement position.

keyvalues.name: Attach Entity Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity we want to force our attachment to. Ensures this applies to the correct brush. Needs parent!

keyvalues.name: Use helper's angles
keyvalues.desc: Portals will lock to the angles, instead of rotating in all directions.

keyvalues.name: Force Placement
keyvalues.desc: Force portals to lock to this helper, no matter what. With this disabled the helper will automatically deactivate temporarily, so that you can place portals finely.

outputs.name: OnObjectPlaced
outputs.desc: A portal has been successfully placed using us as a guide.

outputs.name: OnObjectPlacedSize
outputs.desc: When a portal is successfully placed, this sends the scale level as an out value

desc: A navigation node for flying NPCs that includes some context information for NPCs that are interested in it. The hint might indicate a window that could be looked into, or an item of interest that could be commented on. Many hint nodes are NPC-specific, so it's helpful to use naming conventions like 'Crow: Fly to point' in the hint choices list. The angles of a hint node indicate what direction the NPC should face to perform the hint behavior.

This entity indicates the position and facing direction at which the player will spawn. Any number of info_player_start entities may be placed in a map for when working in cordoned-off portions of the map. When multiple info_player_start entities are present in a map, set the 'Master' spawnflag on one of them to indicate which one should be used when running the entire map.

A dynamic connection between two navigation nodes. You specify the node IDs of the start and end nodes, and then you can use entity I/O to turn on and off the connection. This could be used to create or destroy a connection in the nodegraph because of some event in your map (a bridge being created/destroyed, etc).

keyvalues.name: Start node ID
keyvalues.desc: The node ID of one end of the node connection.

keyvalues.name: End node ID
keyvalues.desc: The node ID of one end of the node connection.

keyvalues.name: Allow Pass When Off
keyvalues.desc: Entity or class to allow passage even when node is off

keyvalues.name: Invert exclusion rules
keyvalues.desc: Allowed entity is the only entity NOT allowed when this is set to 'yes'

keyvalues.name: Precise Movement
keyvalues.desc: Movement through this link must be precise. Used for NPCs that have sloppy movement characteristics to move through things like doors or windows

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the link on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn the link off.

desc: An entity that can use point_cameras to render images for materials used by entities. inputs.name: SetCamera

inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to start emitting.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to stop emitting.

inputs.name: StopPlayEndCap
inputs.desc: Tell the particle system to stop emitting and play its End Cap Effect.

inputs.name: DestroyImmediately
inputs.desc: Destroy the particle system and remove all particles immediately.

desc: An entity used to attach constraints to a local position on an entity. Usually constraints will attach to the center of mass of an object. Attach the desired constraint to this entity, and then parent this entity to the entity you want the constraint to apply to.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: Amount to scale the mass of this body in the constraint solver.

desc: Player spawns for cooperative mode.

keyvalues.name: Player
keyvalues.desc: Which player to spawn.

keyvalues.name: [H] Player
keyvalues.desc: The player model to show in Hammer.

keyvalues.name: Force Gun On Spawn
keyvalues.desc: Give the player a Portal Gun on spawn. Coop players always have a Dual Portal Device.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable the spawn point to be used.

inputs.name: SetAsActiveSpawn
inputs.desc: Enable the spawn point to be used, disabling all other spawn points that do not share the same name.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable the spawn point from being used.

inputs.name: SetTeam
inputs.desc: Set the player this spawn point is for - 0 and 1 are any player, 2 is P-Body, 3 is ATLAS.

desc: An entity that's immediately removed on spawning. Useful as a spotlight target.
An entity that overrides the mass center of the target physics object, by moving it to the info_mass_center's location. This kills itself on spawn.

keyvalues.name: Target object
keyvalues.desc: The entity whose mass center will be overridden.

desc: Exit landmark
Entity that, when seen, generates a simple game event.

keyvalues.name: Event Name
keyvalues.desc: The event to trigger by name from modevents.res

keyvalues.name: Range
keyvalues.desc: Distance that the player must be before the event is generated.

inputs.name: GenerateGameEvent
inputs.desc: Generate my game event. (This entity is sent as the SUBJECT)

desc: An entity that controls all connections between nodes that intersect the controller's volume. This allows for mass enabling/disabling of all node connections through a volume.

keyvalues.name: Use Larger Radius (for air links)
keyvalues.desc: Set this to 'Yes' if this controller is intended to control air links. Air links connect using a larger search radius so leaving this at 'No' might miss some air links.

keyvalues.name: Allow Pass When Off
keyvalues.desc: Entity or class to allow passage even when node is off

keyvalues.name: Invert exclusion rules
keyvalues.desc: Allowed entity is the only entity NOT allowed when this is set to 'yes'

inputs.name: TurnOn
inputs.desc: Turn the link on.

inputs.name: TurnOff
inputs.desc: Turn the link off.

inputs.name: SetAllowed
inputs.desc: Change the allowed pass when off

inputs.name: SetInvert
inputs.desc: Change the invert exclusion rule

desc: Jalopy Radar Beacon

keyvalues.name: Effective Radius
keyvalues.desc: How close the Jalopy must be to detect this beacon. If this radius is -1, the range is infinite.

desc: Entry landmark
A navigation node for ground moving NPCs. Navigation nodes are baked into the nodegraph so that NPCs can move to them. Ground nodes fall to the ground when they spawn.
Vehicle Transition Point
A climb-node for AI navigation. Only usable by NPCs that can climb.
Detects a specific Co-op player's pings, and optionally rotates a func_tank to face towards them (as seen in the Calibration Course)

keyvalues.name: Func_Tank Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the func_tank that will be told to look at the ping location when detected.

keyvalues.name: Player to Observe
keyvalues.desc: Which player's pings to look at.

keyvalues.name: Default State
keyvalues.desc: Is this entity enabled by default or not?

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Starts listening for pings and will fire outputs when found.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable this entity from listening for pings.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle from Enabled to Disabled and vice versa.

outputs.name: OnPingDetected
outputs.desc: Fired when a ping is detected.

desc: Countdown timer for the teleporter. The status of the teleporter will appear on vgui_screen entities whose panel is 'teleport_countdown_screen'.

inputs.name: StartCountdown
inputs.desc: Starts the teleporter countdown. Requires an argument which is the number of seconds for the countdown.

inputs.name: StopCountdown
inputs.desc: Stops the countdown permanently

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Pauses the countdown due to a temporary malfunction. A warning sign will appear on the linked vgui screens.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Restarts the countdown since the malfunction is finished.

desc: A generic target that gets replicated to the client for hud hint targeting.

A hint that is not used for navigation. They don't go into the nodegraph, nor do they fall to the ground. Use these to provide some spatial context for NPCs, such as 'look here if you can't find the player' or 'throw rocks at this spot'.
Use this entity to mark surfaces that shouldn't receive dynamic shadows. Useful to apply to walls and floors where shadows are drawn improperly, giving away the location of enemies.
Sniper Target

An entity that acts as a landmark for transitions to another level. There should be a corresponding info_landmark entity in the next map. Entities will be transitioned to the next level relative to the info_landmark entities.
This entity automatically severs node connections that pass through its radius. If it moves, it will restore those connections.
An entity that does nothing. Very useful as a positioning entity for other entities to refer to (i.e. the endpoint of an env_beam)
An entity that places an overlay on the world.

keyvalues.name: Material
keyvalues.desc: Material to use for the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Brush faces
keyvalues.desc: The brush faces this overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Render Order
keyvalues.desc: Higher values render after lower values. This value can be 0-3.

keyvalues.name: U Start
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the starting X axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: U End
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the ending X axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: V Start
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the starting Y axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: V End
keyvalues.desc: A value between 0-1, defining the ending Y axis position in the overlay material.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis Origin(Read-Only)
keyvalues.desc: Center of the overlay on the surface(s) the overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis U
keyvalues.desc: The direction the X-axis of the material points.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis V
keyvalues.desc: The direction the Y-axis of the material points.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Basis Normal(Read-Only)
keyvalues.desc: Normal of the surface(s) the overlay is applied to.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 1
keyvalues.desc: Corner 1 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 2
keyvalues.desc: Corner 2 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 3
keyvalues.desc: Corner 3 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Overlay Point 4
keyvalues.desc: Corner 4 of the overlay.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the overlay starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist).

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which the overlay is visible (0 = don't fade out).

desc: An entity to handle endpoints for multiple ladders that are too close to each other.

keyvalues.name: Ladder Name
keyvalues.desc: If multiple ladders are near multiple endpoints, use this to stop them from interfering with each other.

desc: An entity that defines an intermission spot where dead players will float until they respawn.

keyvalues.name: Entity to look at
keyvalues.desc: Name of entity that dead players will face while in intermission at this spot.

desc: Alternate classname for prop_ragdoll

keyvalues.name: Does the prop glow by default?
Glow Color (R G B)

inputs.name: SetGlowDisabled

inputs.name: SetGlowColor
inputs.desc: Change the glow's color. Format: <Red 0-255> <Green 0-255> <Blue 0-255>

inputs.name: GlowColorRedValue
inputs.desc: Sets the glow red color channel's value (0 - 255).

inputs.name: GlowColorGreenValue

inputs.desc: Sets the glow blue color channel's value (0 - 255).

desc: Alternate class for the Stiderbuster/Magnusson Device
Generic Choreo vehicle used for scripted events.

keyvalues.name: World model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Move Parent on Exit
keyvalues.desc: Should the player ignore this vehicle's move parent when performing exit checks?

keyvalues.name: Ignore Player collision
keyvalues.desc: The player won't collide against this vehicle when moving around.

keyvalues.name: Can the player shoot
keyvalues.desc: Lets the player shoot their weapon while in the vehicle

keyvalues.name: Use attachment eyes
keyvalues.desc: Should the driver's view use the attachment's orientation and not blend in the player's look.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Plays the vehicle's open animation and unlocks the vehicle for entry or exit.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Plays the vehicle's close animation and locks the vehicle for entry or exit.

inputs.name: EnterVehicle
inputs.desc: Forces the activator (or player) into the vehicle.

inputs.name: EnterVehicleImmediate
inputs.desc: Forces the activator (or player) into the vehicle without enter/exit animations.

inputs.name: ExitVehicle
inputs.desc: Boots the player out of the vehicle.

inputs.name: Viewlock
inputs.desc: Set true to prevent the player from looking around *at all*. Set false to let them look within limits.

inputs.name: SetAnimation
inputs.desc: Force the prop to play an animation. The parameter should be the name of the animation.

inputs.name: SetCanShoot
inputs.desc: Set if the driver can shoot their weapon.

inputs.name: SetMaxPitch
inputs.desc: Set max pitch for driver.

inputs.name: SetMinPitch
inputs.desc: Set min pitch for driver.

inputs.name: SetMaxYaw
inputs.desc: Set max yaw for driver.

inputs.name: SetMinYaw
inputs.desc: Set min yaw for driver.

inputs.name: UseAttachmentEyes
inputs.desc: Force the view to use the attachment's orientation and position and don't blend in the player's look.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the vehicle is open enough to enter.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Fired when the vehicle is too closed to enter.

desc: A prop that physically simulates and can be articulated with internal joints. The joint constraints are part of the physics model.

keyvalues.name: Override Animation
keyvalues.desc: Filled in by the engine via hammer_update_entity, do not edit by hand except to clear.

inputs.name: StartRagdollBoogie
inputs.desc: Begins ragdoll boogie effect. Parameter override = number of seconds to boogie.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Enable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Disable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: FadeAndRemove
inputs.desc: Fade out then remove (kill) self. Parameter override = duration of fade

desc: Spawns futbols. Will re-create a futbol when its created futbol breaks.

desc: A prop that physically simulates as a single rigid body. It can be constrained to other physics objects using hinges or other constraints. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_dynamic (i.e. it should not be physically simulated) then it cannot normally be used as a prop_physics. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_physics_override instead.

keyvalues.name: Allow Portal Funneling
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not this object should auto-funnel into a portal.

inputs.name: DestroyLinkController
inputs.desc: Destroys the link controller created by CreateLinkController.

inputs.name: EnableHazardLights
inputs.desc: Enables the vehicles's hazard lights.

inputs.name: DisableHazardLights
inputs.desc: Disables the vehicles's hazard lights.

inputs.name: StartRemoveTauCannon
inputs.desc: Start the tau removal sequence.

inputs.name: FinishRemoveTauCannon
inputs.desc: Finish the tau removal sequence.

outputs.name: OnCompanionEnteredVehicle
outputs.desc: Companion has entered the vehicle.

outputs.name: OnCompanionExitedVehicle
outputs.desc: Companion has exited the vehicle.

outputs.name: OnHostileEnteredVehicle
outputs.desc: Hostile has entered the vehicle.

outputs.name: OnHostileExitedVehicle
outputs.desc: Hostile has exited the vehicle.

desc: Aperture Science Weighted Cube. Presses floor buttons, and can be moved around.

keyvalues.name: Cube Type
keyvalues.desc: What cube type is this? Use a prop_monster_box for FrankenTurrets. If set to Custom, use AddOutput to change it back OnMapSpawn so gel skins behave correctly.

keyvalues.name: Skin Type
keyvalues.desc: Is the cube clean or rusty? Storage and Reflection cubes are the only types with a rusty version.

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: The model to show in Hammer, or a custom model for cube type 6.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: The old skin property, mainly to show in Hammer.

keyvalues.name: Starting paint
keyvalues.desc: The cube starts painted with the set gel.

keyvalues.name: Allow Portal Funneling
keyvalues.desc: Whether or not this object should auto-funnel into a floor portal.

keyvalues.name: Use new skins
keyvalues.desc: Use the values in the Cube Type and Skin Type fields instead of the Skin(OLD) field. You shouldn't need to touch this.

keyvalues.name: Use Laser Modifier
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, this cube will recolor incoming lasers to the modifier color.

keyvalues.name: Laser Modifier Color
keyvalues.desc: Set reflected lasers to this color. Only applicable to reflection and Schrodinger cubes. You can also specify a custom RGBA color here.

keyvalues.name: Use Laser Filter
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, this cube can only redirect lasers that match the filter color. If disabled, any laser color can be redirected.

keyvalues.name: Laser Filter Color
keyvalues.desc: Filter reflected lasers by this color. Only applicable to reflection and Schrodinger cubes. You can also specify a custom RGBA color here.

inputs.name: EnablePortalFunnel
inputs.desc: Enable portal funneling behavior.

inputs.name: DisablePortalFunnel
inputs.desc: Disable portal funneling behavior.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Allow physics simulation.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Prevent Physics simulation, freezing the cube in place.

inputs.name: SetPaint
inputs.desc: Force the cube to be painted with 0 (Repulsion), 2 (Propulsion), or 4 (No) gel.

inputs.name: Dissolve
inputs.desc: Fizzles the cube, firing the OnFizzled output.

inputs.name: SilentDissolve
inputs.desc: Kills the cube immediately and fires its OnFizzled output.

inputs.name: ExitDisabledState
inputs.desc: Exits the disabled state of a reflective cube.

inputs.name: SetReflectModifyColor
inputs.desc: Changes the laser modifier colour of the cube.

inputs.name: SetReflectFilterColor
inputs.desc: Changes the laser filter colour of the cube.

inputs.name: EmitLaser
inputs.desc: Makes this cube emit or stop emitting its own laser.

outputs.name: OnFizzled
outputs.desc: Fired when a cube is fizzled.

outputs.name: OnOrangePickUp
outputs.desc: P-Body picked up the cube.

outputs.name: OnBluePickUp
outputs.desc: ATLAS picked up the cube.

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Any player picked up the cube.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunDrop
outputs.desc: Any player dropped the cube.

outputs.name: OnPainted
outputs.desc: Cube got painted, only if the state changed. Has the paint type as parameter.

outputs.name: OnPowered
outputs.desc: Cube got powered by a laser.

outputs.name: OnUnpowered
outputs.desc: Cube is no longer powered by a laser.

outputs.name: OnActivated
outputs.desc: Fired when a cube is placed on a button.

outputs.name: OnDeactivated
outputs.desc: Fired when a cube is removed from a button.

desc: A basic mirror model

keyvalues.name: Width
keyvalues.desc: The width of the mirror when there's no model

keyvalues.name: Height
keyvalues.desc: The height of the mirror when there's no model

keyvalues.name: Physics
keyvalues.desc: Move physically

desc: A stationary rocket turret that fires a rocket when players walk in front of it.

keyvalues.name: Rocket Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed the rocket will travel at.

keyvalues.name: Rocket Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: The rocket will automatically detonate after this number of seconds.

inputs.name: ForceFire
inputs.desc: Forces the rocket turret to fire.

inputs.name: EnableTripwire
inputs.desc: Enables the rocket turret.

inputs.name: DisableTripwire
inputs.desc: Disables the rocket turret.

outputs.name: OnTripped
outputs.desc: Fires when the laser has been tripped

outputs.name: OnRocketExplode
outputs.desc: Fires when the rocket explodes.

desc: Portal Door.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from for this door, instead of the origins.

keyvalues.name: Area Portal Window Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of an area portal window that is controlled by the door. When closed, the window will be forced shut

keyvalues.name: Fade Area Portal?
keyvalues.desc: If the area portal should use the specified fade distances to fade out. Otherwise, it will be set to a distance of 10000 (effectively infinite).

keyvalues.name: Fade Start Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance at which the area portal starts fading out.

keyvalues.name: Fade End Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance at which the area portal turns completely opaque.

keyvalues.name: Start Open
keyvalues.desc: If set, the door starts in the open state.

keyvalues.name: Start Locked
keyvalues.desc: If set, the door starts locked and can no longer change open or closed state.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Skin to use in game

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use in-game

keyvalues.name: <Default Animation>
keyvalues.desc: Ignore, needed to prevent the close animation from looping in Hammer

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door and cause the areaportal to return to fading.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door and cause the areaportal to close.

inputs.name: LockOpen
inputs.desc: Open the door and lock it in that state, so it will ignore further inputs.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Locking a door will prevent the Open or Close inputs from doing anything.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: If locked, unlocking a door will allow the Open or Close inputs to function.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its open animation.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Called when the door has started its close animation.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Called when the door has finished its open animation.

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Called when the door has finished its close animation.

desc: A prop that doesn't move and doesn't animate.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: Specify the model to place.

keyvalues.name: Skin
keyvalues.desc: Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.

keyvalues.name: Alpha
keyvalues.desc: Alpha of the fade, where 0 = fully transparent and 255 = fully opaque.

keyvalues.name: Uniform Scale Override
keyvalues.desc: Resize the static prop uniformly.

keyvalues.name: Scale Override
keyvalues.desc: Resize the static prop.

keyvalues.name: Disable Prop Combine
keyvalues.desc: Prevent this static prop from combining with any other static props in vbsp.

keyvalues.name: Disable Vertex lighting
keyvalues.desc: Disable per-vertex lighting on this prop.

keyvalues.name: Disable Self-Shadowing
keyvalues.desc: When vertex lighting is enabled, prevent the geometry from self-shadowing -- casting shadows onto itself.

keyvalues.name: Ignore Surface Normal
keyvalues.desc: When vertex lighting is enabled, ignore the surface normal of faces when calculating the vertex lighting. Useful for thin, translucent objects such as leaves on foliage props.

keyvalues.name: Enable Bounced Lighting
keyvalues.desc: Whether VRAD should create indirect lighting from this prop.

keyvalues.name: Render in Fast Reflections
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, causes this entity/prop to to render in fast water reflections (i.e. when a water material specifies $reflectonlymarkedentities) and in the world impostor pass.

keyvalues.name: Lighting Origin
keyvalues.desc: Select an info_lighting to specify a location to sample lighting from, instead of using this entity's origin.

keyvalues.name: Screen Space Fade
keyvalues.desc: The method by which the fading distance should be determined. If 'No', the fade distances is the distance from the player's view to the object, in units. If 'Yes', the fade distance is the size of the object onscreen, in pixels.

keyvalues.name: Start Fade Dist/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which the prop starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it starts to fade.

keyvalues.name: End Fade Dist/Pixels
keyvalues.desc: Maximum distance at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). If 'Screen Space Fade' is selected, this represents the *minimum* number of pixels wide covered by the prop when it fades.

keyvalues.name: Fade Scale
keyvalues.desc: If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified.This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances.

desc: A variant of prop_physics which has a perfect sphere shape. It is normally restricted to a radius of 12 units.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: The size of the sphere collision.

desc: Special version of prop_scalable, used for EP1's Combine Dark Energy Reactor. To be rendered correctly, this must be placed at (2688, 12139, 517).

inputs.name: SetScaleX
inputs.desc: Scales the coreball in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

inputs.name: SetScaleY
inputs.desc: Scales the coreball in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

inputs.name: SetScaleZ
inputs.desc: Scales the coreball in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

desc: A button which is activated by player use or by game inputs, for use in underground test chambers. Uses different press/release sounds compared to the modern one. The same tick-tock noise is used to indicate limited time.

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use in game.

desc: Scalable Prop

inputs.name: SetScaleX
inputs.desc: Scales the prop in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

inputs.name: SetScaleY
inputs.desc: Scales the prop in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

inputs.name: SetScaleZ
inputs.desc: Scales the prop in one Axis. Params: <New Size> <Time>

desc: Telescopic Arm. Useless.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable Thumper

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable Thumper

inputs.name: SetTarget

inputs.name: TargetPlayer
inputs.desc: Set the player as the entity to target.

outputs.name: OnFoundTarget
outputs.desc: Arm has direct LOS to target entity.

outputs.name: OnLostTarget
outputs.desc: Arm has lost direct LOS to target entity.

desc: Driveable airboat.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: Set the model used by the airboat.

keyvalues.name: Has Gun
keyvalues.desc: Whether the airboat's gun is enabled or disabled.

inputs.name: EnableGun
inputs.desc: Enables or disables the airboat gun and associated crosshair.

inputs.name: InputStartRotorWashForces
inputs.desc: The airboat will start to be blown around by the helicopter rotor wash.

inputs.name: InputStopRotorWashForces
inputs.desc: The airboat will no longer be blown around by the helicopter rotor wash.

inputs.name: ExitVehicle
inputs.desc: Force the player to exit the airboat

desc: A variant of prop_physics which will permit using models that do not have physics data compiled into them, like static or dynamic models. Health and physics data can be overridden on this version, to substitute for the missing info.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking.  0 means don't break.

desc: Discouragement Beam Relay that detects lasers, whilst allowing it to pass through and hit other Relays. The entity will fire outputs when struck and unstruck.

keyvalues.name: Laser Relay Model
keyvalues.desc: Choose a custom model for the relay.

keyvalues.name: Use Laser Filter
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, this relay can only be activated by the specified laser color.

keyvalues.name: Laser Filter Color
keyvalues.desc: Filter lasers by this color. You can also specify a custom RGBA color here.

inputs.name: SetFilterColor
inputs.desc: Changes the laser filter colour.

outputs.name: OnPowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser hits the target.

outputs.name: OnUnpowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser has stopped hitting the target.

desc: A way to attach one studio model to another as an ornament. It will render in the way that player/NPC weapons render.

keyvalues.name: Target Entity
keyvalues.desc: Name of the entity that this ornament should attach to, at startup.

inputs.name: SetAttached
inputs.desc: Attach the ornament to a different entity. Parameter should be the name of entity to attach to.

inputs.name: Detach
inputs.desc: Detach from the Target Entity and become invisible. The ornament can be re-attached with the SetAttached input.

desc: Driveable studiomodel crane.

keyvalues.name: World Model
keyvalues.desc: Set the model used by the crane.

keyvalues.name: Magnet entity
keyvalues.desc: A phys_magnet to hang from the end of the crane. Must be set for the crane to spawn.

inputs.name: ForcePlayerIn
inputs.desc: Force the player to get into the crane. Only works in singleplayer.

desc: A portal.

keyvalues.name: Start Activated
keyvalues.desc: An inactive portal will not be drawn and will not teleport entites

keyvalues.name: Portal Number
keyvalues.desc: Which of the pair is this portal?

keyvalues.name: Portal Group
keyvalues.desc: Portal pair ID that it belongs to, 0=SP, 1=ATLAS, 2=P-Body

keyvalues.name: Hammer Skin
keyvalues.desc: Which portal to show as?

inputs.name: SetName
inputs.desc: Naming your portals is fun

inputs.name: SetActivatedState
inputs.desc: An inactive portal will not be drawn and will not teleport entites

inputs.name: Fizzle
inputs.desc: Makes a cool visual fizzle and properly shuts down the portal

inputs.name: NewLocation
inputs.desc: Sets this portals location and angles. This expects 6 floats with space delimiters, the format is 'x y z pitch yaw roll'

inputs.name: Resize
inputs.desc: Resizes the portal. Format is 'halfwidth halfheight'

inputs.name: SetLinkageGroupId
inputs.desc: Sets the portal linkage ID.  If portal is open it will close and reopen with new portal linked.

outputs.name: OnPlacedSuccessfully
outputs.desc: When a portal is placed without failure, this output is fired.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportFromMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this portal to the linked partner.

outputs.name: OnEntityTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When any entity is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

outputs.name: OnPlayerTeleportToMe
outputs.desc: When the player is teleported from this linked partner to the portal.

desc: Discouragement Beam Catcher that detects a laser, absorbing the beam. The entity will fire outputs when struck and unstruck.

keyvalues.name: Skin Type
keyvalues.desc: Set the type of catcher to use.

keyvalues.name: [H] Skin Type
keyvalues.desc: The skin to show in Hammer.

keyvalues.name: Laser Catcher Model
keyvalues.desc: Is the catcher offset? (You can also add a custom model here.)

keyvalues.name: Fix Skins Logic
keyvalues.desc: If set, add extra outputs to fix the bug with skins not changing after a reload from save.

keyvalues.name: Use Laser Filter
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, this catcher can only be activated by the specified laser color.

keyvalues.name: Laser Filter Color
keyvalues.desc: Filter lasers by this color. You can also specify a custom RGBA color here.

inputs.name: Skin
inputs.desc: Set the skin of the catcher manually.

inputs.name: SetFilterColor
inputs.desc: Changes the laser filter colour.

outputs.name: OnPowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser hits the target.

outputs.name: OnUnpowered
outputs.desc: Fired when a laser has stopped hitting the target.

desc: A floor button which is activated by a prop_weighted_cube.

keyvalues.name: Button model
keyvalues.desc: Model to be used in game

keyvalues.name: Accepts Balls
keyvalues.desc: Do Edgeless Safety Cubes activate this? Should almost always be No unless no balls are in the map.

desc: A variant of prop_dynamic that permits the use of any model, including those designed to be used as prop_physics/prop_static.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking.  0 means don't break.

desc: The P1 personality cores for GlaDOS. Resemble little eyeballs with handles. These play lines and look around when near the player.

keyvalues.desc: Which personality VO set the core is set to.

keyvalues.desc: When the core is talking, this is the number of seconds delay between it's spoken lines.

inputs.name: Panic

inputs.name: StartTalking

outputs.name: OnPlayerPickup
outputs.desc: Player picked up core.

desc: Combine Thumper device, used to scare Antlions away.

keyvalues.name: Effect Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius of the thumper's sound. EPISODIC ONLY.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable Thumper

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable Thumper

outputs.name: OnThumped
outputs.desc: Fires when thumper impacts the ground.

desc: A prop that can be placed in hierarchy and can play animations. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_physics (i.e. it should be physically simulated) then it cannot normally  be used as a prop_dynamic. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_dynamic_override instead.
Invisible entity that holds futbols and fires an output. When a futbol comes close it will snap into place.

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use in-game

outputs.name: OnFutbolReleased
outputs.desc: Player has taken the futbol out of this socket.

outputs.name: OnFutbolCaught
outputs.desc: This socket has captured a futbol.

desc: An entity used to place a door in the world.

keyvalues.name: Slave Name
keyvalues.desc: The name of any doors that should be slaved to this door (i.e. should open when this one opens, and close when this one closes).

keyvalues.name: Ajar Angles (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: If the door 'Spawn Position' is set to Ajar, these are the angles to spawn at, instead of being open or closed.

keyvalues.name: Rotation Distance (deg)
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees, that the door should rotate when opened.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the door moves.

keyvalues.name: Fully Open Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door has finished opening.

keyvalues.name: Fully Closed Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door has finished closing.

keyvalues.name: Moving Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door starts to move.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before close (-1 stay open)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the door has opened before it closes. If the value is set to -1, the door never closes itself.

keyvalues.name: Damage Inflicted When Blocked
keyvalues.desc: Amount of damage done to entities that block the movement of this door, per frame.

keyvalues.name: Locked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the player tries to open the door, and fails because it's locked.

keyvalues.name: Unlocked Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the door is unlocked.

keyvalues.name: Force Closed
keyvalues.desc: If set, this door will close no matter what. Useful for doors that have to close even if the player tries to block them with objects.

keyvalues.name: Open Direction
keyvalues.desc: Force the door to open only forwards or only backwards. Both directions is the standard door behavior.

keyvalues.name: Does the prop glow by default?
Glow Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: The color of the glow (if enabled).

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the door, if it is not fully open.

inputs.name: OpenAwayFrom
inputs.desc: Open the door away from the specified entity.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the door, if it is not fully closed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the door between open and closed.

inputs.name: Lock
inputs.desc: Lock the door.

inputs.name: Unlock
inputs.desc: Unlock the door.

inputs.name: SetRotationDistance
inputs.desc: Set the distance (in degrees) between Open and Closed.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed at which the door rotates. 100 is default.

inputs.name: MoveToRotationDistance
inputs.desc: Sets the open distance (in degrees) and moves there.

inputs.name: SetGlowEnabled
inputs.desc: Starts the glow.

inputs.name: SetGlowDisabled
inputs.desc: Stops the glow.

inputs.name: SetUnbreakable
inputs.desc: The door can't be broken.

inputs.name: SetBreakable
inputs.desc: The door can be broken.

outputs.name: OnClose
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is told to close.

outputs.name: OnOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is told to open.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully open position.

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the door reaches the fully closed position.

outputs.name: OnBlockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnBlockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is blocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedClosing
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while closing.

outputs.name: OnUnblockedOpening
outputs.desc: Fired when the door is unblocked while opening.

outputs.name: OnLockedUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player uses the door, but it is locked.

outputs.name: OnRotationDone
outputs.desc: Fired when the door arrives at it's goal angle.

desc: A node entity that marks a point in a rope. Traditionally, one move_rope is used to start the chain and then is followed by one or more keyframe_rope entities. However they are freely interchangeable.

An entity to control the shadows in the map.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (Y Z X)
keyvalues.desc: This is the shadow direction. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, and roll is the rotation around the X axis.

keyvalues.name: Shadow Color
keyvalues.desc: This is the color of the shadows.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is the maximum distance the shadow is allowed to cast, in Source units.

keyvalues.name: Enable Local Light Shadows
keyvalues.desc: Enables RTT dynamic shadow angles, which cause shadows to face away from the nearest light source instead of always using this entity's direction. This is a new feature and the original Half-Life 2 had no dynamic shadow angles. Leave this off if they are not desired.

inputs.name: color
inputs.desc: Set the shadow color.

inputs.name: direction
inputs.desc: Set the shadow direction.

inputs.name: SetDistance
inputs.desc: Set the maximum shadow cast distance.

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Set the shadow direction.

inputs.name: SetShadowsDisabled
inputs.desc: Set shadows disabled state.

inputs.name: SetShadowsFromLocalLightsEnabled
inputs.desc: Set local light shadows enabled state.

keyvalues.name: Alternate aiming animations
keyvalues.desc: Causes this citizen to use readiness aiming animations with a SMG, AR2, or shotgun. When running or walking while aiming/shooting, they will hold their weapon around their upper-chest instead of from their hip.

inputs.name: StopPatrolling

inputs.name: SetMedicOff
inputs.desc: Set the medic flag off. Will not change the model or skin of the citizen.

inputs.name: SetAmmoResupplierOn
inputs.desc: Set the ammo-resupplier flag on. Will not change the model or skin of the citizen.

inputs.name: SetAmmoResupplierOff

desc: Aperture Science Security Camera. Follows either the player or their pings (Portal 2). When a portal is opened behind it it will fall off the wall. If gestured to in Coop the player's camera will switch to looking out of the camera lens, with a viewfinder effect.

keyvalues.name: Target
keyvalues.desc: Target to follow: the player, or their pings (co-op mode only)

keyvalues.name: Ping Type To Follow
keyvalues.desc: Which player's pings to look at.

keyvalues.name: Player To Follow
keyvalues.desc: Which player the camera should follow.

keyvalues.name: Camera Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to be used in game

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Start following players.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Stop following players, freezing in place.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle following players.

inputs.name: Ragdoll
inputs.desc: Knock the camera off the wall.

inputs.name: LookAtBlue
inputs.desc: Make the camera only follow ATLAS.

inputs.name: LookAtOrange
inputs.desc: Make the camera only follow P-Body.

inputs.name: LookAllTeams
inputs.desc: Make the camera follow all players.

outputs.name: OnDeploy
outputs.desc: Camera is becoming active and dangerous.

outputs.name: OnRetire
outputs.desc: Camera is becoming inactive and harmless.

outputs.name: OnTaunted
outputs.desc: A player STARTED taunting the camera.

outputs.name: OnTauntedBlue
outputs.desc: ATLAS STARTED taunting the camera.

outputs.name: OnTauntedOrange
outputs.desc: P-Body STARTED taunting the camera.

outputs.name: OnTauntedFinished

outputs.name: OnTauntedBlueFinished
outputs.desc: ATLAS FINISHED taunting the camera.

outputs.name: OnTauntedOrangeFinished
outputs.desc: P-Body FINISHED taunting the camera.

desc: Portal 1 rocket sentry, aims a rocket at a target. In Portal 2, the rocket spawns with a speed of 0 and sometimes gets stuck inside the model, so this will need to be worked around.

keyvalues.name: Rocket Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed the rocket will travel at.

keyvalues.name: Rocket Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: The rocket will automatically detonate after this number of seconds.

keyvalues.name: Tripwire Mode
keyvalues.desc: Makes the turret aim in a specific direction instead of following the target. When the beam is crossed, a rocket instantly fires.

keyvalues.name: Tripwire Aim Target
keyvalues.desc: In tripwire mode, the entity to aim at.

keyvalues.name: Model
keyvalues.desc: Model to use in-game

keyvalues.name: Maximum Range
keyvalues.desc: How far the turret will be able to see targets.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles between activated and deactivated states.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Activate Rocket Turret, and allow it to begin scanning.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Deactivate and retract the Rocket Turret.

inputs.name: SetTarget
inputs.desc: Sets the target for this turret to attack.

inputs.name: Destroy
inputs.desc: Sets this turret to it's destroyed state.

inputs.name: ForceFire
inputs.desc: Makes the turret immediately fire a rocket where it is pointing.

outputs.name: OnFoundTarget
outputs.desc: Fired when the rocket turret finds an unobstructed target.

outputs.name: OnLostTarget
outputs.desc: Fired when turret's target is blocked.

outputs.name: OnDeath
outputs.desc: Fired after this turret finishes it's destroy think and begins it's death think.

desc: S.L.A.M. Tripmine
Dr Mossman
Antlion Template Maker

keyvalues.name: Spawn on Hint Group
keyvalues.desc: If specified, children will spawn on a hint node from this group, nearest the target.

keyvalues.name: Spawn radius
keyvalues.desc: Target must be within this distance of any node in the hint group specified above. If the target is outside the radius, no NPC will spawn.

keyvalues.name: Spawn target
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of the entity to try and spawn near.

keyvalues.name: Fight target
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of an entity used as a goal for the children to fight to.

keyvalues.name: Follow target
keyvalues.desc: Targetname of an entity used as a goal for the children to follow.

keyvalues.name: Vehicle Spawn Distance
keyvalues.desc: This is a modifier of the current spawn distance. Spawn distance on a vehicle is based on speed, so this is just a modifier for it.

keyvalues.name: Random Worker Spawn Rate
keyvalues.desc: Percentage chance that a spawned antlion will be a worker. (0 = no chance, 1 = 100% chance)

keyvalues.name: Initial antlions in the pool.
keyvalues.desc: Number of antlions in the pool at map start.

keyvalues.name: Max antlions in the pool.
keyvalues.desc: Maximum number of antlions allowed in the pool. If 0, pool behavior is turned off.

keyvalues.name: Pool regen amount.
keyvalues.desc: This is the number of antlions added to the pool every time it regenerates.

keyvalues.name: Pool regen time.
keyvalues.desc: Time interval between pool regeneration ticks.

inputs.name: SetFightTarget
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity for children to fight to.

inputs.name: ClearFightTarget
inputs.desc: Clears the fight target goal for this spawner.

inputs.name: SetFollowTarget
inputs.desc: Sets the target entity for children to follow.

inputs.name: ClearFollowTarget
inputs.desc: Clears the follow target goal for this spawner.

inputs.name: SetSpawnRadius
inputs.desc: Sets the Spawn Radius.

inputs.name: AddToPool
inputs.desc: Add the number of antlions specified in the parameter to the pool.

inputs.name: SetMaxPool
inputs.desc: Set the maximum number of antlions allowed in the pool at any time. Setting it to 0 turns off the pool behavior.

inputs.name: SetPoolRegenAmount
inputs.desc: Set the number of antlions added to the pool every time it regenerates.

inputs.name: SetPoolRegenTime
inputs.desc: Set the time interval between pool regeneration ticks.

inputs.name: ChangeDestinationGroup
inputs.desc: Change the spawn group for this spawner.

outputs.name: OnAllBlocked
outputs.desc: Fires when all the hint nodes are blocked.

desc: Kleiner

A Generic NPC entity that hears and reports 'danger' and is not preserved on round restart. Danger sounds consist of gunshots, player sounds, bullet impacts, nearby vehicles and andything else that gives off a danger sound.

outputs.name: OnHearPlayer

outputs.name: OnHearCombat

desc: Launches missiles that appear to fly to a target.

keyvalues.desc: Initial launch speed of missile (in up direction).

keyvalues.desc: How strong is the homing effect? (0-100).

keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds the homing effect lasts.

keyvalues.desc: Number of seconds it takes homing effect to decay after homing duration.

desc: Magnusson
Combine security camera

keyvalues.name: Inner radius
keyvalues.desc: The camera will only lock onto enemies that are within the inner radius.

keyvalues.name: Outer radius
keyvalues.desc: The camera will flash amber when enemies are within the outer radius, but outside the inner radius.

keyvalues.name: Min req'd damage for hurting camera
Default target
keyvalues.desc: The default target is the entity that the camera follows when it has no other target to track.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disables the camera. If open, the camera closes.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enables the camera. If closed, the camera opens.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle - If open, close. If closed, open.

inputs.name: SetDefaultTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Sets the entity for the camera to track when it has nothing better to track, by name.

inputs.name: SetTargetEntity
inputs.desc: Sets the entity for the camera to track now, by name.

inputs.name: SetAngry
inputs.desc: Causes the camera to become angry as if it has seen something upsetting.

inputs.name: SetIdle
inputs.desc: Causes the camera to calm down if it is angry.

outputs.name: OnFoundPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired when the player is spotted within the inner radius

outputs.name: OnFoundEnemy
outputs.desc: Fired when a non-player enemy is spotted within the inner radius.

desc: An entity that creates NPCs. The NPCs it creates are clones of a template NPC. NPCs are spawned around this maker's origin, or at specified destination points.

keyvalues.name: Name of template NPC
keyvalues.desc: Template NPC that this maker should be creating clones of.

keyvalues.name: Radius
keyvalues.desc: Radius around this maker within which NPCs are to be placed. Spawned NPCs will try and find empty space within this radius to spawn.

keyvalues.name: Name of Destination Group
keyvalues.desc: If you'd like spawned NPCs to be created at an info_npc_spawn_destination entity, enter the name of that entity here. If you have more than one destination entity by that name, the Destination Criteria will be used to select one from the group.

keyvalues.name: Dest. Criterion: Visible to player?
keyvalues.desc: Should the NPC try to spawn at a destination that the player can see? Only applicable if a Destination Group is being used.

keyvalues.name: Dest. Criterion: Distance to player?
keyvalues.desc: Should the NPC try to spawn nearest to or farthest from the player's current location? Only applicable if a Destination Group is being used.

keyvalues.name: Minimum spawn distance from player
keyvalues.desc: The spawn destination node distance to the player will have to be further or equal than this value.

inputs.name: SpawnNPCInRadius
inputs.desc: Spawn an NPC somewhere within the maker's radius.

inputs.name: SpawnNPCInLine
inputs.desc: Spawn an NPC somewhere within a line behind the maker.

inputs.name: SpawnMultiple
inputs.desc: Spawn multiple NPCs (uses destination group, else radius).

inputs.name: ChangeDestinationGroup
inputs.desc: Switch to a different set of Destination entities.

inputs.name: SetMinimumSpawnDistance
inputs.desc: Set the minimum spawn distance from player to destination node.

desc: Helicopter

keyvalues.name: Grace Period
keyvalues.desc: Time in seconds the helicopter has to see the player before it starts shooting

keyvalues.name: Patrol Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed at which the helicopter moves if it has no enemy.

keyvalues.name: Non-combat (Do not precache gibs)
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, this helicopter will not precache stuff that would only be seen in combat, like mines or gibs. Even damaging the helicopter in this state can crash the game, so you might want to use a damage filter too.

inputs.name: GunOn
inputs.desc: GunOn

inputs.name: GunOff
inputs.desc: GunOff

inputs.name: MissileOn
inputs.desc: MissileOn

inputs.name: MissileOff
inputs.desc: MissileOff

inputs.name: EnableRotorWash
inputs.desc: Turns on rotor wash effects

inputs.name: DisableRotorWash
inputs.desc: Turns off rotor wash effects

inputs.name: EnableRotorSound
inputs.desc: Turns on rotor sounds

inputs.name: DisableRotorSound
inputs.desc: Turns off rotor sounds

inputs.name: StartBombingVehicle
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper leading enemy vehicles and dropping bombs on them.

inputs.name: StartTrailingVehicle
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper trailing enemy vehicles and shooting at them.

inputs.name: StartDefaultBehavior
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper in the mode where it always stops at nav points instead of stopping anywhere in between nav points.

inputs.name: StartAlwaysLeadingVehicle
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper *always* leading enemy vehicles (regardless of how they are moving w/respect to the path) and dropping bombs on them. This mode is different from StartBombingVehicle in that it never uses the machine gun.

inputs.name: StartSprinkleBehavior
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper dropping bombs randomly + shooting at the player.

inputs.name: StartBullrushBehavior
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper bullrushing the player.

inputs.name: SetHealthFraction
inputs.desc: Sets the chopper health as a percentage of max health

inputs.name: EnableDeadlyShooting
inputs.desc: Starts the chopper being deadly to on-foot players

inputs.name: DisableDeadlyShooting
inputs.desc: Stops the chopper being deadly to on-foot players

inputs.name: StartNormalShooting
inputs.desc: The chopper will fire in short bursts. Good for on-foot experiences

inputs.name: StartLongCycleShooting
inputs.desc: The chopper fires in long bursts

inputs.name: StartContinuousShooting
inputs.desc: The chopper fires continuously.

inputs.name: StartFastShooting
inputs.desc: The chopper fires normal bursts, but does not 'charge up' the gun. Fires immediately.

inputs.name: ResetIdleTime
inputs.desc: Allows the helicopter to fire immediately if it's not in the middle of charging or firing

inputs.name: SetAngles
inputs.desc: Instantly snaps the orientation of the helicopter (Pitch Yaw Roll)

inputs.name: DropBomb
inputs.desc: Immediately drops a bomb based on normal bomb dropping rules

inputs.name: DropBombStraightDown
inputs.desc: Immediately drops a bomb directly downwards

inputs.name: DropBombAtTarget
inputs.desc: Immediately drops a bomb directly at the target destination, but only if the player isn't right there

inputs.name: DropBombAtTargetAlways
inputs.desc: Immediately drops a bomb directly at the target destination, no matter whether it's fair or not.

inputs.name: DropBombDelay
inputs.desc: Add a delay before the next bomb is dropped

inputs.name: BecomeIndestructible
inputs.desc: Makes the helicopter take no more damage

inputs.name: DisablePathVisibilityTests
inputs.desc: When the helicopter moves, it will not check for visibility from the path_track to the enemy to cull out path_tracks

inputs.name: EnablePathVisibilityTests
inputs.desc: When the helicopter moves, it will only move to path_tracks that have line-of-sight to the enemy

inputs.name: StartCarpetBombing
inputs.desc: Starts the helicopter constantly dropping megabombs until StopCarpetBombing input

inputs.name: StopCarpetBombing
inputs.desc: Stop the carpet bombing behavior

outputs.name: OnHealthChanged
outputs.desc: Fires when the helicopter health changes. The integer is the percentage of health the chopper has from 0-100.

outputs.name: OnShotDown
outputs.desc: Fires the instant the helicopter is killed

A dynamic item. When the player enters the PVS of this entity, it will determine the item most needed by the player, spawn one of those items, and remove itself. To determine which item the player most needs, it calculates which of the Desired Health/Armor/Ammo ratios the player is farthest from.

If the player is above all the desired levels, then no item will be spawned, unless the 'Spawn Even if Full' spawnflag is set or the item_dynamic_resupply was created by an item_item_crate. In that case, a random piece of ammo used by a weapon, that the player has, will be spawned. If the 'Fallback to Health Vial' spawnflag is set, a health vial will be spawned instead of the ammo.

By default, the item_dynamic_resupply uses the values inside the Master resupply, instead of using it's own values. This makes it easy to tweak the desired loadout of many resupplies. The BecomeMaster input allows you to switch Masters dynamically as the level progresses.

(Assault) assault point

keyvalues.name: Assault Hint Group
keyvalues.desc: NPC's movements are constrained to this hint group once assault has begun

keyvalues.name: Assault time out
keyvalues.desc: This point is cleared when no enemies are seen for this long (seconds)

keyvalues.name: Clear on contact with enemies
keyvalues.desc: If you come in contact with enemies while approaching the assault point, clear our assault point

keyvalues.name: Allow diversion
keyvalues.desc: If you come in contact with enemies while approaching the assault point, divert to kill them. Resume the assault once contact is lost.

keyvalues.name: Diversion Proximity
keyvalues.desc: If Allow Diversion is set, NPC will only divert from assault to attack an enemy that is within this distance of the assault point. 0 = No limit.

keyvalues.name: Never Timeout
keyvalues.desc: If set, the assault never ends for NPCs assaulting this point. Useful for forcing NPCs back to a point.

keyvalues.name: Strict?
keyvalues.default: No, NPC may move from point to attack (0)

keyvalues.name: Force Crouch
keyvalues.desc: NPCs using this assault point are forced into crouching while holding it.

keyvalues.name: Urgent
keyvalues.desc: If true, NPCs will consider movement to this assault point as Urgent Navigation.

keyvalues.name: Attack Tolerance
keyvalues.desc: How far this NPC may move from the assault point to try to attack an enemy.

inputs.name: SetClearOnContact
inputs.desc: Set the clear on contact flag. NPCs who spot enemies while running to the assault point, or while waiting at it, will immediately Clear it.

inputs.name: SetAllowDiversion
inputs.desc: Set the allow diversion flag. NPCs who spot enemies while running to the assault point, or while waiting on it, will divert away (leave Assault mode) to deal with the enemies. Upon losing enemies, they'll go back to Assault mode, and return to this assault point.

inputs.name: SetForceClear
inputs.desc: Set the Force Clear flag. NPCs who are currently running to the assault point will Clear it immediately. NPCs who acquire it in the future will Clear it automatically.

outputs.name: OnArrival
outputs.desc: Fires when the NPC reaches this assault point

outputs.name: OnAssaultClear
outputs.desc: Fires when this assault point is cleared of enemies

desc: This is the center of the instance for rotation.

Place one copy of this entity inside of an instance.  Sending messages to entities inside the instance from the Proxy's OnProxyRelay output will allow you to trigger these entities from outside the instance by sending messages to the func_instance.  Send the ProxyRelay message from entities inside the instance to the proxy and you will be able to use these events to send messages to other entities outside the instance from the func_instance. NOTE: The instance, the proxy, and all entities involved should be named descriptively.

keyvalues.name: Name
keyvalues.desc: The name that other entities refer to this entity by.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay
inputs.desc: This message will get relayed and will be available from the instance.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay1
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay2
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay3
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay4
inputs.desc: Added by the compiler, this is used internally to connect the outputs.

inputs.name: ProxyRelay5

outputs.name: OnProxyRelay
