keyvalues.desc: Message to display to the player for prompts.

keyvalues.name: Player Speed
keyvalues.desc: On prompting, the player's speed will be changed by this factor (use <1 for slowdowns, >1 for speedups).

keyvalues.name: Player Zoom Rate
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time (in seconds) to move between current FOV and zoomfov.

keyvalues.name: Player Zoom FOV
keyvalues.desc: FOV to zoom to on prompting. Use 0 for no zoom.

desc: A trigger volume that removes any entities that touch it. Be careful, removing some entities can cause instability. This is not the same as killing entities. i.e. NPCs removed in this manner will not fire their OnKilled outputs.

outputs.name: OnRemove
outputs.desc: Fired whenever an entity is removed.

desc: A trigger volume that can will check if any of trigger's children pass a secondary filter.

keyvalues.name: Child Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to see if activator's children trigger me. See filter_activator_name for more explanation.

desc: A volumetric trigger that disintegrates enemies
Trigger for setting speed of the player.

keyvalues.name: Keep horizontal speed
keyvalues.desc: If you want to keep the horizontal (x/y axis velocity based) speed, set it to 1.

keyvalues.name: Keep vertical speed
keyvalues.desc: If you want to keep the vertical (z axis velocity based) speed, set it to 1.

keyvalues.name: Horizontal speed amount
keyvalues.desc: Set here the speed length based on x/y axis for the velocity direction.

keyvalues.name: Vertical speed amount
keyvalues.desc: Set here the speed based on z axis for the velocity direction.

keyvalues.name: Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: Direction of the speed applied. Keep in mind that only Y angle is taken into account because vertical speed can be set already.

keyvalues.name: Update every intervals
keyvalues.desc: If you want to make the trigger updating for each defined interval, set it to 1.

keyvalues.name: Interval
keyvalues.desc: Set here in seconds how many time the trigger should update.

keyvalues.name: Every tick
keyvalues.desc: If you want the trigger to update and fire every tick, set this to 1.

desc: A trigger volume that changes the gravity on any entity that touches it.

keyvalues.name: Persist
keyvalues.desc: Whether the gravity change persists. A setting of 0 will reset gravity to default on exiting. 1 will persist and thus act like how it did in older games like TF2.

desc: A volumetric trigger that triggers whenever an RPG is fired within it.
A trigger volume that can be used, and can relay touches to its parent.

keyvalues.name: Input Flags
keyvalues.desc: Filters what kind of entities can interact with this. Set this in spawnflags instead.

keyvalues.name: Proxy To Parent
keyvalues.desc: Relay touching or USEing this entity to the parent entity. The input filters will still apply.

outputs.name: OnStartTouch
outputs.desc: Fired when something touches us.

outputs.name: OnEndTouch
outputs.desc: Fired when something stops touching us.

outputs.name: OnUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player (or I/O) USEs us.

desc: A volumetric trigger that affects the motion of vphysics objects that touch it.

keyvalues.name: Gravity Scale
keyvalues.desc: Scale gravity of objects in the field by this amount.

keyvalues.name: Velocity Limit
keyvalues.desc: Max velocity in field (0 disables)

keyvalues.name: Velocity Limit Force
keyvalues.desc: Max amount to reduce velocity per second when it exceeds the velocity limit (0 disables)

keyvalues.name: Angular Velocity Limit
keyvalues.desc: Max angular velocity in field (degrees/s, 0 disables)

keyvalues.name: Linear force
keyvalues.desc: Amount of force to apply while in the trigger (0 disables)

keyvalues.name: Force Direction
keyvalues.desc: Direction of linear force (Pitch Yaw Roll or Y Z X)

keyvalues.name: Particle Trail Material
keyvalues.desc: Name of a material to use for the particle trail, no name means no particle trail

keyvalues.name: Particle Trail Lifetime
keyvalues.desc: Lifetime of the particles to emit

keyvalues.name: Particle Trail Starting Sprite Size
keyvalues.desc: Starting size of the sprite to emit

keyvalues.name: Particle Trail Ending Sprite Size
keyvalues.desc: Ending size of the sprite to emit

inputs.name: SetGravityScale
inputs.desc: Scale gravity of objects in the field.

inputs.name: SetAdditionalAirDensity
inputs.desc: Additional air density for drag

inputs.name: SetVelocityLimit
inputs.desc: Max velocity in field.

inputs.name: SetVelocityLimitDelta
inputs.desc: Max amount to reduce velocity per second

inputs.name: SetVelocityLimitTime
inputs.desc: Accepts two arguments: the first is the new velocity limit, the second is the time it takes to ramp to that value

inputs.name: SetVelocityScale
inputs.desc: Velocity scale/drag

inputs.name: SetAngVelocityLimit
inputs.desc: Max angular velocity in field.

inputs.name: SetAngVelocityScale
inputs.desc: Angular Velocity scale/drag

inputs.name: SetLinearForce
inputs.desc: Linear force (0 disables)

desc:
An entity that triggers a level change.
Place an info_landmark in both maps that marks the 'same' location in each map.
TIPS & TRICKS: To fire events in the next level, use the OnLevelChange output to turn on an env_global in the current level.  Create a logic_auto in the next level that checks for the state set by the env_global.

To control which entities go through the level transition, create one or more trigger_transitions and give them the same name as the landmark. Any entities within the trigger_transition(s) will go to the next map.

inputs.name: ChangeLevel
inputs.desc: Cause the level change. Use this when triggering the level change with a button, etc.

outputs.name: OnChangeLevel
outputs.desc: Fired when the level changes.

desc: An entity that can be used to disable player's automatic ducking/unducking when jumping.

A trigger volume that can be told to push all physics objects that are inside of it in the direction specified by this trigger's angles.
Also outputs the force at the time of impact for anyone else that wants to use it.

keyvalues.name: Magnitude
keyvalues.desc: The strength of the impact. Negative values reverse the direction.

keyvalues.name: Noise
keyvalues.desc: The amount of directional noise (0-1). 0 = no noise, 1 = random direction.

keyvalues.name: Viewkick
keyvalues.desc: The amount to kick player's view if the player is in the trigger.  Proportional to magnitude (0-1).

inputs.name: Impact
inputs.desc: Fire the impact, pushing all entities within the volume.

inputs.name: SetMagnitude
inputs.desc: Set the magnitude of the impact.

outputs.name: ImpactForce
outputs.desc: Fired after an impact. The parameter passed along is the force of the impact that was generated.

desc: Measures the distance of the player within the trigger volume from a given point (and within a given radius). The NearestPlayerDistance output will be 0 when the player is at the center point, and 1 when the player is at the radius.

keyvalues.name: Point to Measure From
keyvalues.desc: The name of a target entity who's origin is the point to measure the player's distance from.

keyvalues.name: Radius to measure within
keyvalues.desc: The radius to which the distance should be mapped. If the player is outside the radius they will be ignored.

outputs.name: NearestEntityDistance
outputs.desc: Fired continuously when entities are touching the trigger volume. The output parameter is the distance from the Point to Measure From to the nearest entity that passed the trigger filters. The distance is mapped to the radius distance, so it will be 0 when the entity is on the point, and 1 when the entity is at the edge of the radius.!activator is the closest entity.

desc: A trigger volume that pushes physics objects that touch it.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The baseline for how hard the wind blows.

keyvalues.name: Speed Noise
keyvalues.desc: Noise added to wind speed +/-

keyvalues.name: Direction Noise
keyvalues.desc: Noise added to wind direction.

keyvalues.name: Hold Time
keyvalues.desc: Baseline for how long to wait before changing wind.

keyvalues.name: Hold Noise
keyvalues.desc: Noise added to how long to wait before changing wind.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the baseline for how hard the wind blows.

desc: Detects whether a player has pinged in its region.

outputs.name: OnOrangePlayerPinged
outputs.desc: Fired when P-Body has pinged inside the trigger.

outputs.name: OnBluePlayerPinged
outputs.desc: Fired when ATLAS has pinged inside the trigger.

desc: A volumetric trigger that dissolves all weapons within it.

keyvalues.name: Emitter Name
keyvalues.desc: Name of a single or multiple entities to use as the basis for the emitted effects.

inputs.name: StopSound
inputs.desc: Stops all sounds.

outputs.name: OnDissolveWeapon
outputs.desc: Fires when one weapon is starting to dissolve in the trigger volume.

outputs.name: OnChargingPhyscannon
outputs.desc: Fires when the trigger begins to charge the physcannon.

desc: An entity that can control sound operator parameters.

An entity used to trigger something when the player looks at something. It fires 'OnTrigger' when the player looks at a target entity for the given amount of time, while within the trigger volume. If the player leaves the trigger or looks away from the target entity the clock resets. If the 'Use Velocity instead of facing' spawnflag is checked, the trigger uses the player's velocity instead of the player's view, so it determines whenever the player is moving toward the target entity. Useful for triggering when players are driving a vehicle at something. NOTE: Only designed for single-player game.

keyvalues.name: Look Target
keyvalues.desc: The name of the entity to be looked at.

keyvalues.name: LookTime
keyvalues.desc: The time, in seconds, that the player must look at the target before firing the output. Resets if player leaves trigger, or looks outside the Field of View threshold.

keyvalues.name: FieldOfView
keyvalues.desc:
How close the player has to be looking at the target. 1.0 = straight ahead
 0.0 = +/- 90 degrees
 -1.0 = all directions).

keyvalues.name: Timeout
keyvalues.desc: The time, in seconds, to wait after player enters the trigger before firing the OnTimeout output, 0 = never.

inputs.name: LookTime
inputs.desc: Set the time, in seconds, that the player has to look at the target before firing.

inputs.name: FieldOfView
inputs.desc: Set how close the player has to be looking at the target.

outputs.name: OnTimeout
outputs.desc: Fired after the timeout interval expires if the player never looked at the target.

desc: Trigger that fires on user KeyPress if inside trigger.

keyvalues.name: Second key to use that fires, if held down at same time as other keys
Third key to use that fires, if held down at same time as other keys

outputs.name: OnKeyPressed
outputs.desc: Fires when the desired key is pressed

outputs.name: OnKeyHeld
outputs.desc: Fires every tick while the desired key is held

outputs.name: OnKeyReleased
outputs.desc: Fires when the desired key is released

desc: A trigger volume that erases any gel within it. Will destroy prop_paint_bombs and info_paint_sprayer gel, but will not stop gel from streaking under it. It will also clean physics objects like cubes or turrets that touch it. Likely intended to be used with paint_cleanser particle effect (like P1 fizzlers, but red).

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filters don't work on trigger_paint_cleanser!

desc: A trigger volume that teleports entities that touch it. Entities are teleported by Offset from their current position. Useful to get objects out of situations where levels or entities suddenly appear intersecting with them.

keyvalues.name: Offset (X Y Z)
keyvalues.desc: The offset (in World-Space Coordinates X Y Z) to teleport the entity when the trigger is touched.

desc: A trigger volume that damages entities that touch it.

keyvalues.name: Damage
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage done to entities that touch this trigger. The damage is done every half-second. See also 'Damage Model' for extra details on how damage can be dealt.

keyvalues.name: Damage Cap
keyvalues.desc: The maximum amount of damage that can be dealt when using the Doubling w/Forgiveness damage model.

keyvalues.name: Damage Model
keyvalues.desc: How damage is dealt. Normal always does the specified amount of damage each half second. Doubling w/Forgiveness starts with the specified amount and doubles it each time it hurts the toucher, resetting when they leave the trigger. Good for making triggers that are deadly over time, without having to cause massive damage on each touch.

keyvalues.name: Zero Damage Force
keyvalues.desc: Should the damaged entity receive no physics force from this trigger.

inputs.name: SetDamage
inputs.desc: Set a new amount of damage for this trigger.

outputs.name: OnHurt
outputs.desc: Fired whenever this trigger hurts something other than a player.

outputs.name: OnHurtPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired whenever this trigger hurts a player.

desc: A trigger volume that autosaves when the player touches it.

keyvalues.name: Force New Level Unit
keyvalues.desc: If set, the save will discard any savedata from previous levels, for the purpose of keeping savegame filesizes down. Can only be safely used if there is no way for the player to return to previous levels.

keyvalues.name: Dangerous Timer
keyvalues.desc: The number of seconds the player must survive before this autosave takes effect.

keyvalues.name: Minumum Hit Points
keyvalues.desc: Don't save dangerous when player has less than this many hitpoints.

desc: A trigger volume that spawns leeches around entities inside it, and does damage to them until they die. Used to prevent players entering deep water.
Catapult the player in a given direction at a given velocity.

keyvalues.name: Player Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed at which to launch the players (u/sec)

keyvalues.name: Physics Object Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed at which to launch physics objects (u/sec)

keyvalues.name: Launch direction
keyvalues.desc: Direction to launch the player in.

keyvalues.name: Launch target
keyvalues.desc: Entity to try to 'hit' when we're launched.

keyvalues.name: Use Exact Velocity
keyvalues.desc: Try to fling exactly at the speed specified - this prevents the added upward velocity from a launch target.

keyvalues.name: Exact Solution Method
keyvalues.desc: Using exact velocity generates two correct solutions. Use this to force which one you choose.

keyvalues.name: Apply angular impulse
keyvalues.desc: Physics objects that are catapulted will get random rotational force.

keyvalues.name: Air control supression time
keyvalues.desc: [Launch by target only!] If greater than zero, suppress player aircontrol for this number (in seconds). If less than zero use the default (quarter second).

keyvalues.name: Supress directional air control
keyvalues.desc: Whether to supress air control for directional catapults.

keyvalues.name: Use Threshold Check
keyvalues.desc: Use the Lower and Upper Threshold to only trigger when the object is moving at a certain speed already.

keyvalues.name: Only check velocity
keyvalues.desc: Only check velocity of the touching object - don't actually catapult it. Use in conjunction with OnCatapulted to create velocity checking triggers.  Only works when Use Threshold Check is enabled.

keyvalues.name: Absolute Velocity Check
keyvalues.desc: If enabled, the values in Lower Threshold and Upper Threshold represent real velocity values instead of percentages.

keyvalues.name: Lower Threshold
keyvalues.desc: Flung object must be within this percentage value in order to activate fling. Specify a value between [0...1] (default is .15). This is only used if Use Threshold Check is set to yes.

keyvalues.name: Upper Threshold
keyvalues.desc: Flung object must be within this percentage value in order to activate fling. Specify a value between [0...1] (default is .30). This is only used if Use Threshold Check is set to yes.

keyvalues.name: Entry Angle Tolerance
keyvalues.desc: Flung object's velocity must be pointing this much at the target. Specify a value between [-1...1] 1 means exactly, 0 means within 180 degrees -1 means any angle is accepted. This is only used if Use Threshold Check is set to yes.

keyvalues.name: Launch Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when an entity is launched.

inputs.name: SetPlayerSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed to launch the player at.

inputs.name: SetPhysicsSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed to launch the physics objects at.

inputs.name: SetLaunchTarget
inputs.desc: Set the entity to try hit when launched.

inputs.name: SetExactVelocityChoiceType
inputs.desc: Set the Exact Solution Method.

outputs.name: OnCatapulted
outputs.desc: The object has been launched, or passes the Threshold Check and Entry Angle Tolerance.

desc: A trigger volume that softly slows player velocity in a given direction.

keyvalues.name: Push Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: Angles indicating the direction to slow player velocity.

inputs.name: SetPushDirection
inputs.desc: Sets the angles indicating the direction to slow player velocity.

desc: A trigger volume that autosaves each time the player touches it. After it is triggered, it must be Enabled before it will activate again.

A volume that's used to control which entities go through the level transition. Create one or more trigger_transitions and give them the same name as the changelevel landmark. Any entities within the trigger_transition(s) will go to the next map. See trigger_changelevel for more info.
A trigger volume that removes itself after it is triggered once.
A trigger volume that pushes entities that touch it.

keyvalues.name: Push Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: Angles indicating the direction to push touched entities.

keyvalues.name: Speed of Push
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which to push entities away, in units / second.

keyvalues.name: Scale force for alternate ticks
keyvalues.desc: If nonzero, scale the force by this amount when running with alternate ticks. This fixes problems with an overly large force due to the longer frametime on when running with sv_alternateticks 1.

inputs.name: SetPushDirection
inputs.desc: Sets the angles indicating the direction to push touched entities.

inputs.name: SetPushSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the push speed in units / second.

desc: A brush entity that prevents detail sprites from being placed inside its volume.

Used to produce perfectly reflective glass that renders world + entities. Typically, you want your glass brush to have nodraw on all non-reflective surfaces and you want to use a shader like lightmappedreflective in your material applied to the non-nodraw surfaces. See hl2/materials/glass/reflectiveglass001.vmt for an example. NOTE: currently, you cannot use reflective glass in scenes with water, and you can only have 1 reflective glass in your view frustum ( + pvs ) at a time. Players will not see their own reflection unless they are in thirdperson mode.
When used by the player, this entity overrides the player's controls to let them drive a train.

keyvalues.name: Train Name
keyvalues.desc: The target train to control when the player uses these controls.

desc: A breakable surface, for partially breakable glass / tile / etc. All faces but the desired visible one must be marked as NODRAW and that face must be 4 sided. The material applied to the visible face must be set up to be breakable.

keyvalues.name: Health
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage the surface takes before breaking.

keyvalues.name: Fragility
keyvalues.desc: If the 'Surface Type' is set to Glass, this value sets how fragile the glass pieces are after the surface has been broken. Lower values make glass pieces tend to stay more.

keyvalues.name: Surface Type
keyvalues.desc: Sets the behaviour of the brush. Glass shatters in multiple sizes, and easily breaks. Tile only breaks along edges, and is still strong after being shattered.

keyvalues.name: Lower Left Corner (readonly)
keyvalues.desc: This is set automatically by Hammer when saving.

keyvalues.name: Lower Right Corner (readonly)
keyvalues.desc: This is set automatically by Hammer when saving.

keyvalues.name: Upper Left Corner (readonly)
keyvalues.desc: This is set automatically by Hammer when saving.

keyvalues.name: Upper Right Corner (readonly)
keyvalues.desc: This is set automatically by Hammer when saving.

keyvalues.name: Face Error
keyvalues.desc: Set by Hammer to indicate an invalid glass/tile surface.

inputs.name: Shatter
inputs.desc: Shatter the window. Input a vector. First two coordinates are the X,Y center of the shattering (as values from from 0-1). The third coordinate is the radius of the shatter, in units.

desc: PhysCannister Turret

keyvalues.name: Barrel Volume
keyvalues.desc: Name of a trigger the specifies the volume in which cannisters must be placed.

desc: Brush Gun Turret
A brush entity that spawns a translucent dust cloud within its volume.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Particle Size
keyvalues.desc: This value determines the minimum size the particles can be.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Particle Size
keyvalues.desc: This value determines the maximum size the particles can be.

keyvalues.name: Particle Translucency (0 - 255)
keyvalues.desc: Translucency of the particles.

desc: Zone that handles respawning and distribution of clientside physics props.
A brush entity that creates rain and snow inside its volume.

keyvalues.name: Density (0-100%)
keyvalues.desc: This is the amount of particles that fall down from top side of brush. However distance from first particle to second depends on a brush volume size!

keyvalues.name: Color (R G B)
keyvalues.desc: Color added to sprites which are rendered transparently (probably rain and snow particles)

keyvalues.name: Inner particle distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance between the inner and outer particle systems. If not set, this will be automatically selected from the precipitation type keyvalue.

keyvalues.name: Inner near system
keyvalues.desc: Name of the inner near particle system. If not set, this will be automatically selected from the precipitation type keyvalue.

keyvalues.name: Inner far system
keyvalues.desc: Name of the inner far particle system. If not set, this will be automatically selected from the precipitation type keyvalue.

keyvalues.name: Outer system
keyvalues.desc: Name of the outer particle system. If not set, this will be automatically selected from the precipitation type keyvalue.

inputs.name: Alpha
inputs.desc: Changes the density of the rain, and may add additional particle effects like fog or leaves. Accepts inputs from -1 to 255.

desc: A brush entity that moves vertically, and can rotate while doing so.

keyvalues.name: Movement Sound
keyvalues.desc: The sound to play when the brush moves.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: The sound to play when the brush stops moving.

keyvalues.name: Speed of Rotation
keyvalues.desc: Speed at which the brush rotates, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Travel Altitude
keyvalues.desc: The vertical distance from the starting position that this platform moves. If negative, the platform will lower.

keyvalues.name: Spin amount
keyvalues.desc: The amount this platform should rotate as it moves, in degrees.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the platform's state.

inputs.name: GoUp
inputs.desc: Tells the platform to go up.

inputs.name: GoDown
inputs.desc: Tells the platform to go down.

desc: Old brush-based suit battery recharger.

inputs.name: Recharge
inputs.desc: Recharge to full

inputs.name: SetCharge
inputs.desc: This sets the remaining charge in the charger to whatever value you specify

outputs.name: OutRemainingCharge
outputs.desc: Remaining Charge.

outputs.name: OnHalfEmpty
outputs.desc: Half-Empty

outputs.name: OnEmpty
outputs.desc: Empty

outputs.name: OnFull
outputs.desc: Recharged to full.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player +USEs the charger.

desc: Brush-built model that fades out over a specified distance. Useful for creating world detail that doesn't need to be drawn far away, for performance reasons.

keyvalues.name: Solid
keyvalues.desc: Set whether or not these brushes should collide with other entities.

keyvalues.name: Disappear Min Distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which these brushes should starting fade out.

keyvalues.name: Disappear Max Distance
keyvalues.desc: Distance at which these brushes should be completely faded out.

desc: A brush entity that spawns smoke particles within its volume.

keyvalues.name: Material
keyvalues.desc: The material to use for the particles

keyvalues.name: Particle Draw Width (units)
keyvalues.desc: The size of the particles, in units.

keyvalues.name: Particle Spacing Distance (units)
keyvalues.desc: The distance between the particles inside the volume. The lower the number, the denser the particles, and the more overdraw there will be. It is best to keep it as high as you can without it looking bad.

keyvalues.name: Density Ramp Speed (seconds)
keyvalues.desc: Time to go from density 0 to density 1, in seconds.

keyvalues.name: Rotation Speed (degrees/sec)
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the particles should rotate, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Movement Speed (units/sec)
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the particles should move around, in units per second.

inputs.name: SetRotationSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the particle rotation speed (in degrees per second).

inputs.name: SetMovementSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the particle movement speed (in units per second).

inputs.name: SetDensity
inputs.desc: Set the particle density. It should be a range from 0 to 1.

desc: Brush Rocket Turret

keyvalues.name: Projectile speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed the rocket will travel at.

desc: A brush entity that's designed to be used for a player-useable button. When used by the player, it moves to a pressed position. Do not lock while pressed; it will not return when unlocked.

keyvalues.name: Move Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: Specifies the direction of motion to move when the button is used.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the button moves, in units per second.

keyvalues.name: Health (Obsolete)
keyvalues.desc: Legacy method of specifying whether or not the button can be shot to activate it. Use the 'Damage Activates' spawnflag instead.

keyvalues.name: Lip
keyvalues.desc: The amount the button will keep overlapping with the original position. The distance moved = the size of the brush on the movement axis - lip.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before Reset (-1 stay)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the button has been pressed before it returns to the starting position. Once it has returned, it can be used again. If the value is set to -1, the button never returns.

keyvalues.name: Sound Name
keyvalues.desc: The .wav(!!) sound file to use. (Only used when old 'sounds' keyvalue isn't set)

keyvalues.name: Use Look-At Limit
keyvalues.desc: Limit the usable look-at-angle. -1 is looking directly away, 0 is looking perpendicular, 1 is looking directly at.

desc: Acts as a functional clip or barrier affecting vehicle entities. Should be used with the tools/toolscontrolclip texture.

inputs.name: Kill
inputs.desc: Removes this entity from the world

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable collisions with vehicles

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable collisions with vehicles

desc: Legacy Goldsrc support. Non-moving water should be worldspawn, and moving water should be func_water_analog. This brush is a special variant of func_door with water collision physics.
A brush that is always non-solid. Legacy support, see func_brush. However, if func_brush's added features are not needed this can be used for small memory savings.
A brush entity that functions as a conveyor belt, with a moving surface. The surface material should have a ConveyorScroll Material Proxy, to synchronize the material movement and push effect.

keyvalues.name: Move Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction conveyor moves.

inputs.name: ToggleDirection
inputs.desc: Change direction of conveyor.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Sets Conveyor Speed.

desc: An entity that works as a rotating/moving platform that will carry a train to a new track. It must be larger in X-Y planar area than the train, since it must contain the train within these dimensions in order to operate when the train is near it. The track will rotate around its own origin. Similar variant to this entity is func_trackautochange, however you can't trigger func_trackautochange unless the path_track is a dead end. If Auto Activate Train flag is ticked, train isn't paused at the top/bottom of the path after func_trackchange has finished it's movement. Instead, it will continue moving forward and doesn't need to be reactivated by trigger. If selected, the platform only rotates in place of it's origin without travelling specified altitude. The top and the bottom path_tracks should have their origin positioned in the same coordinates.

keyvalues.name: Travel Altitude
keyvalues.desc: Travel distance, from top to bottom. If Start at Bottom flag is selected, the travel distance won't change from bottom to top, it will only make the platform start at bottom and awaits for func_tracktrain to arrive.

keyvalues.name: Spin amount
keyvalues.desc: The amount this platform should rotate as it moves, in degrees.

keyvalues.name: Train to Switch
keyvalues.desc: Name of func_tracktrain this platform will transport to top/bottom track.

keyvalues.name: Top Track
keyvalues.desc: Name of last path_track of the top path (if Start at Bottom flag is selected, this is the name of the first path_track at the top path).

keyvalues.name: Bottom Track
keyvalues.desc: Name of first path_track of the bottom track (if Start at Bottom flag is selected, this is the name of the last path_track at the bottom path).

keyvalues.name: Move/Rotate Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed in which func_trackchange travel the whole way up/down (units per seconds).

inputs.name: Trigger
inputs.desc: Trigger the track change.

desc: Influence bots to avoid this region by increasing the pathfinding cost within it.

A door that moves either when looked by a targeted object or when a target object comes near the door.  Behavior can be either based on viewing direction or proximity alone, or on a combination of both.  If inverted the doors behavior will be the opposite.

keyvalues.name: Proximity Distance
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, proximity range over which door will move

keyvalues.name: Proximity Offset
keyvalues.desc: Offset from the target object

keyvalues.name: FieldOfView
keyvalues.desc: If non-zero, field of view over which door will move. The target must then be a NPC/player!

inputs.name: InvertOn
inputs.desc: InvertOn - when set behavior of door is inverted.

inputs.name: InvertOff
inputs.desc: InvertOff - when set behavior of door is normal.

desc: A brush entity that's designed to be used for a rotating player-useable button. When used by the player, it rotates to a pressed position.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the button rotates, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Health (Obsolete)
keyvalues.desc: Legacy method of specifying whether or not the button can be shot to activate it. Use the 'Damage Activates' spawnflag instead.

keyvalues.name: Delay Before Reset (-1 stay)
keyvalues.desc: Amount of time, in seconds, after the button has been pressed before it returns to the starting position. Once it has returned, it can be used again. If the value is set to -1, the button never returns.

keyvalues.name: Distance (deg)
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees, that the button should rotate when it's pressed.

desc:
A moving platform that the player can ride. It follows a path of path_track entities.
NOTE: Build your train so that the front of the train is facing down the X axis. When it spawns it will automatically rotate to face the next path_track on the path.

keyvalues.name: Manual Train Speed
keyvalues.desc: Train Speed is controlled through IO, handles accel, decel times.

keyvalues.name: Manual Accel Speed
keyvalues.desc: Units per second to accelerate to target speed.

keyvalues.name: Manual Decel Speed
keyvalues.desc: Units per second to decelerate to target speed.

inputs.name: SetSpeedDirAccel
inputs.desc: Accel/Decel to the specified speed, as a ratio of max speed. Negative values reverse the direction [-1, 1]

inputs.name: TeleportToPathNode
inputs.desc: Teleport to a destination and stop there. This can be in a new path.

inputs.name: MoveToPathNode
inputs.desc: Start moving to a destination and stop when you get there. This must be in the same path.

inputs.name: LockOrientation
inputs.desc: Lock the current orientation of the train.

inputs.name: UnlockOrientation
inputs.desc: Unlock the current orientation of the train.

inputs.name: SetMaxSpeed
inputs.desc: Set a new max speed for the train.

outputs.name: OnStart
outputs.desc: Fired when the train starts moving in either direction.

outputs.name: OnNextPoint
outputs.desc: Fires continuously every frame when the train is moving to its next destination.

outputs.name: OnArrivedAtNode
outputs.desc: Fired when this train arrives at a node on its path.

outputs.name: OnArrivedAtDestinationNode
outputs.desc: Fired when this train arrives at a destination that was specified by the MoveToPathNode Input.

desc: An entity that turns its brushes into detail brushes. Detail brushes do NOT contribute to visibility in the PVS. World geometry is not clipped to detail brushes, so if you have a small detail clump attached to a wall, the wall won't be cut up by the detail brush. func_detail is great for high-frequency brush geometry that's visual detail only. It is also ideal for reducing map VIS time.
Brush Mortar Turret

keyvalues.name: Shell travel time
keyvalues.desc: How long after the turret fires before the shell impacts

keyvalues.name: Firing start sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound of the mortar firing

keyvalues.name: Incoming Shell Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound of the shell falling on the target

keyvalues.name: Incoming warning time
keyvalues.desc: How long before the shell impacts to play the warning sound

keyvalues.name: Fire time variance
keyvalues.desc: How much variability to add to fire rate (time +-)

inputs.name: FireAtWill
inputs.desc: Allow tank to fire next shot as soon as ready.

desc: A region that fires an output if a portal is placed inside it.

keyvalues.name: Portal pair ID that it detects
Check all portals
keyvalues.desc: Ignore the Group ID and check for all portals.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Turn off detecting functionality

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Turn on detecting functionality

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle detecting functionality

outputs.name: OnStartTouchPortal1
outputs.desc: Fired when the Blue portal is placed intersecting the portal detector.

outputs.name: OnStartTouchPortal2
outputs.desc: Fired when the Orange portal is placed intersecting the portal detector.

outputs.name: OnStartTouchLinkedPortal
outputs.desc: Fired when linked portal is placed intersecting the portal detector.

outputs.name: OnStartTouchBothLinkedPortals
outputs.desc: Fired when both of a pair of portals is placed intersecting the portal detector.

outputs.name: OnStartTouchPortal
outputs.desc: Fired when any portal touches the detector.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchPortal
outputs.desc: Fired when any portal leaves the detector bounds.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchPortal1
outputs.desc: Fired when the Blue portal has left the volume of the detector.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchPortal2
outputs.desc: Fired when the Orange portal has left the volume of the detector.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchLinkedPortal
outputs.desc: Fired when a portal with a linked partner has left the volume of the detector.

outputs.name: OnEndTouchBothLinkedPortals
outputs.desc: Fired when both portals have left the volume of the detector.

desc: A portal brush used to manage visibility in maps. Portals define areas, which are spaces that are connected in the map. Both sides of a portal cannot touch the same area, for example, a doughnut shaped map would require at least two portals to divide the map into two areas. A linear map could be divided into two areas with a single area portal.

keyvalues.name: Name of Linked Door
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) The name of a prop_door_rotating or func_door whose open/closed state controls the on/off state of this area portal.

keyvalues.name: Portal Version
keyvalues.desc: (Don't change). Differentiates between shipping HL2 maps and maps using new engine features.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Open the portal. When the portal is open is can be seen through.

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Close the portal. When the portal is closed it cannot be seen through.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the open/closed state of the portal.

desc: A brush entity that spawns sparkling dust motes within its volume.

keyvalues.name: Minimum Particle Size
keyvalues.desc: This value determines the minimum size the particles can be.

keyvalues.name: Maximum Particle Size
keyvalues.desc: This value determines the maximum size the particles can be.

keyvalues.name: Particle Translucency (0 - 255)
keyvalues.desc: Translucency of the particles.

desc: Specifies a region where things cannot be built.

Ladder. Players will be able to freely along one side of this brush, as if it was a ladder. If you are using a model prop for the visual representation of the ladder in the map, apply the toolsinvisibleladder material to the climbable side of the func_ladder brush.
Any visleafs touching this brush will assume they can see each other. Place across large open areas to help reduce compile times. Use sparingly, can create lag if you're not careful!
Fires outputs when the player teleports through a portal in its volume.

keyvalues.name: Fire On Departure
keyvalues.desc: Fire when the entity is entering this portal.

keyvalues.name: Fire On Arrival
keyvalues.desc: Fire when the entity is exiting this portal.

keyvalues.name: Player
keyvalues.desc: Fire when a player has portalled. Entities don't get checked, so this is useless to change.

outputs.name: OnEntityPrePortalled
outputs.desc: Fires when the entity is about to portal.

outputs.name: OnEntityPostPortalled
outputs.desc: Fires when the entity is done portalling.

desc: An entity that works as a rotating/moving platform that will carry a train to a new track. It must be larger in X-Y planar area than the train, since it must contain the train within these dimensions in order to operate when the train is near it. The track will rotate around its own origin. This entity will only allowed to be triggered if the train is on a path_track which is a dead end. If Auto Activate Train flag is ticked, train isn't paused at the top/bottom of the path after func_trackautochange has finished it's movement. Instead, it will continue moving forward and doesn't need to be reactivated by trigger. If selected, the platform only rotates in place of it's origin without travelling specified altitude. The top and the bottom path_tracks should have their origin positioned in the same coordinates.
Combine sentry cannon

inputs.name: DisableHarrass
inputs.desc: Disable the cannon tracking an unseen player

inputs.name: EnableHarrass
inputs.desc: Allow the cannon to track and pester a player who is hiding (DEFAULT)

outputs.name: OnShotAtPlayer
outputs.desc: Fired everytime the cannon shoots at the player

desc: Legacy Support for Half-Life. Use func_brush instead. A general brush entity which can be toggled on/off When off, the brush will be non-solid and invisible. Does not cast lightmap shadows.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the brush on/off. When off, the brush will be non-solid and invisible.

desc: This is a moving target that moves along a path of path_tracks. It can be shot and killed.

keyvalues.name: Speed (units per second)
keyvalues.desc: The speed at which the target moves along its path.

keyvalues.name: Spawn Track
keyvalues.desc: The name of the first path_track entity in the path that this target should follow.

keyvalues.name: Damage to Take
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage taken before this target is killed.

inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Start the target moving.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop the target from moving.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the target between moving and stopped.

outputs.name: OnDeath
outputs.desc: Fires when the target is killed.

desc: An brush built entity with various features.

keyvalues.name: Solidity
keyvalues.desc: How the solidity changes.

keyvalues.name: NPC class excluded from collisions
keyvalues.desc: If an NPC classname is specified here, NPCs of that type won't collide with these brushes. In Episodic, you may also specify an individual entity's name.

keyvalues.name: Invert NPC class exclusion
keyvalues.desc: If set, then the excluded NPC class will consider this brush solid, and all other NPC classes will consider it non-solid.

keyvalues.name: Solid Type
keyvalues.desc: How to calculate collisions. BSP is more rudimentary but allows more stable collision with players.

inputs.name: SetExcluded
inputs.desc: Change the NPC class excluded from collisions.

inputs.name: SetInvert
inputs.desc: Set the state of inversion for NPC class exclusion (0 or 1).

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle visibility/solidity of this brush.

desc: A water brush entity that moves linearly along a given distance, in a given direction. This is identical to func_movelinear.

keyvalues.name: Move Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction the water will move, when told to 'Open'.

keyvalues.name: Start Position
keyvalues.desc: Position of the water brush when spawned.The range is a value between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0 is the starting position and 1 is the starting position + (move direction * move distance).

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the water brush moves, in units per second.

keyvalues.name: Move Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance from the starting point that the water brush should move, in units.

keyvalues.name: Sound played when the water brush starts moving.
Sound played when the water brush stops moving.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Move the water brush to the end position (starting position + (move direction * move distance)).

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Move the water brush to the starting position.

inputs.name: SetPosition
inputs.desc: Move the water brush to a specific position between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0 is the starting position and 1 is the starting position + (move direction * move distance).

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the water brush reaches the end position (starting position + (move direction * move distance)).

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the water brush reaches the starting position.

desc: A brush entity for use as a rotating player-useable door.

keyvalues.name: Distance
keyvalues.desc: The amount, in degrees, that the door should rotate when opened.

desc: A brush entity that's physically simulated.

keyvalues.name: Mass Scale
keyvalues.desc: A scale multiplier for the object's mass.

keyvalues.name: Override Parameters
keyvalues.desc: A list of physics key/value pairs that are usually in a physics prop .qc file. Format is 'key,value,key,value,etc'.

keyvalues.name: Health Level to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Force to Override Motion
keyvalues.desc: If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value on the physbox will enable motion.

keyvalues.name: Strength
keyvalues.desc: Number of points of damage to take before breaking.  0 means don't break.

keyvalues.name: Preferred Player-carry Angles
keyvalues.desc: If the 'Use Preferred Carry Angles' spawnflag is set, this angle is the angle which the object should orient to when the player picks it up, with the physgun or +USE.

inputs.name: Wake
inputs.desc: Wake up this physics object, if it is sleeping.

inputs.name: Sleep
inputs.desc: Put this physics object to sleep. It will wake if given the Wake input, or if force is applied to it. Note that physics objects go to sleep automatically after coming to rest for a while, so you don't really need to use this.

inputs.name: EnableMotion
inputs.desc: Enable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: DisableMotion
inputs.desc: Disable physics motion/collision response.

inputs.name: ForceDrop
inputs.desc: If this object is being carried by a player, with the physgun or +USE, force it to be dropped.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Show this object and allow it to collide, doesn't override notsolid.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Hide this object and stop collisions.

inputs.name: BecomeDebris
inputs.desc: Change the collision to act like debris

outputs.name: OnDamaged
outputs.desc: Fired when this entity is damaged.

outputs.name: OnAwakened
outputs.desc: Fired when this entity becomes awake (collision/force is applied).

outputs.name: OnMotionEnabled
outputs.desc: Fired when motion is enabled due to damage/physcannon/force.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when a player picks this object up, either with the physgun or +USE.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunPunt
outputs.desc: Fired when a player punts this object with the physgun.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunOnlyPickup
outputs.desc: Fired when a player picks this object up WITH THE PHYSGUN. +USE pickups do not fire this output.

outputs.name: OnPhysGunDrop
outputs.desc: Fired when a player drops this object.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player tries to +USE the physbox. This output will fire only if the Generate output on +USE spawnflag is set.

desc: Airboat Gun Turret

keyvalues.name: Name of a prop_dynamic which is the airboat gun model

desc: A rotating brush entity.

keyvalues.name: Max Rotation Speed
keyvalues.desc: The maximum rotation speed of the brushes, in degrees per second.

keyvalues.name: Friction (0 - 100%)
keyvalues.desc: The amount of rotational friction. Value must be between 0 and 100 %. Lower values make the brush speed up and slow down faster.

keyvalues.name: Rotating sound WAV
keyvalues.desc: Sound to play while rotating.

keyvalues.name: Volume (10 = loudest)
keyvalues.desc: The volume of the rotation sound.

keyvalues.name: Blocking Damage
keyvalues.desc: Damage done to any entity that blocks the rotation, per frame.

keyvalues.name: Solid Type
keyvalues.desc: How to calculate collisions. BSP is more rudimentarty but allows more stable collision with players.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed as a ratio of the specified Max Rotation Speed, where 0 is stopped and 1 is the Max Rotation Speed..

inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Start the rotator rotating.

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop the rotator from rotating.

inputs.name: StopAtStartPos
inputs.desc: Stop the rotator from rotating when it gets around to the start position again (on its rotation axis).

inputs.name: StartForward
inputs.desc: Start the rotator rotating forward at maximum speed.

inputs.name: StartBackward
inputs.desc: Start the rotator rotating backward at maximum speed.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the rotator between rotating and not rotating.

inputs.name: Reverse
inputs.desc: Reverse the direction of rotation of the rotator, preserving the current speed.

inputs.name: GetSpeed
inputs.desc: Causes the func_rotating to fire its OnGetSpeed output with its current speed.

outputs.name: OnGetSpeed
outputs.desc: Fired when the GetSpeed input is called.  The current speed of the func_rotating is passed with this output.

desc: A brush entity for use as a player-useable door that linearly moves.

keyvalues.name: Move Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction the door will move, when it opens.

desc: An old entity leftover from Quake. It follows a series of path_corner entities. While mostly made obsolete by func_tracktrain, this entity is not affected by the turning inaccuracy issues that that entity has, and may be more suitable for fast-moving objects.

keyvalues.name: Spawn path_corner
keyvalues.desc: The name of the first path_corner in the train's path. The train will spawn at this path_corner.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed at which the train moves.

keyvalues.name: Movement Sound
keyvalues.desc: The sound to play when the train moves. This must be specified, but can be set to 'Default.Null' to play no sound.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: The sound to play when the train stops moving. This must be specified, but can be set to 'Default.Null' to play no sound.

keyvalues.name: Sound volume (0-10)
keyvalues.desc: Volume of the sounds emitted when moving and stopping.

keyvalues.name: Crush Damage
keyvalues.desc: Amount of damage to deal to entities blocking the train.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle movement

inputs.name: Start
inputs.desc: Start movement

inputs.name: Stop
inputs.desc: Stop movement

desc: Adjusts a portal's rotation to match a specified angle. The 'front' of the portal points in the specified direction. In Portal 2, portals are only reoriented when the entity is sent an Enable input, so this will need to be done every time a portal is placed.

keyvalues.name: Angles to face
keyvalues.desc: The angles to rotate portals to. An easy way to figure out what to set this to is to place a prop_portal, rotate it to the desired orientation, then look at its angles.

keyvalues.name: Match linked angles.
keyvalues.desc: If set, portals placed in this volume will have their angles match their linked portals. This only works for floor or ceiling portals with a linked partner that is on a surface with the same orientation.

desc: Original brush-based health recharger.

outputs.name: OutRemainingHealth
outputs.desc: Remaining Health.

outputs.name: OnPlayerUse
outputs.desc: Fired when the player +USEs the charger.

desc: Brush Laser Turret
A brush entity that's considered solid to vphysics.

keyvalues.name: Filter Name
keyvalues.desc: Filter to use to see if activator collides with me. See filter_activator_name for more explanation. Allow means 'Allow to Block' for this entity.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable this entity.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable this entity.

desc: A region which 'bumps' portals outside of it, but will still allow portals to be placed on it.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn off bumping functionality

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn on bumping functionality

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle bumping functionality

desc:
A moving train that follows a path of path_track entities, shoots at the player, and can be killed.
NOTE: Build your train so that the front of the train is facing down the X axis. When it spawns it will automatically rotate to face the next path_track on the path.

outputs.name: OnDeath
outputs.desc: Fired when the tank is killed.

desc: A occluder brush used to manage dynamic visibility in maps. Occluders are used to dynamically determine what things are behind them, to prevent trying to draw them at all.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Deactivate the occluder, When inactive, it can be seen through.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Activate the occluder. When active, it cannot be seen through.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle the active/inactive state of the occluder.

desc: A shield that stops only bullets.
Influence bots to prefer this region by decreasing the pathfinding cost within it.
A brush entity that tells bots to avoid nav areas touching its AABB.
A brush entity that can be broken from damage, or an input.

keyvalues.name: Min Damage to Hurt
keyvalues.desc: The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount.

keyvalues.name: Physics Impact Damage Scale
keyvalues.desc:
Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility.
Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.

desc: A brush entity that moves linearly along a given distance, in a given direction.

keyvalues.name: Move Direction (Pitch Yaw Roll)
keyvalues.desc: The direction the brushes will move, when told to open or passed a positive SetPosition value.

keyvalues.name: Start Position
keyvalues.desc: Position of brush when spawned, where 0 is the starting position and 1 is the opened position. Negatives will position it in the opposite direction.

keyvalues.name: Speed
keyvalues.desc: The speed that the brush moves, in units per second.

keyvalues.name: Move Distance
keyvalues.desc: The distance from the starting point that the brush should move.

keyvalues.name: Block Damage
keyvalues.desc: The amount of damage to do to any entity that blocks the brushes, per frame.

keyvalues.name: Start Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the brush starts moving.

keyvalues.name: Stop Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when the brush stops moving.

keyvalues.name: Solid Type
keyvalues.desc: How to calculate collisions. BSP is more rudimentarty but allows more stable collision with players.

inputs.name: Open
inputs.desc: Move the brush to the end position (starting position + (move direction * move distance)).

inputs.name: Close
inputs.desc: Move the brush to the starting position.

inputs.name: SetPosition
inputs.desc: Move the brush to a specific position, where 0 is the starting position and 1 is the opened position. Accepts any value, with negatives moving in the opposite direction.

inputs.name: SetSpeed
inputs.desc: Set the speed and update immediately.

outputs.name: OnFullyOpen
outputs.desc: Fired when the brush reaches the end position (starting position + (move direction * move distance)).

outputs.name: OnFullyClosed
outputs.desc: Fired when the brush reaches the starting position.

desc: Legacy support for Half-Life. Use func_brush instead. A general brush entity.
A monitor that renders the view from a given point_camera entity.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle - If on, turn off, if off, turn on.

inputs.name: Enable
inputs.desc: Enable.

inputs.name: Disable
inputs.desc: Disable.

inputs.name: SetCamera
inputs.desc: Sets the camera to use for this monitor. Takes the name of a point_camera entity in the map.

desc: A region which prevents portal placement.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Turn off blocking functionality

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Turn on blocking functionality

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggle blocking functionality

desc: APC Rocket Turret

keyvalues.name: Projectile speed
keyvalues.desc: Speed the rocket will travel at.

keyvalues.name: Burst shot count
keyvalues.desc: Number of missiles to shoot in a burst

inputs.name: DeathVolley
inputs.desc: Fire a burst of rockets cause we're dying.

desc: A brush entity that triggers touch events.
A button which activates after a specified amount of weight is applied.

keyvalues.name: Amount of weight required before this button activates, in KG.

outputs.name: OnPressed
outputs.desc: Fired when the button is touching enough weight.

outputs.name: OnReleased
outputs.desc: Fired when the button was pressed, but weight was removed.

desc: Spawns Combine balls.

outputs.name: OnBallReinserted
outputs.desc: Fired when a combine ball is reinserted into the field (only gets triggered when Combine Power supply is checked)

outputs.name: OnLastBallGrabbed
outputs.desc: Fired when the last combine ball is grabbed from the field by a mega physcannon

desc: Brush Pulse Laser

keyvalues.name: Pulse Speed
keyvalues.desc: How fast does pulse travel

keyvalues.name: Pulse Color
keyvalues.desc: Color of the pulse

keyvalues.name: Pulse Width
keyvalues.desc: Width of the pulse

keyvalues.name: Pulse Life
keyvalues.desc: (Seconds)  How long the pulse lasts

keyvalues.name: Pulse Lag
keyvalues.desc: (Seconds)  How far behind is pulse tail

keyvalues.name: Pulse Fire Sound
keyvalues.desc: Sound played when pulse fires

desc: A brush entity that can block nav areas touching its AABB.

inputs.name: BlockNav
inputs.desc: Starts blocking nav areas.

inputs.name: UnblockNav
inputs.desc: Stops blocking nav areas.

desc: A brush entity that prevents rain and snow from func_precipitation inside its volume.

An entity that can be used to optimize the visibility in a map. If you seal off an area with them, when the viewer moves the specified distance away from them, they will go opaque and the parts inside the area will not be drawn. The window brush should enclose the func_areaportal window so no parts of it are culled by the window. If you use the optional foreground brush, then it should enclose the window brush. Both brush models will have their drawing disabled as the areaportal will render them itself.

keyvalues.name: Rendered Window
keyvalues.desc: The name of a brush model to render as the window.

keyvalues.name: Fade Start Distance
keyvalues.desc: When the viewer is closer than this distance, the alpha is set to 'TranslucencyLimit'.

keyvalues.name: Fade End Distance
keyvalues.desc: When the viewer is at this distance, the portal becomes solid and closes off. If set to zero, the window will always be closed.

keyvalues.name: Translucency limit
keyvalues.desc: This can be used to limit the translucency of the window, preventing it from becoming entirely invisible. This could be used with an opaque material, acting as a window.

keyvalues.name: Foreground Brush
keyvalues.desc: (Optional) brush model that is drawn after the fading brush model. This model should be translucent so you can see through it.

keyvalues.name: Portal Version
keyvalues.desc: (Don't change). Differentiates between shipping HL2 maps and maps using new engine features.

inputs.name: SetFadeStartDistance
inputs.desc: Set fade start distance.

inputs.name: SetFadeEndDistance
inputs.desc: Set fade end distance. If set to zero, this will force the window closed.

desc: A brush with primitive physics that can be pushed around.

keyvalues.name: Friction
keyvalues.desc: This determines the amount of resistance the brush will give when the player pushes it. Range is 0 to 400, where 400 is the most resistance.

desc: This class is the same as func_physbox, except the runtime collisions use a more bouncy method that avoids the prediction errors normal physics objects get.
An entity used to create a volume in which to spawn fire embers.

keyvalues.name: Pitch Yaw Roll (X Y Z)
keyvalues.desc: This entity's orientation in the world. Roll is the rotation around the X axis, pitch is rotation around the Y axis and yaw is the rotation around the Z axis.

desc: An entity used to create a volume in which to spawn bubbles.

keyvalues.name: Bubble density
keyvalues.desc: The amount of bubbles per cycle. Final amount is inputted value plus one. -1 is max.

keyvalues.name: Bubble frequency
keyvalues.desc: How frequent cycles occur. Values include negative numbers to 20, the final time between cycles is 2.5s minus X tenths of a second if positive, or 2.5s plus X tenths of a second if negative.

keyvalues.name: Speed of Current
keyvalues.desc: The speed of the water current in the volume, used to move the bubbles.

inputs.name: Activate
inputs.desc: Activates the bubbles.

inputs.name: Deactivate
inputs.desc: Deactivates the bubbles.

inputs.name: Toggle
inputs.desc: Toggles the bubbles on and off.

inputs.name: SetDensity
inputs.desc: Sets the bubble density.

inputs.name: SetFrequency
inputs.desc: Sets bubble emission rate in bubbles per second.

inputs.name: SetCurrent
inputs.desc: Sets current speed in units per second.
